loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is 65 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 3 adult aged children. 

Tito is engaged in fishing activity for 10 years already and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also doing hog fattening and hog raising. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 2 sacks of feed for his pigs to be fattened. Tito has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Tito hopes to expand his hog fattening and hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of feed

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen previously accessed an 17,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Helen hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

Note: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn money and modified the jeep into a 20-seat jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly Filipino.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 52 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.ru:
Кристина жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 22 лет. Она замужем и имеет 1-ребенка. Кристина живёт со своей семьей в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, она только окончила среднюю школу, и потом сразу её выдали замуж. Муж Кристины также не имеет высшего образования, он занимается работой, которой научился от отца.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Кристина занимается своим делом. Она работает парикмахером  в собственном салоне красоты. Для этого она арендует помещение под салон. Там же находится ее свадебный салон, где она сдает в аренду свадебные платья.  От данного дела она получает хороший доход. Муж Кристины в данный момент находится РФ на заработках.  Сейчас Кристина хочет увеличить количество свадебных платьев для расширения своего бизнеса, так как сейчас начинается тёплый сезон, самое хорошее время для проведения свадебных мероприятий. И спрос на платья очень большой. Поэтому она обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить большой ассортимент  свадебных платьев. Кристина очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Kristina is a cheerful and hardworking woman of 22. She is married and has one child. Kristina lives with her family in a small town. She doesn't have a higher education; she got married right after graduating from high school. Her husband doesn't have a higher education either; he practises the occupation he learned from his father.

Kristina earns a living as a hairdresser in her own beauty salon. For this she rents a space where her wedding dress rental business is also located. She received a good income from this business. Kristina's husband is currently working in Russia and she wants to increase the number of dresses she has in order to expand her business, since the warm season is beginning, the best time for weddings, and there is a lot of demand for dresses. Therefore she has turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase a large assortment of wedding dresses. Kristina very much hopes for a successful outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase wedding dresses for her rental business

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Lang is a 57-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 30 years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband raise cows. Together, they can earn about US$17 per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Lang is just with VisoinFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee in university. She hopes to keep her daughter in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Agus lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Agus is married and living with two people in the family home. 

Agus began working with Ruma one and a half years ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es estudiante de Administración de Empresa, comenta que no tiene un trabajo formal, pero que ayuda  a su mamá en la elaboración de productos de limpieza.
Su anhelo es encontrar una empresa en donde pueda poner en práctica sus conocimientos y así poder tener buenos ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, lo que la ayudará a seguir luchando por poder cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Luisa is a business administration student.  She says that she does not have a formal job, but she helps her mother make cleaning products.

She longs to find a company where she will be able to put her knowledge into practice.  This way she would be able to have better earnings.

She is requesting this loan to make her university payments.  This will help her to continue the struggle to be able to reach her goal.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan está estudiando la carrera de psicología, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá. El al graduarse en su profesión se ve trabajando en empresa pública y así también crear su propia clínica para poder ejercer mejor su profesión. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar su cuota de universidad, y también para cubrir sus gastos de transporte. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Adan is studying for a degree in Psychology, and he is from the city of Carapeguá. Upon graduating in his profession, he plans to work in a public company. He also plans to open his own clinic, to be able to better practice his profession. 

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay his university fees and to cover his transportation costs. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving—to continue fighting for his goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees and transportation costs.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es egresada de la carrera de contabilidad y ciencias contables, con sacrificio ha terminado su carrera y está luchando por poder mejorar su vida a través de su profesión.
Viviana hoy sigue estudiando y quiere estudiar la carrera de didáctica universitaria, que le ayudará a poder enseñar y ser maestra.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando, y creciendo en conocimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Viviana graduated with a degree in Accounting and Administrative Sciences. She made sacrifices to complete her degree, and she is endeavoring to improve her life through her profession. 

Today Viviana is continuing her studies; she wants to study Education at the university, which will help her to be able to teach, and to be a teacher. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay the university fees, and be able to continue studying and increasing her knowledge as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda lives at Capatan with her spouse and child. She is 24 years old. Her spouse is a tricycle driver while she is a hog raiser. They are each involved in a business to sustain the family's daily needs. Though she only gains a minimum amount of about P3,000 per hog disposal, she still manages her business well. 

She is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to invest in their businesses. She will buy feed for the hogs and the other part will be used to pay for motorcycle maintenance. This will help improve the growth of the hogs and a good flow of business for profitable income in return.

loans.use: to buy feed for the hogs and to pay for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Classic Group

texts.en:
Alicia is in her late 20s with a kid who is still a baby. She is single and for a period of four years, she has been making her living by running a poultry business. She has been keeping more than 200 broilers per cycle. Alicia works at her business from 6 am to 9 pm each working day and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans (all of which she paid back successfully) to pay for medical service from a specialist, bought chickens and chicken feeds. She is really doing great with her business.  Alicia dreams that one day she will be able to sell her business internationally. Through your loan support, Alicia will be able to walk towards her dream because she will be able to buy more chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business. With the previous loans she received, Alicia made a profit, which she used to pay for her survival. 

She will share this credit with her group, "Classic", which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 29 years old, married and has two young children. Her spouse is a technician at an Emission Center while she is raising and selling hogs for income. She would like to keep nourishing her piglets; that is why she is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy feed and vaccines for piglets. This will help improve their nutrition and someday she will get better profits when she sells healthy hogs. She will save her revenue for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for piglets.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes  posee un negocio de venta de Granos Básicos y productos varios, en  unos de los mercados de la ciudad de León, se dedica a este negocio desde hace diecisietes   años para  el sustento de su familia ya que es una madre soltera de dos hijos y tiene a su cargo a sus querido  padres.

La señora María Mercedes se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a las 6:00 am y abre su negocio a la 7 am   finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta el mediodía.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de Atún, sardina,  pescado seco y granos básicos con la esperanza de  lograr  mayores ventas   ya que estamos en la época de la semana santa, para obtener mayores ingresos y lograr a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
María Mercedes owns a business selling basic staples and other items in one of the markets in the City of León.  She's worked at this business for 16 years to support her family, as she is a single mother of two children and also takes care of her beloved parents.  María heads to her store at 6:00 in the morning and opens her business at 7:00, closing at 5:30 pm Monday through Saturday, and at noon on Sundays. 

The loan she is seeking from Ceprodel will be used to buy tuna, sardines, dried fish, and staple grains with the hope of achieving greater sales and a higher income so she can succeed in realizing her dreams.

loans.use: to buy tuna, sardines, dried fish, and staple grains

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 49 years old and married with two children. She works as a private employee in a security agency and also has a sari-sari (convenience store) in her residence. Her store is only open in the afternoons due to her work time being divided, but this does not mean her store is not robust. Even though she has been selling from her store for more than six years, it does not generate enough income. For now, she wants to borrow to restock the store with canned goods, soap, milk and noodles. Having more goods to sell would help her earn more income.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, soap, milk and noodles.

location.town: Dipolog-Minaog, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 26 years old and from Olkalou in Kenya. He is married to Irene but they do not have any children at present.

He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last five years. To enable him to buy some planting seeds of maize and beans and some fertilizer, he has applied for his third loan of KES 48,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Right now his monthly income is about KES 20,000 and his plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to buy dairy cows. In the future, he hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy planting seeds of maize and beans and some fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 36-year-old lady who is married, and together with her husband they have four children. She has been doing electronic repairs for the last 12 years. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She would like a loan of KES 70,000 which she will use to purchase spare parts for electronics in order to expand her business. She anticipates that from the expected profits she will be able to open another business. 

She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She hopes and dreams that in the future she will one day have a successful business and family.

loans.use: to purchase spare materials for electronics.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Editha is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra is a 46-year-old, married woman and the mother of three children. 

She has been providing the service of flour grinding in her community with her husband (also shown in the photo). They have gained ten years of experience in this field. In that time, they have become famous for providing fine-quality flour, and they earn enough to support the needs of their family members. 

In order to purchase a new grinding machine, Sughra contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). It would help her to cater to more customers time after time, which would ultimately help in generating more cash. 

She wishes to spend that part of profits on the betterment of her family members. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 53-year-old married woman. She started a small video game shop in her community a year ago. She offers various video games for every type of customer and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy rolls of audio/video cables, with a collection of new games by considering the choice of her customers. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rolls of audio/video cables and a collection of new games.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Siti lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Siti is married and living with two people in the family home. 

Siti began working with Ruma one year ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Meet Sera, a mother of 6. Sera lives in Kisii, a region of Kenya known for banana and tea farming. She has been farming for the past 12 years to make ends meet. She is passionate, caring and hardworking. Nyota (Swahili for ‘star’) is what she named her cow. To make extra income to sustain her family, she holds a job, too. Those who know her attest that she constantly weeds whenever she is at her farm. “Her land stays cultivated and the crops grow healthy,” said a neighbor.

Sera is seeking a KIVA loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She successfully serviced a previous loan she took to acquire a dairy cow, and now she is going for another. She chose a Kiva loan because of the favorable interest terms. The additional income she will generate from the additional cow will offset most of the business related expenses that are crippling her financially today. In the long run, Sera is striving to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Hello guys, meet Jared. He is a father of 3 who has been practising agriculture for the last 15 years in Kisii. He, together with his family, sells milk, eggs and tea for a living. The area is marked with poor roads that make Jared’s life hard in accessing the market. The problem does not end with the roads, as farm produce prices in the market keep fluctuating.

Jared was happy to learn about KIVA. He feels it is an organization that has come to the rescue that meets the financial needs of the people who are marginalized, like himself. Jared is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. The additional cow will increase his asset base and grow his income. Currently, most of Jared’s income is spent paying school fees. With an additional cow, he will be able to generate enough income to repay the loan and use the surplus to attend to personal expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra vive es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, vive con sus padres, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería comercial, con lo que desea poder ayudar a sus parientes. 
Estudia esta carrera porque piensa que le va a dar posibilidades de mayor ingreso y  así poder ayudar a su familia y poder seguir creciendo económicamente. Su familia es gente trabajadora y honesta.
Sandra pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, que le ayudará a cubrir ese gasto que tiene y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in the city of San Ignacio with her parents. She is studying commercial engineering, with which she hopes to help her relatives.

She is studying in this field because she thinks it will give her the possibility of a higher income and thus she will be able to help her family and continue to grown economically. Her family are hardworking and honest people.

Sandra is asking for this loan to pay her university fees. It will help her cover this expense and will be of a great help.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Angel Maria Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no han podido tener. Ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas que día a día están luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La señora Rafaela es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas que sale a vender de forma ambulante. Ella comenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que la venta de prendas usadas es cada vez mejor, ya que es más económico.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas usadas varias, ya que así podrá seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this communal bank work in various activities.  Each one is putting in her best efforts in order to be able to give her family all that they have not been able to have.  They are sacrificing women who day after day are struggling to improve their living conditions.  Rafaela is part of this group.  She works selling used clothing and is a walking saleswoman.  She comments that things are going well because the sale of used products is growing since they are more economical.  

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of assorted used clothing items, since this will help her continue with her sales and to struggle to improve her living conditions and help her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of assorted used clothing items

loans.name: Roth Group

texts.en:
Roth is 29 years old. She is a married woman of two children at Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and her husband is a construction worker. 

Roth is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Roth hopes that she can open a retail shop at home, build a new house and her child can get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Martha Patricia   es madre de tres  hijos y   propietaria de una mini pulpería desde hace 16 años, actualmente también tiene un cafetín ubicado en una de las universidades  de León, ella realiza esta labor  para ayudar a su esposo a los gastos del hogar.   

Doña Martha Patricia,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  en la compra de  zinc, perline, tornillo y mano de obra, para la reparación del techo de su vivienda ya  que se aproxima el invierno.
texts.en: Martha Patricia is a mother of three children and owner of a general store for 16 years.  She now also has a small cafe located at one of Leon's universities.  She works to help her husband with the household expenses.  Martha Patricia got involved with Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy zinc, galvanized steel, screws, and hired labor to repair her roof in preparation for the winter.

loans.use: to buy zinc, galvanized steel, screws, and hired labor to repair her roof

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie previously accessed a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos, which she used to buy dried fish products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in paying for the education of her children and for the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Rosemarie would like to apply for another loan, for 12,000 PHP, to purchase additional stock of dried fish products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosemarie hopes to have more variety of products and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of dried fish products needed in her business.

loans.name: Twigunane Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is in her late thirties and has got two sons and two daughters who are in school. She is married and, together with her husband, thanks Kiva for the life support.

Zainabu has been running a business selling vegetables and small dry fishes (dagga) for fifteen years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. every working day and is able to make fair monthly returns. 

This will be her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Zainabu used the previous loans to grow her business capital by buying missing food items for her business. She bought new stock away from her normal purchases which she believes will maximize her business profit. Zainabu has paid back all loans successfully. She used the business profit to pay their medical expenses and part of the school fees and home food expenses. She will use this loan to buy small dry fishes (dagga) and vegetables to make her business attractive. Zainabu dreams of building a nice business premise. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "TWIGUNANE," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy small dry fishes (dagga) and vegetables to make her business attractive

loans.name: Eufracia Guillermina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Narcisa Del Jesús  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Eufracia, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 23 y 17 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio y es quien aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es chofer y comerciante.
Doña Eufrascia es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su negocio, el trabaja de chofer para la empresa Coca Cola, carga los productos desde la empresa a las grandes distribuidoras de la localidad, pero el también aparte de esto en un carro con la ayuda de personas que trabajan para él, compra estos productos directamente a la empresa o a las distribuidoras y entrega a las tiendas y negocios de la localidad, así el se gana algo extra y les paga un sueldo a dos personas que trabajan con él, ya son 5 años que llevan en este negocio con el cual salen  adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar colas, aguas, energizantes, jugos que distribuye la Coca Cola. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son comprar un camión más grande.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Narcisa del Jesús” meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

Sra. Eufracia lives in this place. She is 46 years old, married, and has two children (ages 23 and 17). Her younger child is in high school and still lives with them. Her husband is a driver and a trader.

Doña Eufracia is a good wife who is a requesting a loan that her husband can use for his business. He is a driver for Coca Cola who transports the products from the company to large distributors in the area. In addition, he has a vehicle that he uses for transporting his co-workers. Eufracia’s husband also buys products directly from the company or from the distributors and then delivers them to stores and businesses in his town. This allows him to earn some extra income and pay the salary for the two people who work with him. He has been in this business for five years and it has allowed their family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy colas, water, energy drinks, and juices that are distributed by Coca Cola. Eufracia has been with the Communal Bank for 10 years and enjoys the help that the loans have given to her. Her dreams include buying a larger truck.

loans.use: to buy colas, water, energy drinks, and juices.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is forty-seven years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Wilma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Wilma has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Wilma is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Ma. Fe is borrowing 23,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Ameeran, age 31, is a married woman. She has been running a business of selling cosmetics for many years. She sells make-up kits, lipsticks, different types of cleansers and lotions, etc. to the people in her community. 

She has a good client list and makes enough to lead a decent life. In order to cater to more customers, she needs to purchase various creams and make-up kits with packs of lipsticks and lip glosses. 

For this she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. She expects an increase in her earnings through her larger sales. She wishes to spend a part of her profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase various creams and make-up kits with packs of lipsticks and lip glosses.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Meet Paul, 25, a young farmer who started in agri-business at the age of 15 to get by. He hails from Kisii, a region of Kenya known for banana and tea farming, where he lives with his wife and child. For a living, Paul sells milk and food crops from his farm into the local market. He makes extra money engaging in other small businesses to take better care of his small family. He enjoys taking care of his child to free his wife to do domestic chores. 

His major challenge is going miles downhill to fetch water for domestic and farm use. To solve this problem, Paul is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank. His plan is to trap rainwater and store it in the tank. The water will be used for domestic purposes, for watering plants and for the cow to drink, too. This will save the family a great deal of trouble and time going to fetch water in the river.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 60 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Edna has been fattening pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en: Ameen is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been dealing with the milk selling business for the past 11 years. At present she has 2 cows and 2 calves. Ameen has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 8th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Ameen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es de la ciudad de Pilar, está cursando el 3 año en la carrera de comercio internacional, comenta que su mayor aspiración es tener un trabajo como despachante aduanero, y de esa forma y por medio de sus estudios ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Vive con sus padres y sus 4 hermanos quienes son su inspiración para poder seguir sus metas y objetivos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cuotas de su universidad, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Gustavo is from Pilar city. He is in his 3rd year of studying international business. He adds that his greatest aspiration is to have a job as a customs officer, and that way through his studies improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

He lives with his parents and 4 brothers whose dreams are to pursue their goals and objectives.

He is asking for this loan to invest it in his university fees, which will permit him to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal PACHACUTEQ DE YANATILE,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quebrada, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Cesar tiene 41 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar de albañil para las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, el socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que el socios saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas como pinturas, brochas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el  crédito otorgado y  se compromete a cumplir con  sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cesar is a member of the Communal Bank “Pachacuteq de Yanatile” which is located in the District of Quebrada in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. He is 41 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. Cesar divides his time between his daily activities and his work as a bricklayer. He works on different projects where his services are requested. Cesar has been in this line of work for a long time and is doing well thanks to the efforts he puts forth each day. He is a responsible person, which demonstrates to the other members that they can work in this manner to support their families.

Cesar is requesting a loan to buy equipment such as paints, brushes, and other items. He is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy paints, brushes, and other equipment.

loans.name: Flor De Invierno Group

texts.es:
Flor de Invierno se formó en la ciudad de Caacupé, con la unión de 18 mujeres, todas ellas muy emprendedoras y luchadoras, que se han unido con el objetivo de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
La señora Lilian es integrante del comité, ella es casada y vive con su familia de manera unida, trabajando en su peluquería, y por medio de su negocio es que ayuda a su familia, para darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le permitirá seguir trabajando.
Lilian pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás, que le permitirá seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Winter flower" was formed in the city of Caacupé, Paraguay and is made up of 18 women.  All of them are very entrepreneurial and fighters.  They have joined together with the goal of helping their families through work and in solidarity.  

Lilian is a member of the group.  She is married and lives with her family - they are very close.  She works in her hair salon, and through her business she helps her family in order to give them all that she was not able to have.  She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving and that it permits her to keep working.  Lilian is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy hair dye, shampoo, rinses, cremes and other items that will allow her to continue giving good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, shampoo, rinses, cremes and other items that will allow her to continue giving good service to her beauty salon customers.

loans.name: Pedro Alfonzo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Alfonzo, es propietario de un negocio en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de León desde hace doce  años, inicia a ofertar sus productos a su clientela desde las  5:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm el realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar es padre de tres hijas.

Don Pedro  solicito este  crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de bloque, cemento, arena, piedrín zinc, y perline para construcción de una cocina en su humilde vivienda, así tener un mejor nivel de vida junto a su familia. 

El sueño de Pedro  es mantener su negocio bien establecido, y  continuar mejorando su vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en: Pedro Alfonzo has been the owner of a business in one of the markets in the City of León for 12 years.  He opens for business at 5:00 in the morning and doesn't close until 5:00 p.m.  He works to provide for his home, as he is the father of three children.  Don Pedro is seeking this credit with Ceprodel to buy concrete blocks, cement, gravel, stone, zinc, and galvanized steel to build a kitchen for his modest home and thus improve his family's quality of life.  Pedro's dream is to maintain his well-established business and continue improving his home, little by little.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement, gravel, stone, zinc, and galvanized steel

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 26-year-old man from Kakamega region, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He is married and supports 3 people in his family. He has been blessed with a child of 3 years.

He has a barber shop, a business he has been doing for the last 4 years, and generates a monthly income of 15,000 KES. Amos has applied for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase more machines and mirrors. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his child and other dependents.

Amos has a dream of having a sustainable source of income and taking good care of his family's health and his child's education.

loans.use: to purchase new machine

loans.name: Terah

texts.en:
Terah is a 39 year old man from Kakamega County which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He is married to Agrifina and together they support their family by providing income. They have five children whose ages are; 14, 12, 10, 8 and 3 years old respectively.

Terah has a retail shop which has been operating for the last 3 years and generates a monthly income of Kes 10900.He has applied for his second loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which he will use to purchase sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to boost his stock.Terah will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business.

Terah's dream is to live a better life and support the needy around him.

loans.use: to increase his stock of shop items

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 57-year-old man from the western part of Kenya in Kakamega county. He is married to Risper, who is also a business lady and they are blessed with three children aged six , three years and three months old respectively.

He has a welding center, a business he has been doing for the last 22 years and comfortably earns a monthly income of KES. 30,000. He is taking his second loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which he will use to boost his business by buying more welding metals. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is to own a shop and educate his children.

loans.use: to add to his stock of metals for welding.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load). Victoria is borrowing PHP 60000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past fourteen loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 30-year-old married lady running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 40,000 which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand from her customers. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support one child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours beyond nightfall.

Evangeline is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Meet Abel, a mixed farmer with eight years of experience in the field. He lives in Kisii, which neighbours Maasai land, together with his wife and two children. 

Abel sells milk and eggs produced by his cattle and hens to the locals at the market. He and his children enjoy milking together as a family every morning before the children head to school. Pests and disease seem to be a common problem among farmers in the region. 

Abel is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase a dairy cow. A huge chunk of Abel’s income has always been used for business-related expenses, leaving a very small sum for his family. He believes, by sacrificing more capital into the business, he will yield a higher income in the future, which will go toward improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kathia

texts.es:
Kathia es estudiante de trabajo social, está en el 2 año, quiere poder terminar su carrera y así poder brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar en el futuro.
Ella es la menor de 4 hermanas, vive con sus padres, y que desearía poder devolverles todo el esfuerzo que hicieron para que ella esté estudiando y poder recibirse y tener su título.
Kathia pide el préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Kathia is studying social work. She is in 2nd year, she wishes to finish her studies and that way be able to improve her family’s well-being in the future.

She is the youngest of 4 sisters, and lives with her parents. She would like to  pay back all of the efforts that they made so that she could be studying , graduate and have her degree.

Kathia is asking for this loan to pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sagrado Corazón de Jesus está en su 5º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una de las integrantes está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a su familia.
Carmen es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy luchadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, que se está esforzando por  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Ella vende joyas variadas para tener un ingreso extra y ayudar así a sus seres queridos.
Carmen pide este préstamo para poder comprar cadenas, anillos, pulseras, y demás joyas para que las pueda vender y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, ayudando a su familia y mejorando su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Sagrado Corazón de Jesus" (Sacred Heart of Jesus) is in its 5th lending cycle with the women's committee program.  All the members have promised to work and help each other so they can all get ahead.  They are doing the "Poverty Stoplight" program, and each member is putting forth her greatest effort to help her own family.  
Carmen is one of the members of this communal bank.  She is a very hard-working woman and, above all, enterprising.  She is working hard to improve her family's standard of living.  Carmen sells a variety of jewelry so she can have an extra income and help out her loved ones.  
Carmen is asking for this loan so she can buy chains, rings, bracelets and other jewelry to re-sell.  With the loan, she will be able to continue with her sales, help her family and improve her small business.

loans.use: to purchase chains, rings, bracelets and other jewelry items for re-sale.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Rosa Mistica está en su ciclo 5to., son mujeres jefas de familia, que se han unido para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido de todas ellas. También forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una persona que se destaca dentro del grupo es la Sra. Laura, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos variados para poder tener un ingreso con el cual ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por poder mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados para la venta, ya que tiene muchos pedidos con los que quiere poder cumplir. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
This group, called Rosa Mistica, is in its 5th cycle. It is made up of women who are heads of house that have gotten together to be able to help their families by way of teamwork from all of them. It also forms a part of the program for poverty elimination, which will allow them to understand the situation of each one and conform it to be able to improve their lives. 

One person who stands out in the group is Sra. Laura, who is dedicated to the sale of various cosmetics to be able to have an income with which she can help her family. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who fights to be able to improve. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase various cosmetics to sell as she has many orders that she wants to be able to complete. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, and it will allow her to continue working and fighting.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Asernal Group

texts.en:
Edina, who is in her late 30s, is a widow with two sons who are still at school.  She has been running two projects, selling clothes and cosmetics.  She has been in her business for four years now.  She works from 8 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Edina's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her clothes stock, started selling cosmetics and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy clothes and cosmetics to meet her customer's demand. She dreams of opening another new business in a different place.

Edina will share this loan with her loan group "Asernal" which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics to meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
A resident of Shikoti, located in the Kakamega region of Western Kenya, Peter is a 43-year-year-old married father of three children who are 12, 8 and 6 years old. He has been a carpenter for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10000.

Peter has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase materials such as timber. He will reinvest the anticipated income in his business. Peter dreams of developing his enterprise in order to better support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 52-year-old lady. She is married and, together with her husband, has been blessed with three children. 

She has been in the weaving business for 20 years. She currently makes an estimated income of 40,000 Kenya Shillings (KES).

She would like a loan of 60,000 KES, through which she will buy beads, string, and other weaving materials. From her expected profit, she will repay her loan and save. 

In the future she hopes to build her family a home.

loans.use: to buy more beads and string to weave more baskets

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Perfecta works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, She also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Perfecta is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle used in her transport business.

Perfecta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle used for her transport business

loans.name: Wilton Alejandro

texts.es:
Wilton siempre ha tratado de salir adelante con sus proyectos y las metas que se propone, por esta razón decidió iniciar con su negocio de reparación y mantenimiento de celulares.
Este oficio lo viene ejerciendo desde hace 6 meses y la experiencia la obtiene luego de haber realizado diferentes cursos en este campo.
Es un hombre con ganas de progresar, por eso alterna esta labor con la del servicio de lavado de muebles que también realiza en algunas ocasiones. En general es un hombre de múltiples ideas y de mente inquieta.
Él solicita un crédito para comprar herramientas que necesita para continuar con la reparación de móviles y además desea comprar una buena cantidad de repuestos, así podrá ofrecerles siempre lo mejor a sus clientes y será oportuno en sus trabajos.
Su mayor sueño es ver su negocio crecer y ser competitivo en este mercado tan concurrido.
texts.en:
Wilton always has tried to move forward with his projects and the goals that he sets. For this reason, he decided to start his own business repairing and maintaining cell phones. 

He has been running the business for the past 6 months, and he is having this experience after completing courses on the subject. He is a man who wants to progress, and for that reason he alternates this work with a service of cleaning furniture, which he also does occasionally. In general, he is a man of multiple ideas and a curious mind.

He is requesting a loan to purchase the tools that he needs to continue repairing cell phones, and also to buy a good amount of replacement parts. In that way, he will be able to offer the best for his customers and be timely with his work. His biggest dream is to see his business grow and be competitive in this crowded market.

loans.use: to buy tools and replacement parts for cell phones.

loans.name: Artan

texts.en: Artan is a hard-worker man. Not only does he operate a pig farming business, but he also sells items such as clothes, towels, lines, kitchenware etc. in the villages. Previously he got help from Kiva lenders to build a stable for the pigs, and so he did. Artan appreciates the Kiva lender's help. Now he is asking for lenders' financial help again to stock up on his inventory of items to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on clothes and houseware items to resell

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es vendedor ambulante, y comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo se ha abierto camino. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder comprar vacas para la venta de leche y queso que el hace.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una vaca, para que siga con su trabajo. agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Anastacio is from the city of Carapeguá. He is a street vendor, and says that with a lot of sacrifice and effort, he has made his way. He says that he used his previous loan to be able to buy dairy cows to sell milk and cheese that he makes. 

Now, he is asking for a new loan to be able to invest in the purchase of a cow, so that he may continue with this work. He appreciates the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy a cow to make cheese and to sell milk.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo esta luchando por poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo ha invertido en la compra de ropas y cosméticos para la venta.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos y seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mercedes is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person who through a lot of effort and strength is striving to provide her family with all she couldn't have. She comments that with the previous loan she invested in buying clothing and cosmetics for resale. Today she is requesting a new loan to buy cosmetics to continue with her sales.  She is striving to improve the living conditions of her self and her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry  está en su ciclo número 19º  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo que está unido hace ya bastante tiempo, y que están trabajando por mejorar sus vidas. Ellas también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde por medio de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza van mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Venancia, quien además de ser integrante de este grupo, es la presidenta, y comenta que siempre se esfuerza por poder motivar a sus compañeras a seguir luchando. Por su parte Venancia comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y que se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela, con la cual obtiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que quiere comprar de camisas, pantalones, short, pulóver y demás prendas para poder seguir con sus ventas, y seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Katupyry" group is in their 19th cycle of the Woman's Committee program. They have been together for a long time and are working to improve their lives. They are also active in the Poverty Stoplight program where by means of a survey to eliminate poverty they work on improving their standard of living.

One of the members is Venancia who is also the president. She comments that she always makes an effort to motivate her companions to continue the struggle. For her part Venancia sells a variety of clothing and she has built up a good clientele. She makes the revenue she needs to help her family. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving and wants to buy shirts, pants, shorts, sweaters and other clothing to continue with her sales. And continue to support her family through her efforts.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts, sweaters, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Rory  está en su ciclo número  14º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas gracias al esfuerzo han ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Waltraud, quien se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, por medio de la venta de productos agropecuarios, como ser lechugas, acelgas, y demás tipo de productos que ella misma planta. Es una mujer muy dedicada y que quiere salir adelante es por eso que le está yendo muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para seguir cultivando sus productos, como ser semillas y abonos. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory group is in its 14th cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to move forward. They are taking the eliminating poverty survey, where they all have worked to improve their life conditions. 

One of the group's members is Waltraud, who is improving her poverty situation by selling agricultural products, like lettuce, chard, and other products that she plants. She is a very dedicated woman who wants to move forward, and for that reason it is going very well for her. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to continue cultivating her products, including seeds and fertilizer. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zinatjon

texts.en:
Zinatjon is a young and successful business lady. She began her business five years ago. She grows agricultural products, mainly tomatoes, cucumber, maize etc. She little by little develops her business. 

Her mother-in-low helps her with growing vegetables. Zinatjon is the main provider for the family. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. 

Zinatjon is going to get mineral fertilizers for her land but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani is a hog grower at Capatan. She is 44 years old and married. Her spouse is a tricycle driver. Aside from raising hogs, she also sells Avon products such as cosmetics and perfumes. From her businesses, she usually earns PHP 5,000 each month, spent on electric bills and revolving capital too. 

Leilani had disposed of all her hogs and had insufficient funds left. That is why she is now asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy a hog to raise and feed to sustain it. 

In the future, she hopes to keep improving their profits so she can save for emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy a hog to raise and feed to sustain it

loans.name: Mombasa Group

texts.en:
Rabia, who is in her late 50's, is a widow with six kids and only one of them is still at school.  She has been buying water to decant into her big tank and sell to small scale customers who bring their buckets and basins to collect water. She has been in this business for twenty years now.

This will be Rabia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy water to decant into her tank and to sell to small scale customers.  She dreams of building another house.

Rabia will share this loan with her loan group, Mombasa, which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

loans.use: to buy water to decant into her tank and  to sell to small scale customers.

loans.name: Nancy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 47 años, que toda su vida la ha dedicado a cuidar a sus dos hijas y su esposo, pero siempre con ganas de progresar y salir adelante.
Desde hace 1 año decidió iniciar con su propio negocio al ver la necesidad de aportar y ayudar con los gastos del hogar y su familia, por eso tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de comidas como tamales, morcilla y pulpas de fruta, alimento que son muy típicos de su región.
Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar un enfriador en el cual poner las pulpas de fruta, una olla más grande para los tamales, algunos insumos y utensilios de cocina. Esto le permitirá mantener sus alimentos más frescos y a la orden del día para sus clientes, que en su mayoría son familiares, amigos y vecinos.
Su principal desafío es la situación económica que en estos momentos está atravesando, pero ella confía en su negocio y cree fielmente en que éste le permitirá progresar
texts.en:
Nancy is a 47-year-old woman. She has always worked taking care of her two children and husband, but she always has wishes to progress and move forward. 

A year ago she decided to start her own business upon seeing the necessity of contributing and helping with the expenses of the home and her family. For this reason, she has a business making and selling food like tamales, sausage, and fruit juice, which are all traditional foods in her region. 

She needs a loan to buy a cooler in which to place the fruit juices, a bigger pot for the tamales, and some supplies and kitchen utensils. This will allow her to keep her food fresher for her customers, who are mostly family, friends, and neighbors. Her main challenge is the current economic situation, but she has confidence in her business and truly believes that it will allow her to make progress.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, a big pot, kitchen utensils, and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Chanthyny's Group

texts.en:
Chanthyny is 38 years old and married. She is a resident of the Bovel district of Battambang province where her cassava is grown. She can earn more income via working for others for a fee. She has been involved in the current business for 10 years. 

This is the fourth-cycle loan for Chanthyny and the eleventh loan for her co-borrower. She has fully repaid her past loans with success and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle so that it isbetter than before. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ñepytyvo  está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. 
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona muy alejada del centro y comenta que aparte de ser empleada doméstica, también se dedica a la venta en un carrito de panchos en el que genera ingresos  y trata de ayudar a su familia.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de panchos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Agradece por esta ayuda y oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Ñepytyvo group is in its fifth cycle of the Committee for Women program from the city of Concepcion, located in an area a good distance from the central area and is still growing.  Maria is one of the members and she comes from a distant area and says that she, apart from being a housewife, sells panchos from a cart which, generates income and tries to help her family.

Maria is asking for this loan to buy panchos so she can continue making sales, striving for a better life.  She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy ponchos for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, es empleada en el cargo de Auxiliar Administrativo, y está cursando el cuarto año   de la carrera de Licenciatura en Enfermería.
Lucia está estudiando mucho para poder sobresalir y algún día por medio de sus estudios poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona con muchos sueños y metas y es por ellos que está luchando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto, y seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta gran oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Lucia is a fourth year nursing student and works at the same time as an assistant manager.

Lucia studies hard so that one day she can help her family.  She is a person with many dreams and goals and is working toward them.

She is asking for this loan to pay her tuition and be able to cover that expense and continue studying as she has been doing.  She is grateful for this great opportunity.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras se llama este grupo que está en su ciclo número  28, es un grupo muy antiguo que viene trabajando de manera unida, y que han ido mejorando gracias al trabajo en conjunto. Son 15 las integrantes, pero solo 13 de ellas retiran el préstamo en este ciclo, por lo que en la foto aparecen 14 personas. Este grupo tambien forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hilda, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y  por medio de su trabajo en su pequeña despensa ha ido mejorando. Hilda es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para la venta en su despensa, como ser carne, bebidas, verduras, enlatados, panificados y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos con lo cual podrá ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" is the name of this group who are in their 28th cycle. They are a very old group and have come along working in a united manner. They have improved thanks to their collective efforts. There are 15 members in the group but only 13 are participating in the loan this cycle. 14 members appear in the photo. The group also participates in the Elimination of Poverty program.

Hilda is one of the members and in the last survey she rated a level 3. Which is to say through her effort and continual work and through the work she does in her small store, is progressing. Hilda is a very demanding woman and a fighter. She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of supplies to sell in her store, like meat, drinks, vegetables, canned goods, pastries and more. Then she can continue with her sales and striving to improve her income so she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, vegetables, canned goods, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Maria Auxiliadora, está en su ciclo número dos del programa de comité donde todas están trabajando y se ayudan por salir adelante. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, donde  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas.
Beatriz es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de calzados y prendas varias, y por medio de este trabajo está ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con sacrificio y esfuerzo está ayudando a sus seres queridos para poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar calzados varios y también de prendas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Maria Auxiliadora”, and it is in its second cycle of the Communal Bank Program, where all are working and helping one another to move forward. This communal bank is from the city of San Lorenzo, where the members’ main goal is the development of each one of them, not just economically, but personally. 

Beatriz is part of this group. She sells footwear and various types of clothing, and by means of this work she helps her family and her loved ones. She is a very hardworking woman, who with sacrifice and effort, is helping her loved ones to be able to move forward. 

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase various types of footwear and clothing, as this is the way that she will be able to continue working and fighting to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase various types of footwear and clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas; está en su ciclo número  1  del programa de comité, es un grupo nuevo que esta con muchas ansias de poder capacitarse y poder de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias.
Delia es parte de este grupo, donde ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio su trabajo en la venta de cosméticos está luchando por mejorar un poco las condiciones de vida de sus seres queridos. Es una mujer que tiene muchas metas, por las cuales está luchando.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos de variadas clases, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes. Delia es una mujer muy entusiasta y que quiere seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Unidas (United Women) is in its first cycle of the committee program. It is a new group that is eager to be able to train and in that way improve the life conditions of their families.

Delia is part of this group. Through her efforts and continuous work, and through her work selling cosmetics, she is fighting to improve the life conditions of her loved ones. She is a woman with many goals, which she is working for. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy various supplies, since she has many orders and wants to be able to fulfill them for her customers. Delia is a very enthusiastic woman who wants to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
Santa Clara se llama este grupo que está en su 5º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias a las capacitaciones y al trabajo en conjunto están mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una persona que se destaca por su trabajo es la Sra. Celia, quien se dedica a la venta de quesos varios que ella misma trae y vende. Comenta que gracias a la venta de este producto está luchando por mejorar las condiciones de vida y de su familia, y dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Celia pide este préstamo para poder comprar más quesos, y que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella sueña con poder tener un negocio más grande que le permita seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called "Santa Clara," is in it's 5th lending cycle with the women's committee program.  They are also participating in the "Poverty Stoplight" program, where, thanks to the trainings and the members working together, they are improving their standards of living. 
One person who stands out for her work is Sra. Celia, who makes her living selling a variety of cheeses.  She, herself, buys and re-sells the cheese.  She says that thanks to the sales of this product, she is working to improve her standard of living and that of her family.  She is trying to give them everything that she wasn't able to have. 
Celia is asking for this loan so she can purchase more cheeses.  This will allow her to continue with her sales, as she is doing.  She hopes to have a bigger business, which would allow her to continue helping her family through her work.

loans.use: to purchase cheese for re-sale.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Katupyry está integrado por 14 mujeres, todas ellas mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación en la que cada una está y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Beatriz, quien cuenta que realiza manualidades, que ella misma hace y que sale a vender de manera ambulante. Beatriz es una persona muy dedicada a su familia, por quienes está luchando para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
La Sra. Beatriz pide este préstamo para la compra de  insumos   para  su negocio y para poder hacer sus manualidades, como ser telas, hilos, botones, y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry group is made up of 14 women, and all of them are very hardworking and above all, enterprising women. They are doing a survey about the elimination of poverty to be able to better understand the situation in which each woman is in, and to be able to improve their lives accordingly.

One of the members is Beatriz. She says that she makes handicrafts and then leaves to sell them by traveling to different neighborhoods. Beatriz is a person who is very dedicated to her family. She is fighting for them, to be able to give them everything that she could not have, and so that they do not have to want for anything. 

Beatriz is requesting this loan to buy the supplies for her business and to be able to make her handicrafts. These supplies include fabrics, threads, buttons, and others, which will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, and other materials.

loans.name: Mujeres De Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres de Santa Inés está en su 1º  ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gregoria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, lo que quiere decir que se encuentra en un nivel medio, pero a través de las capacitaciones podrá ir mejorando y creciendo. Gregoria se dedica a hacer comidas, que ella misma prepara y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, y por medio de su trabajo ha ido ayudando a sus seres queridos. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, pollo, condimentos, panificados y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende, y así seguir creciendo en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres de Santa Inés is in its first cycle of the program of the women's committee, where they are doing the survey of poverty elimination, in order to be able to help their loved ones and improve the life conditions of their families. 

One of the group's members is Gregoria, who in showed a level 2 of poverty in the survey, which means that she is at a medium level. Through the trainings, she will be able to improve and grow. Gregoria works making food, which she prepares and then goes out to sell door-to-door. Through her work, she has helped her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments, baked goods, and other supplies to be able to continue making the food that she sells, and in that way to continue growing her micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments, baked goods, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fátima está en su ciclo número  8º  del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo que todas vienen haciendo están mejorando su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cristina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres es decir que ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida y de ingresos a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo. Cristina tiene un comedor en el que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que prepara.
La Sra. Cristina Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de  insumos y productos varios para  su negocio, lo que le ayudará a seguir trabajando y deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
The group Virgen de Fátima is in its eight cycle of committee programs, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead.  They are doing a survey concerning the elimination of poverty, where thanks to the work everyone together, they improve the quality of life.  

One of the members is Sra. Cristina, who, in her last survey, indicated a poverty level at level three, meaning that she has improved her living conditions and income through effort and continuous work.  Cristina has a restaurant she works at early every day, delighting her customers with the delicious food she prepares.  Sra. Cristina is requesting this loan in order to purchase ingredients and various products for her business which will help her continue working and delighting customers with the tasty food she makes.

loans.use: buy ingredients and various products to make food.

loans.name: Muhtasar

texts.en: Muhtasar was born in 1960. She is married and has three children. She has successfully run a business for four years. Muhtasar produces plastic doors and windows. She has her own organization which employs some workers. Her husband helps her with managing the business. From the profit of her business, Muhtasar little by little improves her living conditions. Muhtasar is asking for a loan of 5,000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy raw materials for making plastic doors and windows. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for producing plastic doors and windows.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
