El grupo Rosa Mística está en su ciclo número 4, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que están esforzándose más para poder mejorar su vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys, quien entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas, también se debe destacar el arduo esfuerzo que ella hace para poder superar su pobreza. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia por quienes está luchando.
La Sra. Gladys solicita de este prestamo para la compra de ropas para damas y niños, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosa Mística" (Mystic Rose) is in its 4th lending cycle.  The members are participating in the "Poverty Stoplight" program.  Three of their members fall below the poverty line, which is to say that they are working even harder to improve their lives.  
One of the members of the communal bank is Sra. Gladys who, among the work she does to make a living, sells clothing.  It's also worth mentioning how hard she works to get past her poverty.  She is a woman who is very dedicated to her family, for whom she works so hard. 
Sra. Gladys is requesting this loan so she can purchase women's and children's clothing, which will allow her to solidify her business plan and help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase women's and children's clothing for re-sale.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre Renacer  se encuentran en el 9no. Ciclo del programa cuenta con 19 integrantes actualmente, es un grupo que  tiene como prioridad la práctica de la responsabilidad, solidaridad, ayuda mutua entre ellas. Todas son mujeres muy luchadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Amada de 42 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración de ropas desde hace varios años, la venta de sus productos lo realiza por toda la zona de Paraguarí, esta actividad es realizada  por todos los integrantes de la familia,posee su taller de costura en su casa.
Amada pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus confecciones, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por su familia y sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group is named Renacer and is in its 9th cycle of the program. It currently has 19 members. It is a group that has as a priority the practice of responsibility, solidarity, and mutual help among the members. All of them are very determined and entrepreneurial. 

One of the stories worthy of highlighting is that of Amada. She is 42 years old and has worked making clothes for several years. She sells her products throughout the city of Paraguarí. All members of the family help her in this activity. She has a sewing workshop in her home. 

Amada is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, fasteners, and other supplies to be able to continue making her products, and in this way to be able to continue fighting for her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, fasteners, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny, 48, is married with three dependent children who are all still in school. His family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in the Battambang province’s Bovel district. The main sources of his family’s income are farming rice and working for others. He has been running his business for 20 years, earning about KHR 80,000 per day. He is able to save about KHR 40,000 each day. 

Ny received his first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, three cycle ago and has effectively used it to sustain his family’s business, support his family’s needs and save some money from the earnings for the future. He is now leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sattor

texts.ru:
Саттор жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 56 лет. Он женат и имеет 4-их детей, из которых один на его иждивении, а остальные уже взрослые и живут отдельно. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Саттор живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он имеет высшее образование, но в данный момент не работает по специальности. Жена Саттора не имеет образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Саттор занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Саттору в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Саттор хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Саттор очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Sattor is a cheerful and hardworking man of 56.  He is married and has 4 children, one of whom still lives with him, and the rest of whom are grown and live independently.  He first turned to Arvand when he found out that there was a possibility to receive financial support.  Sattor lives with his family in a rural area.  He has a higher education, but right now is not working in his speciality.  Sattor's wife does not have an education because her family's financial problems precluded her from studying at university.  She is a homemaker and does household chores and raises the children.  In order to have money to take care of his family, Sattor runs his own business fattening and selling cattle.  He receives a good income from this job.  He wife also helps with Sattor's work by selling milk from the cows.  Sattor hopes to increase the number of cattle in his herd in order to expand his business.  He thus turned to Arvand in the hopes of receiving a loan to buy cattle.  Sattor is hopeful for a positive outcome, and thanks Arvand in advance for it support.

loans.use: to  buy cattle

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap, 38, is a married mother blessed with one child who is in school. For her family, cassava farming and her paid job are the main sources of income. She has had this business for 10 years. This is not the first loan Pheap has taken with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The positive impact of her previous loan has enabled her to improve her lifestyle. For this cycle, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion of 1,200,000 KHR to pay for plowing fees and labor costs. She strongly believes that she can gain twice as much as before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and labor costs

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El Sr. Gregorio está casado, también tiene hijos, es macatero (vendedor ambulante) de todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, calzados y demás, tiene una motocicleta y un automóvil los cuales usa para poder visitar a sus clientes por todas las zonas aledañas.
También tiene cultivos diversos de productos agrícolas y también tiene animales vacunos y porcinos. Cuenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido mejorando y ayudando a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas y calzados varios, que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio is married and has children. He is a street vendor and sells all types of products, like clothing, shoes, and more. He has a motorcycle and a car which he uses to be able to visit his customers in all of the bordering neighborhoods. 

He also has diverse agricultural crops, cattle, and pigs. He says that with much sacrifice and effort he has helped his loved ones through his work. 

He is asking for this loan for the purchase of clothes and various shoes, which will allow him to continue with his sales, fighting to improve his income and help his family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and various shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo is a hardworking woman who always works for well-being of her family. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Marhabo began her own business of selling clothes 10 years ago. Little by little, she gathered a wide assortment of her goods. Now, she also sells and rents wedding dresses in her own shop. Marhabo is going to increase her working capital to offer her clients new fashions of dresses. She is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy additional wedding dresses. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy wedding dresses

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia es un grupo que forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, con la cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a ello poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una.
La Sra. Sonia es una de las integrantes, que además es la presidenta del grupo, es una mujer muy luchadora, que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante y también siempre trata de poder ayudar a su grupo, incendiándolas. Sonia vende prendas variadas, y es por medio de este trabajo que ella lucha para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Sonia solicita este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia is a group that forms part of the Elimination of Poverty Program, where everyone is completing the Elimination of Poverty Survey, with which they will be able to gain insight into their individual situations, and be able to improve the living conditions of each one of them accordingly.

Señora Sonia is one of the members, and she is also the president of the group. She is a woman with fighting spirit, who with sacrifice is moving forward; and she is always striving to be able to help and inspire her group. 

Sonia sells various types of clothing; and by means of this work she fights to be able to help her family and her loved ones.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of various types of clothing to sell, which will help her to implement her business plan; and this will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase various types of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ham's Group

texts.en: Ham is 46 years old, a widow and mother of four children. Her main source of income is from two hectares of rice crops. It is the business that she has had for several years and it has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. This is the ninth loan for her and fifth loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her past loans, which have enabled her to improve her lifestyle. For this cycle, she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay a plowing fee and to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee and to buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly, a villager from Bovel district of Battambang province, is 53 years old and a mother of seven children. To support her family, rice cropping & cassava farming are the main sources of income. She has worked in this business for 10 years, earning about 33,000 KHR per day. This is the fourth loan for Ly and sixth loan for her joint borrower with Kiva's partner VisionFund, all with a successful repayment. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before. For this cycle, she is applying for 1,200,000 KHR while her joint borrower is seeking for 200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crops. She highly believes that she can gain double the crop yield than before.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Mujeres Humildes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Humildes forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están luchando por mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Evangelista, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta en su despensa está luchando por mejorar su vida.
Ella comenta que por medio de su despensa está luchando por su familia y por sus seres queridos. También comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio,  pero que poco a poco ha ido creciendo y mejorando su vida de esa forma.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, enlatados, y demás productos, con los que podrá surtir su negocio y seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Humildes" group forms a part of a poverty elimination program, where everybody is fighting to improve the living conditions of their families. One of the members is Señora Evangelista. Her latest survey indicated that she was at a stage 2 poverty level. Through her effort, hard work, and the through the sales from her grocery store, she is fighting to improve her life. 

She commented that through her grocery store, she is fighting for her family and her loved ones. She also commented that she began with a very small business, but little by little it has grown and improved her life. She asks for this loan to be able to buy vegetables, fruits, canned foods, and other products that she can use to stock her business and continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, canned foods, and other products

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom comes from Tajikistan. She lives with her parents. Dilorom is not married. She is very industrious woman. Dilorom began working in animal husbandry, but she only made a small income from that business, so she changed her business to sewing. Dilorom sews national woman dresses. She has been in this business for 5 years and has her own workshop. She is going to use the money from her loan to buy fabrics because she needs a variety of fabrics for sewing national women's dresses. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy fabrics for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for increasing working capital

loans.name: Nadiuska

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal PACHACUTEQ DE YANATILE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quebrada, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Nadiuska tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de heladería, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su mama, la socia elabora helados de diferentes sabores como platano, mango entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia  solicita el crédito para la compra de  frutas para su negocio de helados.
La socia se siente agradecido por el  crédito otorgado y  se compromete a cumplir con  sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Nadiuska is a member of the Communal Bank “Pachacuteq de Yanatile” which is located in the District of Quebrada in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. She is 30 years old, single, and divides her time between her daily activities and her ice cream business. Nadiuska works with her mother. She produces ice cream in different flavors, such as banana and mango. Nadiuska has been in this business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. She wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits for her ice cream business. Nadiuska is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Rinalyn

texts.en:
Rinalyn is 33 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee, sugar, spices, etc. to sell.

Rinalyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming sugar cane.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee, sugar, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 31 years old, has a five year-old child and is pregnant. Recently, her spouse died. Jesusa doesn't want to stop making a better future for her children, which is why she still manages her hog-raising business though she is already widowed. Jesusa joined ASKI and asked for loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs. It will help sustain the needs of her hogs for good growth and nutrition. 

Someday, Jesusa hopes to become a succesful entreprenuer and will continue making a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Bunthoern's Group

texts.en:
Bunthoern is aged 63 and married. He has three children. Living in a village of the Bovel district, Bunthoern has been growing cabbage and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for five years, he manages to earn about 50,000KHR per day to feed his family and children. 

Bunthoern has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped him better support his family. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Blanca Myriam

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer con amplia experiencia en el área de la confección, ya que prácticamente ha trabajado toda su vida en distintos talleres y fábricas. Ella vive con sus hijos a los cuales ha tratado de darles todo lo mejor.
Ella trabaja como independiente desde hace cinco años, tiene un taller de confecciones en la parte de atrás de su casa en el cual fabrica uniformes escolares, camisetas, entre otros. Adquirió algunas máquinas de confección y con estas se ha ido desenvolviendo en este medio de la costura.
Su principal meta es agrandar su taller, conseguir más proveedores y aumentar sus clientes.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar una maquina fileteadora para reemplazar otra que está muy antigua y en muy mal estado, esto le ha ocasionado muchos retrasos en sus pedidos.
Ella confía en que con la nueva máquina podrá aumentar su volumen de producción y ventas, esto impactara positivamente sobre sus ingresos y podrá seguir sosteniendo a sus hijos y darles la mejor educación.
texts.en:
Blanca is a woman with broad experience making clothing and has done this practically all of her life in various workshops and factories.  She lives with her children for whom she works to provide the best.

She works independently and has for five years.  She has a workshop in the rear of her home and makes school uniforms, t-shirts, and other things.  She acquired some sewing machines and has been working in this type of sewing.

Her main goal is to grow her workshop, find more suppliers, and increase her number of customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy a filleting sewing machine because the one she has is very old and in bad shape, which has caused her many delays in filling her orders.

She is confident that this new machine will allow her to increase her production and sales.  This will have a positive impact on her income and she will be able to continue supporting her children and provide them with an education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Roque, está en su noveno ciclo  dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas ellas se han comprometido a  trabajar y a realizar actividades para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo, que es la de ayudar a sus familias.
Teresa es una mujer muy trabajadora, quien se dedica a la venta ambulante de leche. Comenta que todos los días empieza su jornada muy temprano, ya que siempre quiere poner su producto a primera hora para el desayuno de sus clientes. Quiere poder mejorar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de leche, lo que le permitirá seguir con su negocio y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named San Roque is in its ninth cycle within the women's committee program, where all the women have promised to work and carry out tasks to reach the common objectives that they have within the group, which is to help their families.

Teresa is a very hard-working woman, who makes a living selling milk in the street. She mentions that she starts each day very early, since she always wants to put her product out first thing in the morning for her clients' breakfast. She wants to be able to improve her business and continue growing. She is asking for this loan to buy milk, which will allow her to continue with her business and carry out the requests of her clients.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Bikhodjal

texts.en:
Bikhojal, a 60-year-old widowed mother of four, was one of the best pupils in school, but did not have the opportunity to enter university to achieve higher education. Bikhojal has been weaving carpets for more than 22 years, and earns additional income by selling dried fruits. Her daughter-in-law helps to manage her business.

 Bikhojal is now requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy more dried fruits. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a young and industrious woman. She is 23 years old. She is married and brings up 2 little children. Her children are 5 and 3 years. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. 

Aziza learned sewing of national women's dresses in her parents' house. Aziza has been involved with sewing business for more than 5 years. She has 3 sewing machines and tries to provide high quality service to her clients. Now, Aziza is going to buy an embroidery machine. She is requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni to buy the embroidery machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Kiranzi Development Savings & Credit Ass Group

texts.en: Josephine is a 36 year old lady living in Kagadi-Uganda with three children aged 15, 14 and 8, with only 2 attending school. She has operated a retail shop since 2009 and has been involved in farming to supplement her income. She hopes to educate her children and also grow her business in spite of competition.  Josephine intends to use the loan to buy beans, maize and ground nuts to sell. She is a member of Kiranzi Development Savings and Credit Association where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy  beans, maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Sean's Group

texts.en: Sean is a young mother of two kids who are in school. She is a villager from Bovel district of Battambang province where her cash-crop is grown and pig-raising business is run. She has been involved in the current business for several years. This is not the original loan for Sean with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and her living condition is getting better than before. For this cycle, she is a leader of a group consisting of seven borrowers. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay a plowing fee, to buy rice seeds and to buy fertilizer. She strongly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee, to buy rice seeds and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Loek's Group

texts.en: Loek is 52 years old and a villager from the Bovel district of Battambang province. She makes a living via cassava and rice farming as the main source of income. She has been  in her current business for years with a decent income in return. Loek and her co-borrower are in their fourth cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava, to pay a plowing fee, and to buy rice seeds. She strongly believes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: To buy cassava, to pay a plowing fee, and to buy rice seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en: Natasha bought pesticides for her plants previously, and she very much appreciates the kindness that lenders showed to her. Now she is seeking their financial help again, but this time to invest in her family's poorly built house.

loans.use: to invest in her poorly built house

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian tiene 33 años, está casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, ella es docente desde hace varios años, también su marido se dedica a la enseñanza.
Quiso estudiar otra profesión por eso está estudiando la carrera de Derecho ya que quiere ser profesional y docente de dicha rama, dice que es lo que le gusta y está inculcando a sus hijos que con esfuerzo pueden obtener grandes logros. Solicita el préstamo pues en el último año los gastos son mayores, y quiere poder cubrir su cuota y matricula. 
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en: Lilian is 33-years-old, married, and has two school-age children. She has been a teacher for several years and her husband also makes a living through teaching. She wants to study another profession she is studying law. She would like to become a lawyer and teach law. She says that this is what she wants and she is showing her children that with effort, they can achieve their goals. She asks for this loan because in the last year, her school fees have increased and she wants to be able to cover the full tuition amount. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving that will allow her to continue growing and fighting.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition and school fees

loans.name: Safaroy

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Сафарой. Ей 48 лет. Она уроженка района Вахш вблизи городка Курган-Тюбе. Сафарой милая, добрая и приятная в общении женщина. У нее большая и дружная семья. С ней живут трое сыновей и две дочки. Сафарой более 12 лет занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, земледелием. На участке земли Сафарой выращивает арбузы, дыни и пшеницу. Сейчас настал для посева очередного урожая. В этом году для приобретения запланированной количество семья и минеральных удобрений у Сафарой не хватило суммы денег, и она решилась обратиться за кредитом. Она надеется найти поддержку, чтобы во время закончить посев.
texts.en: The woman in the photo is Safaroy.  She is 48 and hails from the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan, which is not too far from the town of Kurgan-Tyube.   Safaroy has a large, close-knit family; she lives with her three sons and two daughters, and is a kind woman who is pleasant to talk with.  For more than 12 years, she's been working as a farmer, growing watermelons, honeydew melons and wheat.  It's currently time to plant seeds for the next harvest, but Safaroy lacks the money to buy the necessary seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She's seeking a loan to that end, and is counting on your help to be able to finish sowing her fields.

loans.use: buy mineral fertilizers, melon seeds and wheat kernels

loans.name: Zinatpocho

texts.en: Zinatpocho is very ambitious woman. She is a careful mother of three children. Her husband is an immigrant in Russia. Five years ago Zinatpocho organized a group of thirty women. They serve as rental workers to farmers. They sow, collect the harvest and do other land work. They work with high quality so they have regular clients. Zinatpocho is a leader of this group. Zinatpocho also has a green house. She grows tomatoes and cucumbers there. Now, Zinatpocho wants to repair her green house. She is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to buy building materials such as wood, cellophane, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood, cellophane, etc

loans.name: Leidith

texts.es:
Leidith es madre de 2 hijos a los cuales adora con todo su corazón y vela para que no les falte nada.
hace 2 años decidió iniciar junto a su esposo un negocio en el cual pueda ofrecer productos básicos de la canasta familiar, pero en estos momentos sus ventas han disminuido mucho por la falta de productor y variedad. Por esta razón ella pide una ayuda económica para comprar surtido y volver a tener el mismo volumen de ventas que tenia hace algún tiempo.
Ésto le permitirá recuperar los clientes que ha perdido y podrá ofrecerles mas variedad y calidad en sus productos.
Su mayor anhelo es poder acreditar su negocio y olvidar este vacío económico por el que actualmente esta pasando.
texts.en:
Leidith is the mother of two children whom she loves with all her heart, and she makes sure that they lack for nothing.

Two years ago she decided to start a business with her husband, selling basic food basket products, but now her sales have been greatly diminished due to a lack of products and variety. For this reason she is requesting economic help in order to purchase merchandise and regain the same sales volume that she had some time ago. This will allow her to win back the customers that she has lost, and she will be able to offer them a greater variety of quality products. 

Her biggest desire is to be able to stock her business and put this economic void that she is currently passing through behind her.

loans.use: to purchase a range of basic food basket products in order to have inventory in her store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Meet Joseph who is in his 30s and from Masuba in Sierra Leone. He is married and has one child. In 2010, Joseph established his clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant. He works at the business from 7:00 AM until 7:00 PM, six days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is poor business location, and during the rainy season, sales are slow.

Joseph requires a loan to buy more shoes, jeans, and clothing material for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living and to increase his business. In the future, Joseph plans to build a permanent business place. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, jeans, and clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, hooks, glue and foam.

loans.name: Mandela Grp Bnd Group

texts.en:
Kinanda is a businessman who makes his life by managing a shop selling home products. He has been in this enterprise for ten years and is able to make a fair monthly profit. Kinanda is a married man in his early forties. He has six children - two boys and four girls, all of whom are still in school. Kinanda opens his shop from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM per working day. 

Kinanda is a member of Mandela Group, which has five people who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. From Tujijenge in Tanzania, this will be Kinanda’s first loan, which he will use to replenish his shop with new home products. In the coming years, he would like to open a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with new home products.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 37-year-old man, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop where he earns income for the betterment of his home, alongside a cocoa garden where the yield is sold to increase his profits. He began the business to get profits and to look after his five children. He dreams of expanding his business to a bigger wholesale shop and of educating his children through better schools. He wants a loan to buy sugar, soap, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rattana's Group

texts.en: Rattana, a villager from the Bovel district in Battambang, is 56 years old and married. She has five children in school. For her family, rice farming is the main source of income, while working for others is the supplementary source of income. This is the third loan for Rattana and the first loan for her co-borrower in a group of two. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for rice seed and plowing fees for her crop. She strongly believes that she can gain more income better than before.

loans.use: to pay for rice seed and plowing fees for her crop.

loans.name: Jesika

texts.es: Jesika es soltera no tiene hijos y vive con su padre Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento Jesika se dedica al comercio ambulante y necesita credito para comprar perfumes, máscaras de pestañas y sombras para los ojos. Jesika es colaborada por su padre pero el sueldo no alcanza para cubrir todos los gastos de manutención por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Jesika is single with no children. She lives with her father in La Paz in a house made of brick and cement. She makes a living as a street vendor and she needs the loan in order to buy perfume, mascara, and eye shadow. Jesika is helped by her father but the wages are not enough to cover expenses, which is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy perfume, mascara, and eye shadow to sell

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Oyara Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA OYARA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana ella es conviviente y tiene 45 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos y café y también la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Virgen Asunta Oyara”. This bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, which belongs to the province of La Convención in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Juana. She is 45 years old and has a partner. She has a business which sells and raises animals. She also has a plot of land, where she grows plantains and coffee, and she also breeds guinea pigs and hens, which she fattens up and sells at the different fairs and markets. Juana manages to provide for her children through this small business. Her dream is to have a permanent store where she can sell her guinea pigs and hens. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase guinea pigs and hens, as well as animal feed.

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo obtained permission to have their photos taken after the meeting due to work reasons.

The other members make a living from agriculture, fruit sales, a grocery store, and food sales.

Juana is grateful to those who become part of her dream on this platform and she is committed to making her repayments on the dates stipulated.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, guinea pigs, and hens

loans.name: Lidia Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Lidia Teresa se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambien sigue llevando animales como cuyes,gallinas y patos, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Lidia Teresa continues to work in the grocery store business, and she also continues to handle animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and ducks. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has already had this business for seven years, and it is going very well for her. The dream of this bank member is to expand her grocery store business. She is applying for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers for her store.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con su madre en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino Daniela se dedica a la venta de empanadas y lo hace hasta altas horas de la noche pues tiene que acabar toda su produccion Daniela necesita credito para comprar una computadora, además de trabajar ella estudia  y el equipo le servirá para hacer sus trabajos Los padres de Daniela son separados pero ambos le ayudan, aunque lo que le dan no es suficiente por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Daniela is single. She is 21 years old and lives with her mother in La Paz in a well finished house. Daniela sells empanadas, and she does it until the late hours of the night, since she has to finish all her production. Daniela needs the loan to buy a computer. In addition to working, she goes to school, and the equipment will serve her for doing her work. Daniela's parents are separated, but both of them help her, although what they give her is not sufficient, and for that reason she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her schoolwork

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, es una estudiante muy sacrificada, comenta que su meta es poder ayudar a la gente, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería.
Viene de una familia muy humilde, a la que quiere ayudar por medio de su estudio y su sacrificio. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir sus metas y sus sueños.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases y también para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Ybycuí. She is a very selfless student. She says that her goal is to be able to help people, and this is why she is studying to become a nurse.

She comes from a very humble family, whom she wants to help through her studies and her sacrifice.

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving of being able to continue with her goals and her dreams.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in paying for her classes and covering university fees.

loans.use: to pay for university classes and fees

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de derecho, también está trabajando. Ella vive con su abuela porque su mamá está lejos por cuestiones de trabajo.
Cuando obtenga su título como abogada le gustaría ejercer su profesión y seguir estudiando para poder ayudar a su abuela que siempre la cuido y la acompañó en todo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las matricula de su universidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le permitirá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Juana is in her second year of a law degree and she is also working. She lives with her grandmother because her mother lives far away for work reasons.

When she obtains her law degree, she would like to work as a lawyer and continue studying in order to be able to help her grandmother who has always looked after her and shared everything with her.

She is asking for this loan so she can invest it in paying for university fees. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and that it will enable her to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Los Diamantes De Macamango Group

texts.es:
La socia Marisol pertenece al banco LOS DIAMANTES DE MACAMANGO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de la Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marisol tiene 29 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primer a necesidad como arroz, leche, azucar y también vende golosinas entre otros, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the Los Diamantes de Macamango communal bank, which is in the district of Santa Ana, Convención province, Cusco department.

Marisol, 29, has a partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells basic needs products such as rice, milk, sugar, and she also sells sweets and other items. Also, she works as a farmer. Marisol is a responsible and enterprising woman, which is how she moves her family forward.

Marisol is requesting a loan to buy sugar for her business. She is grateful for this loan and promises to make the planned payments.

loans.use: to buy sugar for her business.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia Leonarda se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Leonarda continues working in her grocery store business. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has already worked in this business for five years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is applying for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers for her store

loans.name: Enmanuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Enmanuel de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, debido a la situación económica de su familia se le hizo difícil seguir estudiando. Esta acompañado y tiene 1 hijo. Su pareja se dedica al cuidado del hogar y nadie mas vive con ellos.

 Enmanuel, desde hace 6 años se desempeña como motorista de un camión, antes se dedicaba a ayudante de albañil. Para llegar donde trabaja hay que caminar unos 20 minutos. Él se levanta a las 4:00 am porque a las 5:30 am tiene que estar haciendo meta con el camión y termina su día de trabajo a las 4.30 pm. Pero dice que lo hace con mucho gusto, pues su deseo es siempre lo mejor para su familia.


El crédito sera invertido para comprar 70 metros de lamina Cincalum. Su deseo es, mejorar su vivienda, ponerle techo nuevo, tener su propio vehículo. Que sus hijos se preparen en una carrera y pagar el crédito para tener siempre abiertas las puertas.
texts.en:
23-year-old Enmanuel studied as far as the ninth grade. His family’s economic situation made it difficult to continue studying. He has a partner and one child. His partner looks after their home and no one else lives with them.

Enmanuel has been working as a truck driver for six years. He previously worked as a bricklayer. He has to walk 20 minutes to get to work. He gets up at 4:00am because he has to be working at 5:30am, and he finishes work at 4:30pm. He says that he likes doing this work, because he always wants the best for his family.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of 70 metres of 55% Al-Zn alloy-coated steel sheets. His dreams are to improve his home by building a new roof, to have his own vehicle, to have his children get a degree, and to pay off the loan so that doors will always be open for him.

loans.use: to buy 70 metres of 55% Al-Zn alloy-coated steel sheets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy children's clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Hasanah

texts.en:
Hasanah runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Hasanah lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Hasanah is married and living with five people in the family home. 

Hasanah began working with Ruma two months ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stationery to expand his business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a fifty-six-year-old married man with nine children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He runs a small restaurant in one of the busiest towns in Bundibugyo, as well as working in cattle rearing and poultry and crop production on his two-acre piece of land. Richard has been in practice since 2009. He has many sources of income, however he faces the difficulty of inadequate capital with respect to his plans to complete his residential house.

Richard needs this loan to buy raw materials like sand and cement to complete his residential house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like sand and cement to complete his residential house

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan is 58 years old, married, with a daughter and two sons. She earns money for the family by selling wedding and holiday dresses. She has been working in this field for 38 years and has good experience. Her monthly income is 200 AZN. Her husband is a farmer. He raises fruits and vegetables and sells them at a local bazaar. This is the way the family gets additional income.

Azerbaijan women like beautiful dresses. They buy or sew dresses for holidays, parties, weddings, etc. Local women prefer to buy dresses in Reyhan’s  small shop, because they can find nice clothing there. 

Reyhan’s income doesn’t cover the family’s needs. Reyhan applied for 1000 AZN in order to buy new and beautiful kinds of textiles and dresses. She plans to sew dresses herself and expand her small business. This is her third loan and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new and beautiful kinds of textiles and dresses

loans.name: Aytajh

texts.en:
Aytajh is a 22-year-old student. She lives with her parents and studies at the university at the pedagogical faculty. 

Education is one of the most important parts of life. People study in order to become professionals in their area and to develop and earn money for life. The pedagogical faculty is also one of the most important faculties, because people there learn in order to properly teach future generations.

Aytajh’s parents raise seasonal vegetables in their garden and sell them at the local bazaar. This is the only source of the family’s income. Additionally, they have to pay for Aytajh’s education, but their income doesn’t cover her educational costs. Aytajh has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN in order to pay for her education. This is her second loan and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to cover her education costs

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
Tunzala is a 52-year-old married woman and she has a daughter. Her husband is a farmer and earns money for the family by raising seasonal vegetables. But the main source of the family's income is Tunzala’s business. She has been selling women's clothing, including dresses, shirts, blouses, and jackets, for 10 years. Her monthly income is 600 AZN.

There is high demand for women's clothing. Women like to put on beautiful dresses for holidays and to wear nice jackets and shirts every day. Working in this business for a long time, Tunzala knows her customers' demands. She knows how to choose and sell her customers nice quality clothing.

Tunzala’s income doesn’t cover her family’s living expenses. She applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN in order to supply new kinds of clothing and to expand her shop’s assortment. She plans to expand her business and increase her monthly income. This is her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to supply new kinds of clothing and to expand her shop’s assortment

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de Derecho y Escribanía. Es una mujer muy dedicada y que quiere salir adelante por medio de sus estudios.
Comenta que su familia la ha ayudado bastante y así ha ido cumpliendo su sueño de crecer como profesional.
Con este Préstamo que pide ella podrá abonar el gasto de sus títulos para poder trabajar en su profesión, y así poder realizarse como persona y profesional.
texts.en:
Aida is from the city of Carapeguá and she is studying law and clerkship. She is a very dedicated woman and she wants to move forward through her studies. She mentions that her family has helped her quite a lot and this way she has been fulfilling her dream of growing as a professional. 

With this loan she is asking for, she will be able to pay for the expenses of her degrees to be able to work in her profession, and this way to be able to accomplish herself as a person and a professional.

loans.use: to pay for expenses of her degrees.

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en:
Marziya is widowed. She is a careful mother of one child. Marziya has a medical education. She works in a maternity hospital as a midwife and she has worked here for more than 10 years. She is a kind and hardworking woman. Marziya likes her job and so she does her job well. 

Now, her brother is ill. He does not have the money to buy medicine. Marziya is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy medicines to treat her brother. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines to treat her brother, who is ill

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a seventy-five-year-old widowed woman with one grandchild living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells ladies' clothes to the people around town in one of the busiest streets. She also has a cocoa garden where she earns income to support her home affairs. Faith dreams of educating her grandchild, who is an orphan, to higher levels of education, but she has limited capital and a poor season for cocoa has affected her dreams.

Faith is very hardworking and wants a loan to buy women's clothes to sell in her business.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda was born in the 1992. She is married and does not have any children yet. Umeda has always wanted to be a successful businesswoman. She is going to start a business selling clothes, including women's, men's, and children's clothes. Umeda’s husband will help her with managing the business. She took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ through a women's organization, where she got a lot of useful information for herself. 

Umeda is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy clothes for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
Guldasta is from a rural area. She is a hardworking woman. For 11 years, Guldasta has been busy with an animal husbandry business. She has had good opportunities to develop her animal husbandry business because she lives in a mountainous area. She usually feeds her cattle on the mountain. 

Guldasta is the main breadwinner of her family because her husband is a migrant in Russia. Now, she is going to repair her house because her house is in bad condition. Guldasta is asking for a loan of $1,000 USD to buy building materials as cement, wood, paints, etc. for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
This is Mwanasha. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. Besides the charcoal and coconut-selling businesses, Mwanasha prepares food in a cafe and sells to her customers.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of food ingredients for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food ingredients for her business

loans.name: Carol Maurena

texts.es:
Carol es una joven de 22 años, quien todos los días se viste con el uniforme celeste y blanco de enfermería para poder servirle a los que la rodean. Hace cinco años ella empezó a estudiar todos los sábados, luchando por cumplir su sueño de poseer el título tan deseado de licenciada en enfermería. El espíritu fraterno de esta joven, la ha llevado a entregarse por completo a su futura profesión ayudando de diferentes maneras a la población. 
Carol cuenta con el apoyo moral de su mamá y con la ayuda parcialmente económica de su padre, quien trabaja como médico veterinario, por lo que necesita del préstamo para la cancelación de sus módulos de finalización de estudios. Entre sus metas está sacar una maestría en Gineco-obstetricia, lo que le facilitaría a obtener un mejor trabajo que le permitirá poder tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Carol is 22 years old. Every day she wears a light-blue and white nurse's uniform to be able to serve those around her. Five years ago she started to study every Saturday, fighting to complete her dream of having the much-desired title of a licensed nurse. 

This young person's spirit has brought her to give herself completely to her future profession, helping the population in different ways. Carol has the moral support of her mother, and the partial economic support of her father, who works as a veterinarian. She needs the loan to be able to pay for the final units of her studies. 

Among her goals is to pursue a master's degree in obstetrics and gynecology, which will allow her to obtain a better job which will allow her to have her own house.

loans.use: to pay for the final units of her studies.

loans.name: Nasirrudin

texts.en:
Nasirrudin runs a small stall which sells drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. Nasirrudin lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Nasirrudin is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Nasirrudin began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Cici

texts.en:
Cici runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Cici lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Cici is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Cici began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one school going child. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling second hand clothes via door-to-door selling. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Siha's Group

texts.en:
Siha, 28, is married and lives with her husband and two children in a village in the Bovel district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers and they supplement their family’s income by raising pigs. Siha has been in the rice farming business for seven years, earning about 70,000 KHR per day to feed her family.

Siha’s group consists of three members who all are female. Siha is in her third loan cycle as a client of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully paid back her past loans, which have helped relieve her family's financial burdens and improve their livelihood. Now requesting another loan through VisionFund, Siha, who is the group leader, will use her loan portion to buy piglets and pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Devi

texts.en:
Devi runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Devi lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Devi is married and living with two people in the family home. 

Devi began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Maftuhi

texts.en:
Maftuhi runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Maftuhi lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Maftuhi is single and living with six people in the family home. As seen in the picture: Maftuhi with RUMA’s Agent.

Maftuhi began working with Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is a 43 year-old single woman. She lives with her parents and earns money for the family by raising chickens. She sells eggs, chickens, and hens at the local bazaar. She has been working in this field for 23 years and her monthly income is 200 AZN.

People in Azerbaijan like to use eggs and hen meat for different national dishes. They use these products to cook chighirtma, levengi, etc. Local people buy these products from Kamala because her products are always fresh and of good quality.



Kamala earns a little and this income doesn’t cover her live cost. She applied for 1500AZN in order to buy quality bird crops and repair old coop because it’s in a bad condition. Kamala applies for a loan for the sixth time. She is a responsible woman and has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy quality birds and repair the old coop

loans.name: Doricah

texts.en:
Meet Doricah, 43, is an agri-business entrepreneur from Kisii, an area in Kenya known for heavy rainfall throughout the year. The mother of 4 has been practicing agriculture for the past 8 years. She makes extra money engaging in other personal businesses. She occupies herself weeding and cultivating her land. Her biggest challenges are climate changes and crop/animal diseases.

Doricah, being a poor farmer, cannot access formal financial services from the banks. The banks consider Doricah a high risk client. When she heard of Juhudi Kilimo, she formed a group with other small farmers and joined. She learned about KIVA through training and took the chance. 

Doricah is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She takes good care of the one she has today that she named Nyabaro. She feels she can handle another cow with excellent care.  The additional cow will produce extra milk that will help her meet the high business related expenses. Doricah's plan is to improve the living standards of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is a 48-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo Uganda with his eight children. He has a cocoa garden alongside renting other cocoa gardens to yield more income and get better profits.  He is very hardworking and hopes to complete his residential house and educate his children despite having limited capital and enduring seasonal changes. He needs a loan to pay for the rental of the cocoa gardens and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for the rental of the cocoa gardens and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Sevinjh

texts.en:
Sevinjh is a 36-year-old married woman and has a son and two daughters. The members of the family are refugees and have lived in İDP settlement for a long time. Sevinjh raises seasonal fruits (apples, cherries, pears, etc.) and vegetables (onions, cucumbers, potatoes) and sells these products at a local bazaar. She has been working in this field for 18 years and has good skills. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. Her husband is a laborer and brings the family additional income.

People prefer to buy fruits and vegetables raised in private gardens. They know that such products are always fresh and tasty. They use fruits to prepare tasty fresh juice and buy vegetables to cook different delicious national dishes.

Sevinjh’s income doesn’t cover her family's life demands. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new garden tools, and a variety of fruits and vegetables for resale.  She plans to increase the family’s income and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, and a variety of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, se ha mantenido trabajando de manera ininterrumpida en su negocio gracias a que el crédito anterior le facilito la compra de materia prima, sus clientes, ventas y ganancias son mejores, ha podido cancelar sus cuotas y mejorar la calidad de de vida de sus hijos.
En esta oportunidad se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para reforzar el inventario de los materiales básicos para elaborar la venta de pupusas, comprara aceite, gas propano, bebidas, bolsas, maíz, aderezos, repollo, quesillo, chicharrón, etc.
texts.en:
Sandra has kept working in her business without interruption, thanks to the fact that the earlier loan enabled her to buy ingredients and supplies. Her number of clients, as well as her sales and earnings are better. She has been able to pay her installments and improve the quality of life of her children. 

On this occasion she has made the decision to take a new loan to build up her inventory of the basic ingredients and supplies for making pupusas to sell (pupusas are Salvadoran stuffed grilled tortillas). She will buy cooking oil, propane gas, drinks, bags, corn, dressings, cabbage, soft cheese, roast pork, etc.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, propane gas, drinks, bags, corn, dressings, cabbage, soft cheese, roast pork, etc.

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister is a widowed woman and has five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Wilkister sells small fish and she has been in this business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock of small fish for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of small fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, meat, bitter ball, pepper, onion, and other items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts and peppers for resale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Mohamed from OIC Ropolo, Makeni northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 4 to 20 years. Three of his children are attending school. He was a farmer, but he could not earn enough to sustain his living so he decided to operate a business to improve his standard of living.

Mohamed runs a general stock business.  He sells local food items. He has been running this business since 1992. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Mohamed says that the main challenges to his business is price inflation.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy more bags of rice, beans, and pepper for resale.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful business man and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he plans to expand his business. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, beans, and pepper for resale

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
Meet Lamin. He is a 42-year-old from the OIC Ropolo northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 and 16. His children are currently attending school. In 1999, Lamin established his clothing business. He was trained in this business; he started it to improve his standard of living. He works from 7:00am until 7; 00pm, 6 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business high cost of transportation.

Lamin requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing material for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees and increase his business. In the future, Lamin plans to build a permanent business place. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 28 años de edad, realizo sus estudio en la escuela del cantón, está casado, su paraje se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es quien se encarga del cuidado de sus 6 hijos pequeños y los quehaceres de la casa. 

Él se dedica al comercio de ganado, ya tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre fue quien le enseño a valorar lo que es el trabajo, dándole como ejemplo la vida que él había tenido, donde solo trabajando y cuidando la familia podía vivir tranquilo,  la necesidad y la escases de oportunidades de trabajo en la zona lo llevaron a tomar decisiones, tiene dos actividades, la agricultura y el comercio del ganado, la distancia que recorre es variable ya que no siempre va a los mismo lugares. Nadie más se involucra en sus actividades, el horario de trabajo es de las 6 am a 12 md. 

El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra, hoy que viene la época de invierno, ya que tiene sus animalitos; pero no se quiere deshacer de ellos, por alguna necesidad que se le presente, la necesidad satisfecha será el dar inicio a la preparación de la tierra para la siembra de los granos básicos.  

Su deseo es poder tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en  poder dar inicio a la preparación de las tierras.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old. He studied at the school in his town. He is married and his partner is a homemaker. She cares for their 6 small children and does the housework.

He makes a living selling livestock. He's been doing this productive activity for 5 years. His father was the one who taught him to value work by giving as an example the life he lived, where only by working and taking care of his family could he live in peace. Necessity and a shortage of job opportunities in the area led him to make decisions. Luis has two jobs: farming and selling livestock. The distance that he travels varies since he doesn't always go to the same places. No one else is involved in his work. He works from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m.

This loan will be used to prepare his land for planting since winter is coming. He has his animals, but he doesn't want to get rid of them in case a need arises. The met need will be to begin preparing the land for the planting of staple grains.

His dream is to first give what is most needed to his family, who he hopes to always work for as long as God gives him health and life. This loan will help him begin to prepare his land.

loans.use: to begin preparing his land.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Meet Abdul. He is in his late forties and is from OIC Ropolo northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 15. Three of his children are currently attending school. In 1999, Abdul established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-employed. He works from 7:00am until 7:00pm, 6 days per week. He says that his business is doing well.

Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more jeans, shirts and a variety of other clothing for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees and increase his business. In the future, Abdul plans to build a permanent business place. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more jeans, shirts and other clothing for resale

loans.name: Haneefan

texts.en:
Haneefan, age 57, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. Haneefan makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income. She also sells milk to generate extra income, but she needs to improve her business to manage her household expenses. 

For this reason, Haneefan contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, Haneefan will definitely expand her business and improve her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Eliseo De Jesús

texts.es:
Eliseo de 46 años de edad,  nunca asistió a la escuela, está casado, su paraje se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es quien se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos pequeños y los quehaceres de la casa, tienen 6 hijos.

Eliseo se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 25 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre fue quien le enseño a valorar lo que es el trabajo, dándole como ejemplo la vida que él había tenido, donde solo trabajando y cuidando la familia podía vivir tranquilo, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura, Eliseo ha sido un hombre responsable, a criado a sus 6 hijos sin abandonarlos como muchos padres lo hacen, el trabajo le queda a 1 km, de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, sus hijos mayores le apoyan en sus actividades. El horario de trabajo es de 5 am a 11 md.    

El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra, pago del arrendamiento de la tierra y compra de abonos, fertilizantes y  semilla, hoy que viene la época de invierno, con el apoyo de sus hijos no invierte en personas que le ayuden, pero si en el arrendamiento de la tierra, la mejora será el ir avanzando en los trabajos, y la necesidad satisfecha es el tener su propio capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Eliseo is 46 years old, never attended school, is married, and his spouse does the work at home, is in charge of taking care of their small children and the household tasks. They have 6 children. 

Eliseo works in agriculture, and he already has been working in this productive activity for 25 years. His father taught him to value work, giving him the example of his life, where only working and taking care of the family, he could live peacefully. The type of activity in the region is to work in agriculture. 

Eliseo has been a responsible man and has raised his 6 children without abandoning them like many parents do. His work is 1 kilometer away from his house. He walks there on foot, and his older children support him in his activities. The working day is from 5am to 11pm. 

The loan will be invested in the preparation of the land for sowing, for paying the rental of the land, and the purchase of fertilizers and seeds. Now that the winter is coming, with the support of his children he will not invest in hiring helpers, but he will invest in renting the land. The improvement will be his advancement in the work, and the satisfied necessity is having his own working capital.

loans.use: to prepare the land for sowing, pay for the rental of the land and purchase of fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Yasinta

texts.en:
Yasinta is 34 years old and is married to Michael. They have six children between the ages of 10 and 19. Three of the children attend school.

She operates a retail shop where she sells items like sugar, salt, clothes, etc. She started this business in 2005 in a nearby trading centre.

Yasinta has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to add inventory to her shop so as to meet the available demand.

She dreams of educating all her children and constructing a good family house and expanding her house.

The main challenges faced by Yasinta are competition from people with similar businesses.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maqsodin

texts.en: Maqsodin is a 60-year-old woman and the dedicated mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Maqsodin's son. Her son runs a donkey cart as a transportation service. The donkeys help customers carry material from one place to another. He makes enough to meet the family's needs. In order to purchase a larger size wooden cart for the donkey, Maqsodin contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This way her son will be able to take more things on his cart at once, like fruits and vegetables. This ultimately saves him time and hopefully will increase his net income. Maqsodin plans to spend the additional revenue on bettering the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a larger size wooden cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is a 45-year-old married woman and has a daughter and seven sons. Her husband is a farmer. The family’s income source is a small product market. She sells sweets, cookies, bread, water, salt, sugar, etc. She has been working in this field for 20 years and her monthly income is 400 AZN. 

Daily products are in high demand in Azerbaijan. People buy sweets and cookies for tea every day and use them for holidays and parties. 

Tarana has a big family and it’s hard to cover the family’s demand with her income. She has to pay for their education and cover life costs. She applied for 100 AZN in order to purchase a variety of products for her market.  She plans to sell different kinds of products and household goods in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her market

loans.name: Kankoe

texts.fr: Mr Kankoe vit avec sa famille(femme et ses 02 enfants à Lomé). Il est agent de sécurité dans une société et en même temps loue les chaises aux personnes pour les manifestations. Sa clientèle s'élargit de jour en jour et n'arrivant plus à répondre aux besoins des clients, mr Kankoe demande un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des chaises en vue de louer et de revendre à ses derniers. Il espère à l'avenir, acheter des micro pour louer et bien nourrir sa famille.
texts.en: Mr Kankoe lives with his family (his wife and his two children in Lomé). He is a security guard for a company and, at the same time, rents chairs to people for their events. His clientele grows from day to day and, no longer able to meet the needs of his clients, Mr Kankoe is asking for a second loan from WAGES to buy chairs to rent and resell to the aforementioned clients. He hopes in the future to buy microphones to rent and to feed his family well.

loans.use: to rent chairs

loans.name: Latafat

texts.en:
Latafat is a 53-year-old married woman and has four sons. Her husband works doing repairs, but the main source of income is poultry. Latafat has been raising chickens and hens for 20 years. Her monthly income is 400 AZN.

Poultry is one of the most predominant types of farming. People buy eggs and hens to use them in cooking of different national dishes.

Latafat applied for 600 AZN in order to buy chicken feed and expand her small business. She plans to increase her income and cover the family’s life demands. This is her second loan and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and expand her business

loans.name: In God Group

texts.en:
These group members are part of the group called In God, and it is made up of three women who all live in the same neighborhood. They get together once in the week to repay the loan, make savings, and get training from the MFI. They are into the sale of pepper, gari (cassava flour), corn, cassava, wine, and other items.

Joyce, the woman standing at the lefthand side in the photograph, is the featured borrower of this group. She has 12 years of experience. She's seeking this loan to buy gari, cassava, and corn dough to sell to customers.

She's 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She helps her husband cover the daily expenses of the family. She starts her day at 8 a.m. and finishes it at 5 p.m.

In the future, she would like to strengthen her business and increase her income, thanks to the loans from the MFI. She also intends to save money with the MFI.

loans.use: to buy gari, cassava, and corn dough to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blood syrup, injections, hot rub, oral hydration salt and baby food.

loans.name: Zamiq

texts.en:
Zamiq is a 32-year-old refugee.  He is married with two sons, and lives in an IDP (Internationally Displaced Persons) settlement.  Zamiq has been raising seasonal fruits and selling them at a local bazaar for 8 years.  He has good experience in this field and his monthly income is 200 AZN.
