Azerbaijani people like to eat fresh fruits and use them to prepare fresh fruit juice or different sorts of jams.  They like to eat jam during tea time.  Local people attend Zamiq’s grocery store because fruits there are always fresh and tasty.

Zamiq doesn’t earn enough money to cover his family’s needs.  He applied for a 700 AZN loan in order to supply new fruit tree seeds and fertilizers.  He wants to raise vegetables in order to diversify his assortment.

loans.use: to buy new fruit tree seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en: Valentino is a 31-year-old married man and lives in Bundibugyo Uganda.  He has two children.  He owns a mini supermarket and in addition has a business buying and selling dairy products such as milk, yogurt, and eggs.  He dreams of leaving the rented house and building a permanent residential one, and of educating his children.  Despite his dream, he is challenged by competition and high rental costs. Valentino is requesting a loan to buy eggs, milk, and yogurt for resale.

loans.use: to buy eggs, milk,and yogurt for resale

loans.name: Ghulam  Fiza

texts.en: Ghulam Fiza is a 46-year-old married woman. She is running an academy in her house. She has gained a good number of students and is well respected in her community. She is contributing much to the family income through all of her great efforts. In order to accommodate more students, Ghulam Fiza requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase a couple of benches and chairs along with a new blackboard. She expects more admissions as her academy becomes popular in her town. She desires to spend part of the revenues on the expansion of her academy.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of benches and chairs along with a new blackboard

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Bonaface is a 58-year-old married man who lives in Bundibugyo Uganda.  He has twelve children.  He has been dealing in buying and selling cocoa since 1986, and it has helped him to provide for his family's basic needs.  

He sells cocoa to cocoa companies around town.  He is very hard working, but competition and weather affects his production.  

He wants a loan to pay for the rental of a cocoa garden to increase his produce and his profits.

loans.use: to pay for the rental of a cocoa garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of lace, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of lace, zippers and buttons

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado, su paraje se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es quien se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos pequeños y los quehaceres de la casa, en su hogar tienen cerdos, ganado, gallinas,  tienen 4 hijos, los cuatro estudian,  en la universidad y los demás en básica, por lo que le toca rebuscarse como todo padre responsable para que sus hijos tengan lo necesario, nadie más vive con ellos, por lo que solo los hijos y su esposa dependen de él.


Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre y madre son quienes le enseñaron el respeto al prójimo y  así mismos, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura, José ha sido un hombre responsable, el trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más se dedica a la actividad  y su horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 11am.

El préstamo será invertido para pagar a personas que le ayuden con los trabajos de la agricultura, lo demás del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para el cultivo del maíz.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old, and he studied up to the ninth grade. He is married and his wife runs their home, taking care of their small children and carrying out the household duties. 

They have pigs, cattle, and chickens. They have four children who are studying at the university, and the rest are in grade school. So, like every responsible father, he has to make sure that his children have what they need. No one else lives with them; his wife and his children are the only ones who depend on him.

He works in agriculture, and he has been carrying out this productive activity for more than 20 years now. His parents taught him to respect others and each other. The only occupation in the zone in which they are engaged is agriculture, and José has been a responsible man. His work is near his house and he makes the trip on foot. No one else carries out this activity, and his work schedule is from 6 a.m. to 11 a.m.

The loan will be used to pay people to help him with the farm work, and he will invest the rest in the purchase of supplies for cultivating corn.

loans.use: to pay people to help him with the farm work, and to purchase supplies for cultivating corn.

loans.name: Ghulam  Ruqiya

texts.en:
Ghulam Ruqiya is a 35-year-old married woman who sells goats. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them home for a year or two, then sells them in the market for higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a Cameroonian man who is 35 year old and married with a one-year-old child.  He has been in this business for over ten years.  This makes him very experience and makes his business profitable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase his profit forty percent and his turn over from 450,000 FCFA to 650,000 FCFA.

loans.use: to buy material for weaving baskets.

loans.name: Thyvuth's Group

texts.en:
Thyvuth, 37, is married and lives with his family in a village of the Pnhom Proek district. He has two children. To make a living, he has been growing corn and selling grocery items for 10 years.
  
There are two members in Thyvuth’s group and they both are first cycle clients with VisionFund. Thyvuth, who is the leader, is leading his group to apply for a loan. He will use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor. He hopes to increase his income from his current business, in order to make life better for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Loem's Group

texts.en:
Loem is aged 44, married, and has six children. Her family lives in a village of the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province.  She and her husband have earned a living planting cassava for 10 years. The current business earns her about 54,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs.
 
Loem has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The past loans have helped her relieve her family's financial burden to a great extent. She is now leading a group of two members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for land plowing and labor. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crops and sell them for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, Maggi cubes, pepper, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a beekeeper from Jermuk town. She lives with her husband and two school age children. Her husband works at local electricity station.

Aida herself has been involved in beekeeping. She keeps 20 colonies of bees, gets high quality honey and sells it to locals of the Vayots Dzor region.

The requested loan of 2,000 USD is important for Aida and will allow her to purchase 12 more colonies of bees and increase her honey production. 

The income from honey production is vital for the family to cover their basic needs. 

Aida hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 12 colonies of bees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods which she will resell

loans.name: Shamiram

texts.en:
Shamiram is a farmer living in Gyumri town. She lives with her husband, who helps run a farm. Shamiram, besides her farming activities, also teaches at a local school.

Near the house where they live, Shamiram and her husband own arable land where wheat, potato, carrots, and beetroot are cultivated. The couple sells the gathered harvest in local open markets to earn income.

Shamiram has applied for this loan of $2,500 to pay for potato seeds and labor for the cultivation process. The loan is very important for Shamiram and her husband. They hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and to hire workers for land cultivation.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is an accountant by profession, but also runs a farm.  She keeps livestock, (3 cows, calves, chickens and 40 colonies of bees) and cultivates wheat, potatoes, and some fruit trees.  Nune and her husband sell the gathered harvest locally to earn income for their family. 

Nune's son attends school and her mother-in-law is retired.  The family’s main income is from agribusiness so the requested loan of 2,500 USD is very important for them.  With the loan, Nune plans to purchase seeds and fuel for land cultivation. 

Please help this hard working family continue to further develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Lusakert village, where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and two sons. The only family income comes from farming. They keep animals (cows, calves, chickens) and cultivate plants (potato and wheat).

Anna's husband and sons take the gathered harvest to the local market for sale. This hardworking family takes care of their farm with great love, and they would like to expand it. Anna requested this loan of $2,500 to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, fuel and labor for land cultivation. The loan will greatly help Anna and her family, and they hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer, fuel and labor for land cultivation.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, 31, is married and has one child.  They reside in a rural village of the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province. To support the family, she has been growing cassava for 3 years, while her husband works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 170,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs.
 
This is Chanthorn's first cycle with VisionFund, and she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sevara

texts.ru:
Севара жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая девушка в возрасте 26 лет. Она замужем и имеет двух детей. Сама Севара уже несколько лет сотрудничает с Арванд, она получала кредиты на потребительские нужды и всегда погашала свои обязательства вовремя. Она имеет среднее образование.  Сама Севара занимается шитьём на дому. Этому делу она научилась с юных лет, и сегодня получает от этого хороший доход. Муж Севары работает в местной мастерской.

Сейчас Севара планирует организовать большой праздник, у её сына скоро будет день рождения. По традиции она должна организовать большой праздник. Сейчас она закупает все необходимые вещи и продукты для этого праздника. Но у неё имеется недостаток денежных средств. Поэтому она в очередной раз обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить потребительский кредит на покупку продуктов для мероприятия. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Sevara is a cheerful and hardworking 26-year-old who is married and has two kids.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and works from home as a seamstress, first learning the ropes in her youth and currently earning a good living from it, while her husband works at a local craftsman's workshop.  She's been taking loans through Arvand for several years for personal purchases, and has always paid her loans off on time.  Currently, Sevara is organizing a celebration for her son's birthday in accordance with tradition, and is buying all the necessary items for his party.  She lacks the money to buy everything needed, though, and is turning to Arvand once again; specifically, she is seeking a loan to buy food for her son's birthday party.  She's hoping for a positive outcome, and would like to thank Arvand in advance for their help.

loans.use: buy food for her son's birthday celebration

loans.name: Mélégan

texts.fr: Madame Mélégan âgée de 34ans et pour subvenir à ses besoins(Célibataire) revend des sacs et boissons à ses clients dans un marché de la place. Afin de renforcer son activité, elle fait un second prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle espère épargner afin d'ouvrir d'autres points de vente et fonder plus tard un foyer. Mélégan a une ancienneté de 11ans.
texts.en:
Mélégan is 34 years old and single.  In order to provide for her needs, she has been selling bags and drinks to her customers at a local market for eleven years now.

She would like to strengthen her business so she has requested this second loan from the field partner, Wages.  She will use her loan to buy more stock to sell.

Mélégan will save a part of her earnings so that, in the future she can open further sales outlets and, eventually, build herself a home.

loans.use: to buy second-hand bags and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Govakan

texts.en:
Govakan is from Arapi village. She lives with her husband and 32-years-old son. Govakan and her husband work at the village municipality. As the income they earn is hardly enough to make ends meet, the couple also runs a farm. They own arable land where potatoes, carrots, beetroots, and grass are cultivated and sold in local markets.

Realizing that the profit from this activity is very important for her family, Govakan requested this loan of 2,000 USD to be able to purchase fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation.

The loan is important for their farm's further development.  Govakan and her family hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 42-year-old, married woman and mother of five children.  Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in functioning condition.  For this reason, Nasreen has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts

loans.name: Sulestri

texts.en:
Sulestri runs a small stall selling drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. Sulestri lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Sulestri is married and living with five people in the family home. 

Sulestri began working with Ruma two months ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Titin

texts.en:
Titin runs a small stall selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Titin lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Titin is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Titin began working with Ruma four months ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Banita Shg Group

texts.en:
From a small village in the Baragarh district, Odisha state, India, 11 women stepped out and made a self-help group having the name of "Banita Shg" to earn some money from different activities to support their families. All the group members are engaged in different business activities like paddy cultivation, vegetable cultivation, etc. 

Ulas, age 32, is a married lady with two children. The lady standing with her hand raised is Ulas. To provide a living, she has been planting rice and farming for seven years. From farming, she earns an income of 3,500 INR per month. Now she is the leader of this group and they are seeking their first loan with People's Forum (Kiva’s partner) for 165,000 INR. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes she will have a good rice crop yield to earn a profit to support her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a mother of three, including one who was born half-paralyzed. She owns a rolling wooden fast food business that she has stabilized on her little property by the beach. She sells fast food, grilled fish, and summer drinks. She runs the business from May until September. She is now requesting this loan to buy kitchen supplies and wares.

Vera and her family live in a little coastal town that is frequented by thousands of visitors every year. It is the third largest seaport in the country for landing and distributing fish and other merchandise. The scenery is breathtaking, as the town is built at the foot of a mountain where there are lots of pine trees. Part of this town is built elongated with lagoons parallel to the coast.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies and ware.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and tools and to pay for workers.

loans.name: Laura Nathaly

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de una joven estudiante llamada Laura Nathaly de bachillerato, con muchos sueños y metas por cumplir, llena de ganas y entusiasmo por salir adelante, la prueba de esto es que estudia un técnico en auxiliar de enfermería mientras esta en bachillerato, fue complicado porque mientras estaba en grado 10 hacia primer y segundo semestre de esta carrera así que todos los días eran de estudio,  completa entrega a la lectura, cada día recordando a donde quería llegar, los padres la apoyaban bastante y no solo económicamente ya que sabían cuán importante era el tema de la salud para ella, no solo porque se trata de ayudar a los demás si no porque desde pequeña había sentido que esto era definitivamente lo que quería hacer el resto de la vida y de lo que quería vivir, estando en tercer semestre y en grado undécimo comenzaron a surgir una serie de problemas familiares y económicos que preocuparon a esta joven y a la familia, pensando en posponer el semestre, aviso a el instituto la probabilidad de no poder continuar por un tiempo este técnico, ellos le comentaron que tenía el convenio con kiva, que le podían ofrecer una ayuda económica  para no tener que aplazar el estudio y mucho menos no terminarlo.  
Esta ayuda le sirve a ella y  a muchos estudiantes, ya que podrá lograr seguir con las prácticas, una etapa más de la vida en la cual tuvo excelente desempeño, terminando el colegio y el técnico tiene bastantes motivos para celebrar, ya que la familia se sentirá muy orgullosa de ella.
texts.en:
This is the story of a young student named Laura Nathaly, who has many dreams and goals to achieve and is full of enthusiasm and desire to get ahead.

The proof of this is that she's studying for a nursing assistant degree while she's in high school. This was complicated because while she was in 10th grade, she did the first and second semester of this course, so she was studying every day, completely immersed in reading, every day remembering where she wanted to go.

Her parents supported her a lot, and not only financially. They understand how important the subject of health is for her - not just because it has to do with helping others, but also because she's known since she was little that this is definitively what she wanted to do for the rest of her life and what she wanted to live for.

Being in her third semester and in 11th grade, a series of family and economic problems began to develop, worrying this young woman and her family. 

She thought about postponing the semester and told the institution that it was likely she would not be able to continue this degree for some time. 

They told her they had an agreement with Kiva, which could offer her financial assistance so she wouldn't have to defer her studies, much less end them.

This help serves her and other students, as they can successfully continue with practices, a stage of life in which she's had excellent performance. Finishing high school and a degree provides many reasons to celebrate, as her family feels very proud of her.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Sucheli

texts.en:
Sucheli runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Hei lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Sucheli is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Sucheli began working with Ruma four months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Budi

texts.en:
Budi runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Budi lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Budi is married and living with two people in the family home. 

Budi began working with Ruma two years ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Yele Group

texts.fr:
YELE est un groupe de l’association BENKADI (FILABOUGOU) de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la restauration à l’image de KATRINE qui est la première personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à FILABOUGOU dans la  Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités vente de restauration. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
KATRINE, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la restauration. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz et une quantité importante de viandes et de condiments.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité vente de restaurant.
texts.en:
Yele is a member group of the business association Benkadi (Filabougou), based in Ouelessebougou.  It is made up of women who know one another through family and neighbourhood ties.  The women are, on average, 44 years old, married and have three children.  They live in large, traditional families in Filabougou, in the Prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali).  They have several years' experience in various businesses such as restaurants and are much sought after for their services.

In order to satisfy the growing demands of their customers, the women decided four years ago, to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their sixth group loan.

Katrine (sitting on the far right of the photo) is very well known in Ouelessebougou and runs an excellent restaurant business.  She will use her loan to buy two sacks of rice and a large quantity of meat and condiments.  She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako and then sells her food in Ouelessebougou to various customers, for cash or on credit.  Katrine hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA which she will use to repay her loan and reinvest in her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
This is Meali. Her previous loan was a big help in her rental house business since she managed to install more pipes. She also operates a retail shop business.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Shg Group

texts.en: A portion of this group loan will go to support "Phaguni". She is the president of "Jay Jagannath SHG" self help group and is pictured here as the lady standing with her hand raised. Most of the women in her group are working in dairy farming or own other small businesses in their village in Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India. With her portion of the loan, Phaguni will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. Her husband works as a florist in the village and they support their one child together. After this loan, Phaguni will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. Phaguni is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm. The women in the group also plan to save the money they earn from expanding their businesses to buy a food-processing machine, which they can all use to make spices and pickled vegetables together.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to increase her dairy farming business.

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Since 1998, Taguhi has been trading women’s clothing and underwear from a rented shop in one of the city’s markets. In the past, Taguhi used to travel to neighboring countries to purchase inventory. Now, she orders through other traders so she can spend more time managing the shop. Currently, Taguhi requires new stock for the shop. With a good credit history behind her, to help her finance the inventory order, Taguhi has applied to SEF International for a loan of USD 1,500. 

Taguhi hopes for the lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of clothing

loans.name: Rusina

texts.en: The Kiva loan has been successful in helping Rusina expand her business selling second-hand clothes. With the loan, she bought bales of clothing from neighboring Mozambique to sell to her local community in rural Zimbabwe.  As these clothes are very affordable, many people in her village flock to purchase clothes from Rusina. This initial increase in sales, made possible through Kiva lending, allowed Rusina to purchase bales more frequently. Rusina is very thankful that the increase in profit has enabled her to pay the school fees for her son and provide basic food and clothing for her family. However, the market place where she sells her clothes has no shelter, so selling clothes during the rainy season is a challenge. In the future, Rusina plans to rent a shop, which will allow her to sell more items. She plans to use the profit to improve her education, send her son to boarding school, and expand into the Pre-School business.

loans.use: to rent a store

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is hardworking farmer from Kirants village. 
She lives there with her husband and three children. Her two sons are grown up and work in the private sector. Karine's little daughter is school aged. The family's father is a village herdsman. He grazes the cattle of local villagers and gathers income for his family.
Karine herself takes care of their farm. She keeps 3 cows, 15 chickens and also cultivates wheat, potato and corn. The farming business is very important for this family so Karine has requested this loan of USD 1,000 to be able to purchase 3 more calves, wheat and corn seeds and purchase fuel for her tractor. 
This will greatly assist Karine to develop her farm further and gather more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 calves, wheat and corn seeds and purchase fuel for her tractor

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 42 años, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos. Ella se dedica a fabricar y distribuir lonas para eventos y negocios, así como bolsas, se dedica a esto desde hace más de 15 años, su esposo también se dedica a la fabricación de lonas, pero en otro lugar. 
Irma esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar una maquina y algunas materias primas, dice que ahora tiene más clientes y por lo tanto más trabajo y con esta inversión podrá fabricar más lonas y también su esposo la podrá ayudar en las tardes. Hasta ahora ella tiene que mandar a maquillar algunas piezas, pero con la maquina podrá fabricarlas ella misma y tener más utilidad.
texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old and married with four children. 

She earns her living making and distributing tarps for events and businesses, as well as bags. She's been doing this for over 15 years. Her husband also makes tarps for a living, but in another location.

Irma is asking for this loan to buy a machine and some raw materials. She says that now she has more clients, and thus more work. 

With this investment, she'll be able to make more tarps, and her husband will also be able to help her in the evening. 

Until now, she's had to send some pieces to a factory, but with the machine, she'll be able to make them herself and have more utility.

loans.use: to purchase a machine and raw materials for making tarps and bags.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of food ingredients such as onions, wheat flour, cooking oil,maize flour, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food ingredients such as onions,wheat flour, cooking oil,maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, ha mejorado favorablemente su situación económica con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior, ha dado buena atención a sus clientes nuevos y a los que ya tenía, sus hijos se mantienen estudiando así como también teniendo una mejor vida familiar.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de quesillo, maíz, aceite, tomates, aderezos, bebidas, chicharrón, loroco, bolsas entre otros materiales, seguirá mejorando la venta de pupusas y teniendo los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria has greatly improved her financial situation with the help of the previous loan. She has given good service to both her new customers and those that she already had. Her children are continuing their schooling, as well as having a better family life.

She is requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of fresh cheese, corn, oil, tomatoes, seasonings, drinks, pork cracklings, loroco (an edible flower), and bags, among other supplies. She will continue improving her sales of pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and having the income that she needs to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh cheese, corn, oil, tomatoes, seasonings, drinks, pork cracklings, loroco (an edible flower), and bags, among other items.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Ljevan town where she runs a small store with her husband. Since 2008 they have rented a small store in the center of Ljevan town where they sell different fruits and vegetables.

The requested loan of USD 1,500 will help Anna to purchase new stock of supplies (fruits and vegetables) for selling in the store. Anna and her husband have two school age children and they do their best to provide normal living conditions to their children.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of supplies (fruits and vegetables) to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking season to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and rice to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, chicken and season to expand her food business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: She is taking another loan to further improve on her beauty hair salon. This loan will be used to buy yet another hair drying machine, more recent hair products and mesh. The last loan affected her business positively. The number of customers increased from 19 to 32 per week. The living standard of her family has increased significantly. She now sponsors two of her younger brothers who were not going to school.

loans.use: to buy a new hair dryer, hair products, and hair mesh

loans.name: Gjergji

texts.en:
Gjergji wants to buy potato seeds with this loan. His focus has been only on agriculture/arboriculture for a very long time now. He’s been photographed in his yard where there are three beehives and a warm bed covered with a waterproof plastic sheet that serves to prepare seedlings for seasonal veggies. Gjergji, in particular, plants potatoes and beans and has apple orchards. He sells the products to wholesale buyers. Grains such as corn and wheat as well as onions are some other agro products that residents of his village focus on producing. Plum orchards in addition to the apple orchards, are two fruit trees that villagers in this entire region have been focusing on for generations.  As far as the livestock is concerned, cows and sheep are the two most preferred animals for almost everyone here since the terrain supports them.

Gjergji, whose name in English is ‘George’, is 42 years old and a married father of two children who are 13 and 10 years old.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for seasonal planting

loans.name: Hebert Danilo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de pasteles,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener una panaderia.El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca, azucar entre otros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with his cake-making business. He has had this business for several years and it is going very well for him. His dream is to have a bakery. He requested the loan in order to purchase supplies, such as flour, butter, and sugar.

The member is happy to get the loan and is committed to making his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as flour, butter, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, coconut and Cassava grain to expand her business.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives with her father in Azatamut village. She rents a small store where she has been trading woman's clothing and underwear for a year. 
Gayane's father is a teacher at local village school and brings income to the family. However, the main breadwinner of the family is Gayane with her retail business.
She has now requested this loan of USD 1,500 to be able to purchase new stock of clothing for her store and meet her clients' demand.
Gayane will be very grateful to lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for the store

loans.name: Rocio Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia Roció Alejandra continua trabajando en un jardín, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su trabajo, la socia es profesora de niños, la socia le gusta su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colores, temperas entre otros.

La socia esta feliz con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rocio Alejandra is still working in a kindergarten, a job she has had now for a few years.  She is good at her job thanks to the effort she puts in on a daily basis.  She teaches children and she likes her job because it gives her a lot of satisfaction and she earns a good income.   She would like to continue in this work so that she can continue to support her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy some tempera colors and things like that.  She is very happy with the loans and promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to buy tempera colors and other things.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Lakshmi, 47 years old, is married, has two children, and lives with them and her husband in a village that belongs to the Bargarh district of Odisha, India. She has always worked in agriculture. She has been growing her own crops along with her husband for many years, since the area where they live is agricultural and apt for these crops. She grows potatoes, corn, beans and cabbage. She sells this produce in the local market. 

She has applied for this loan to keep her crops well maintained. On this occasion, she, along with her group, is applying for this loan of 150,000 INR. She will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide for her crops in order to have better harvests. Her goal is to increase the income for her family. She belongs to the "Maa Mangala SHG" self-help group, which is made up of 10 members. In the photo, the lady standing with her hand raised is Lakshmi. They all make their living in potato farming in the area and live in the same community.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide and other items for her crops

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr: Mariée à un déclarant en douane, Adjowavi pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales exerce comme activité la vente des charbons de bois à domicile.Elle s'approvisionne généralement à Lomé et dans les villes de l'intérieur et sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter des tonnes de charbons de bois. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Married to a customs agent, Adjowavi helps her husband with family expenses by selling charcoal through home delivery.

She usually resupplies in Lomé and in the inland towns, and is requesting her third loan to buy tons of charcoal.

Profits will enable her to expand her business and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic compost and tools for farming.

loans.name: Gaby Alexandra

texts.es:
La socia Gabi Alexandra se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gabi Alexandra raises animals for a living.  She works with guinea pigs and chickens, helping them grow and fatten up so that she can sell them at the different fairs and markets.  Thanks to this small business venture, she can look after her children.  

She dreams of having her own place where she can sell guinea pigs and chickens.  She is asking for a loan to buy some animals and the food she needs to feed them.

She is very happy with the loan system and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and food to feed them.

loans.name: Gorreth

texts.en:
Gorreth used her previous loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more stock of retail items, which she sold and increased her profits from the usual 150,000 to 220,000 fortnightly. This also increased her turnover and the number of clients.

She works 7 days a week and 16 hours per day to maximize profits. She is acquiring another loan to pay tuition for her children. She will use a small portion of the loan to buy more stock for the retail shop. She hopes to expand into a large business that can supply all the people around her area. Her clients are traders from her village and the surrounding places

The challenge she faces is too many people not paying on time.  She describes herself as an honest and hardworking woman. She appreciates the services that the financial institution is giving to small-income earners.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her children and buy stock for her shop

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya has been involved in beekeeping for many years. She is a teacher by profession, but is already retired. She lives with her only son, who is employed in the private sector.

Zoya is a beekeeper. She currently keeps 24 colonies of bees, gets honey and sells it to locals.

She has requested this loan of USD 3000 to be able to increase the number of beehives by 14 and enlarge her honey production.

Zoya is very hardworking and she will be very grateful if lenders support her to develop her beekeeping business.

loans.use: to pay for fourteen colonies of bees

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en: Sakhi is in her first loan cycle with "Maa Santoshi SHG" self-help group through People's Forum. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Sakhi. She likes this type of funding because it allows her to grow her businesses. Sakhi is 30 years old and married. She has two children. Her husband is also in business. He works in mobile village markets on market days. Sakhi makes a living raising and then selling goats to the local butchers in the nearby market. She has been doing this business for the last six years. She spends most of her time taking care of her business but she also raises chickens to help her husband with the household expenses. She will use the loan to buy more goats, goat kids and feed. Her goal is to have a bigger goat business. All the members of this group are women and all are sharing a common goal to give a better life to their children. All the group members live in a small village in Odisha, India, and all are engaged in different activities. On behalf of this group, Sakhi says, "We are very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for giving us this opportunity to grow."

loans.use: To purchase more goat kids, goats and feed.

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila es una joven que vive en Bogotá junto a la madre y abuela materna, Camila ingreso a Campo  Alto en el año 2013 para estudiar auxiliar de enfermería, ella ingreso con un convenio que obtuvo por salir de un colegio Público, pero cuando estaba en segundo semestre, el convenio se terminó, ahora Camila no sabe cómo hacer para continuar estudiando, ya que no cuenta con los suficientes recursos económicos para terminar la carrera.

La meta de Camila es convertirse en médico y especializarse en cirugía plástica facial, y que mejor manera de iniciar este propósito que estudiando enfermería. 

Por esta razón ella recurre a kiva en busca de apoyo para culminar este primer ciclo de la carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Camila is a young girl who lives in Bogota with her mother and her grandmother.  She joined the Campo Alto organization in 2013 so that she could study to be a nurse.  She became a member when she finished her high school education thanks to an agreement her school had with the organization.  However, now that she is in her second semester, the deal has now finished.  Camila does not know how she is going to be able to continue with her studies as she does not have the necessary funds to pay for her course.

Her goal is to become a doctor and specialize in plastic surgery.  She believes that the first step towards this is to become a nurse.  

For this reason, she has asked Kiva for a loan so that she can finish the first cycle of this course.

loans.use: to pay a education fees for a semester.

loans.name: Petrit

texts.en:
Petrit, who is 28 years old and married with a 4-year-old, wants to buy a harvesting/grass reaper machine. He works with a fadroma wheeled loader in the construction industry in addition to what he does in the agriculture sector; planting/harvesting and selling plums and cherries and summer veggies such as tomatoes and peppers and also red onions, garlic and some grains (oats and rye).

The village where Petrit and his family live is situated very high, almost on top of a mountain in the southern part of the country. The roads to take you there are bumpy and unpaved and also very narrow so for most of the villagers, it’s very difficult to drive normal cars. They need Fuoristrada or Jeep type vehicles.

loans.use: to buy a harvesting/grass reaper machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias trabajadoras, coordinado por la señora Juliana de 51 años de edad, soltera, quienes propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio y cosméticos de la AVON, esto negocios los tiene desde hace cinco años atrás, por este motivo requiere el crédito para surtir el negocio con productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, pastillas varias como ranitidinas, panadol, sal Andrew, así mismo cosméticos como vanidad, pinturas labial, pinturas de uñas y perfumes de damas y caballeros, por ser lo que la comunidad más demanda. Otra de las socias es la señora Silvia de 36 años comerciante de ropa interior en su comunidad y mercado local, y la señora Carla de 34 años propietaria de una venta de fritanga todos los fines de semana sopa los días domingo. Esta socias elaboran actividades diferentes para ganarse el pan de cada día y así mantener el hogar.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hard working members, with Juliana, 51, the coordinator.  She has a grocery store in her house and sells Avon cosmetics.  She has had these two businesses for five years.  She needs the loan to buy stock for her store.  She will buy rice, frijoles, oil, medicine such as ranitidine, panadol and Andrews salts.  She will also buy cosmetic products such as lipstick, nail varnish and perfume for women and men.  These products are those that are in demand in her area.  

Another of the members is Silvia, 36, who sells underwear in her community and at the local market.  The other is Carla, 34, who has a fried food stall every weekend with soup every Sunday.   These members do different jobs to earn a living and look after the household.

loans.use: to buy various goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more milk, matches, soap, candles, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nidia Xiomara

texts.es: Es una mujer amable y alegre, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 21 años de edad, casada con un pequeño hijo de 22 meses. Desde hace 4 años vendía de manera ambulante: chiverías en un carretón y en termo con hielo ofrecía, refrescos y gaseosas, ubicándose en los colegios del Municipio. Gracias  a los financiamientos otorgados por Pana Pana como grupo solidario y a las ganancias percibidas, le permitieron construir un pequeño anexo de madera para establecer una pulpería en su vivienda desde hace un año. Actualmente solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de créditos individuales para comprar mercadería para su negocio: 12 bolsones de chivería, un bolsón de papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, sopas instantáneas, granos básicos, café instantáneo, jabones de baño y de lavar ropa, un quintal de arroz, un quintal de azúcar, pañales desechables, leche en polvo, 3 bolsones de sal, pastas de dientes, bujías, pollo, carne molida, un bidón de aceite, pan. Su sueño es ir creciendo y construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Nidia Xiomara is a kind, cheerful woman from Puerto Cabezas, who is 21 years old, married and has a baby son, 22 months old.  Four years ago she used to work as a street vendor selling dairy drinks and iced beverages from a food cart at municipal schools.  Thanks to funding through the Pana Pana solidarity group and profits she made she was able to build a small wood annex onto her house to open a grocery store a year ago.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy goods for her business such as 12 bags of dairy drinks, toilet tissue, sanitary napkins, instant soup, basic grains, instant coffee, bath soap, detergent, a quintal of rice, a quintal of sugar, disposable diapers, powdered milk, three bags of salt, tooth paste, batteries, chicken, ground meat, oil, and bread.  Her goal is to continue expanding and to build a concrete house.

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKAFO de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente de restaurant à l’image de MASSIRE qui est la troisième personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités de restauration avec les repas de viandes, poissons, haricots, riz , etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a six ans. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. 
MASSIRE, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de riz et une quantité importante de viandes et haricots. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, sur place et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans ses activités de restauration.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group belongs to the Siguikafo association in Tiele. It includes women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 29 years old, married with two children.

They conduct various activities such as preparing food like Massire, who is the third person standing from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Tiele, in the Baguineda sub-district (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand with their food preparation activities, offering meals with meat, fish, beans, rice, etc.

To satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided six years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their eighth group loan.

Massire plans to use her loan to buy two bags of rice and a large quantity of meat and beans. She resupplies in Bamako and locally, and retails her food preparations in Tiele, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 25,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the remainder in her food preparation activities.

loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparations

loans.name: Yosip

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose al negocio de turismo, él socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es guisa de turismo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.
El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank member continues to work in the tourism business which he has been involved in for several years thanks to the hard work he does on a daily basis.  He is a tour guide and wants to continue working so he can support his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy tour site tickets.  He is grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy tour site tickets.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le, pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende aceites, faros entre otros para los distintos clientes que le solictan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando ´para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar retrovisores, aceites entre otros.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Aida continues with her auto parts business. She has been doing this for years and does very well thanks to her hard work. She sells lubricants, headlamps and other spare parts demanded by her customers. She wishes to be able to continue working in order to help her family.

Aida is requesting a loan to buy rearview mirrors, lubricants and other spare parts. She appreciates the help she will receive and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rearview mirrors, lubricants and other spare parts.

loans.name: Monte De Sion Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres socios laboriosos, coordinado por la señora Rita de 30 años de edad, soltera y madre de cuatro hijos de las edades de 9, 12 y unas gemelas de 7años, vende comida, refresco y gaseosas en el centro de salud de su comunidad desde hace cinco años, cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá para la elaboración de la comida, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, carnes, salsa de tomate, sal, gaseosas, naranjas, azúcar, carne de res, carne de cerdo y más, con el objetivo de que a su hijos no les falte el alimento diario y la educación, pues se ha propuesto que sus hijos sean profesionales para que puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida. Las otras socias son la señora Iliana de 49 años de edad, quién se dedica a elaborar espejos en su domicilio, y el señor José de 23 años de edad el cual ofrece el servicio de comida y refrescos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three hardworking members and is coordinated by Rita, who is 30, single, and the mother of four children aged 9, 12, and 7 (twin sisters). She has been selling food and beverages at the community’s healthcare center for five years. Her mother helps her to prepare the food.

Rita is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, oil, different types of meat, ketchup, salt, sodas, oranges, sugar, beef, pork, etc., so she can make sure her children will not lack food and education. Her goal is to see her children become professionals so that they can raise their living standards.

The remaining members are Iliana, who is 49 and makes mirrors and sells them at home; and José, who is 23 and sells food and beverages at home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, oil, meat and beverages.

loans.name: Juan Ovidio

texts.es:
Juan, necesita capital para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio comprara abono, herbicidas, semilla y para pagar mozos para acondicionar el terreno en el que realizara su próxima siembra.
El financiamiento anterior le ayudo a sembrar un área más grande, su producción fue abundante y realizo la recolección de la cosecha en menor tiempo para comercializarla. Su familia se encuentra en óptimas condiciones brindándole apoyo para seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Juan needs capital in order to continue strengthening his business. He will purchase compost, herbicides and seed, and he will also pay boys to prepare the land for the next crops.

The previous loan helped him to sow his crops in a larger area. His production was abundant and he gathered the harvest in less time in order to sell it. The members of his family are very healthy and they support him in the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to pay for labour and buy compost, herbicides, and seeds

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, ha descubierto en los créditos una herramienta útil para aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio, se ha decidió por un nuevo crédito con el que comprara hilos, telas, zippers, agujas, botones, tizas, con los que se mantendrá elaborando sus productos.
Con el préstamo anterior aumento las posibilidades de seguir trabajando en su negocio con el que genera los ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de su familia y cancelar su deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Ana has discovered that the loans are a useful tool for increasing the profitability of her sewing business.  She has decided on a new loan to buy thread, fabric, zippers, needles, buttons and chalk so she can continue making her products.

She used the previous loan to increase her possibilities to continue the business which generates the income to improve her family's living conditions and to pay off debt.

loans.use: To buy thread, fabric, zippers, needles, buttons and chalk.

loans.name: Milenka Teresa

texts.es:
La socia continua trabajando en una empresa privada, la socia lleva años dedicándose a trabajar para esta empresa la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres parea su hogar.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to work in a private company where she has been employed successfully for several years thanks to her dedication.  She wants to continue working so she can support her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy consumer goods for her household.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy consumer goods for her household.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales à l’image de ALIMA  qui est la première personne assise de la  droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).  
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de céréales : riz, maïs et mil. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a sept ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
ALIMA, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz et 3 sacs de mil.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, sur place  et vend ses céréales à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et  réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
The Danaya group belongs to the Benkadi association in Tiele. It includes women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 27 years old, married with two children.

They conduct various activities such as trading cereals like Alima, who is the first person sitting from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Tiele, in the Baguineda sub-district (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand with their cereal-trading activities: rice, corn and millet.

To satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided seven years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their ninth group loan.

Alima, who is a group member and very well known in Tiele, excels in trading cereals. She plans to use her loan to buy two bags of rice and three bags of millet. She resupplies in Bamako and locally, and retails the cereals in Tiele, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 30,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the remainder in her cereal-trading activities.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes, abono, semilla, para facilitar la preparación del terreno en el que cultiva y seguir teniendo una buena calidad del producto.
Con el crédito anterior su negocio ha mejorado la producción de maiz y frijol, las ventas y sus ingresos han aumentado, su familia tiene nuevos miembros y vive en mejores circusntancias.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to buy insecticides, fertilizers, compost and seeds to prepare his land and continue to harvest a good-quality produce.

With the previous loan, his corn and beans production improved, and his sales and his income increased. His family has now new members and their living conditions are better now.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, compost and seeds.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Diema Group

texts.fr:
DIEMA est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKAFO de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfant, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente des produits cosmétique  à l’image de KADIA  qui est la première  personne assise à droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente des produits cosmétique : parfums, crème à lèvre et savon.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a six ans. Elles sont à leur huitième  prêt solidaire. 
KADIA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  TIELE, excelle dans la vente des produits  cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  20 cartons de parfum et 20 cartons de savon.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  TIELE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et  réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente des produits cosmétique.
texts.en:
The Diema group belongs to the Siguikafo association in Tiele. It includes women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 40 years old, married with five children.

They conduct various activities such as the retail trade of cosmetics like Kadia, who is the first person sitting at the right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Tiele, in the Baguineda sub-district (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand with their cosmetic-trading activities: perfumes, lip balms and soap.

To satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided six years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their eighth group loan.

Kadia, who is the president of the group and very well known in Tiele, excels in selling cosmetics. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 cartons of perfumes and 20 cartons of soap. She resupplies from wholesalers in Bamako and locally, and retails her products in Tiele, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 22,500 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the remainder in her cosmetics-trading activities.

loans.use: buy cosmetics

loans.name: Fotemogoba Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBA est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDIA de N TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de BINTOU  qui est la première personne assise de droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités activité d’achat vente de condiments : choux, tomate et oignon.   
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a un an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
BINTOU, qui est un membre  du groupe et très connue à  N'TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 paniers de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et le reste réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
The Fotemogoba group belongs to the Siguidia association in N'Tentou. It includes women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 37 years old, married with four children.

They conduct various activities such as the retail trading of condiments like Bintou, who is the first person sitting from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in N'Tentou, in the Kati district (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand with their condiment-trading activities: cabbages, tomatoes and onions.

To satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided one year ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their second group loan.

Bintou, who is a group member and very well known in N'Tentou, excels in selling condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes. She resupplies from wholesalers in Bamako and locally, and retails her products in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the remainder in her condiment-trading activities.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, Margi cubes, pepper, tomatoes, etc. at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that her own hard work has enabled her to greatly increase her income and help her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy bales of clothes for resale. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, soap, hair-grease, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 22 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de plátanos, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad y los buenos precios, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de plátanos por mayor y así poder seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This client is 22 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has been selling bananas for a living for a few years. She sells her products in different markets near where she lives. She has a lot of customers because of the quality and good value of her products.

She is requesting a loan to buy bananas in bulk so that she can continue selling them and obtaining a profit, which allows her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: compra de plátanos por mayor

loans.name: Jesus Es El Camino Y La Verdad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS ES EL CAMINO Y LA VERDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas ella es casada y tiene 37 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
La socia que esta tapado con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Jesus es el Camino y la Verdad.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Jesus es el Camino y la Verdad”, which is located in the Anta district in Anta province in Cusco department. 

Felicitas, 37, is a member and is married and has four children. She has her own business raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens, fattens them, and then sells them in various fairs. This small business has allowed her to provide for her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she could sell the guinea pigs and chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the animals.

The member that has a circle over her face on the picture no longer belongs to the communal bank “Jesus es el Camino y la Verdad”.

Felicitas thanks those who share her dream, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Letticia

texts.en:
Leticia has managed to enlarge the size of her vegetable garden from one eighth of an acre to a quarter of an acre since she received her Kiva loan. As a result, her sales have also increased. Leticia sells produce from her thriving tomato and bean garden mostly to nearby schools and church gatherings. She has also started a poultry business and keeps a hundred chickens. 

These businesses have enabled her to make enough profits to pay school fees for her son and seven nieces. Since Leticia’s father passed away, she has been the family’s primary breadwinner. Leticia continues to care for her widowed aging mother and her late sisters’ seven children. Her mother testified that the family is now eating well since Leticia’s garden and poultry business is bringing in enough money for her to support all of them. She has even bought seven goats which she intends to breed and sell for meat. She did however have a small portion of her vegetables destroyed by parasites and has challenges with customers who buy items on credit and fail to pay their credit back on time. Leticia aspires to open a shop at the main market and also sell groceries in addition to the vegetables and chickens she currently sells.

loans.use: to open a shop at the market

loans.name: El 21 Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres socios exitosos, coordinado por la señora Ingrid de 25 años de edad, casada, y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 6 años y 18 meses, se dedica a comercializar ropa de segunda en los departamentos del país, desde hace dos años, el crédito lo requiere para la compra pacas e invertir en calzado para damas y caballeros. Otra de las socias es la señora Yuri de 29 años de edad dedicada a la venta de ropa de segunda en los mercados y el señor Zacarías de 30 años, quién comercializa productos relacionados al maíz como es la chicha, pinol, pinolillo, etc.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 successful members. Mrs. Ingrid is the coordinator. She is 25 years old, married and has two children. One of them is 6 years old and the other is 18 months old.

She has been selling second-hand clothes for 2 years, in various departments of the country. She needs a loan to buy bundles of clothes and to invest in women’s and men’s shoes.

The other members are Mrs. Yuri, 29, who also sells second-hand clothes in markets, and Mr. Zacarías, 30, who sells corn products (chicha, pinol, pinolillo, etc.).

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes and women’s and men’s shoes.

loans.name: Etty

texts.en:
Etty’s grocery store is doing very well. She has managed to stock it with the basic commodities that people in her village need. More clients are attracted to her shop now that she has a large stock of products. She has seen an increase in sales and profits and is managing to pay shop rentals of $70 per month. With her profits, she bought furniture for her home, paid school fees for her three siblings, and started a poultry business to further increase her income. 

There are now new competitors who have opened shops in the same area. Etty is working hard to make sure that this does not impact her business. To do this, she ensures that she has a variety of commodities in her shop and she has also added clothing in one corner of her grocery shop. Etty plans to go to college to improve her education and also to build a house for her family from the profits her business is making.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of products for her shop

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Hello, this is Salamatu, a business woman from Waterloo in northern Freetown. She is married to a man who works in the local area. They have five children. 

Salamatu started her business to take care of her family. She sells palm oil in a nearby town. Palm oil is heavily relied upon in local homes as it is the base for spicy local (and affordable) stews such as ‘crain-crain’ or ‘rice and cassava leaf’. She works from 8.00 am to 6.30 pm and then tends to her family. Even though Salamatu is proud of her business, it faces challenges in the form of poor transportation infrastructure in the area. This makes travelling to purchase stock or reaching new markets slow and expensive. 

Salamatu would like to use this loan to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon). This will allow her business to remain profitable. She would like to thank BRAC Sierra Leone and all Kiva lenders for helping her and her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es: Carmen de 50 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de pecado, adicional a eso también se dedica  a la agricultura y crianza de cerdos, con su trabajo logra solventar y a salir adelante con los gastos de hogar, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes le ayudan en el negocio y en la agricultura, Carmen está solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo para poder comprar pescado por mayor y poder seguir con su trabajo ya que donde ella reside se realiza ese tipo de comercio y por esa razón posee mucha clientela y así podrá tener mejores ingresos y darle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old. She has been selling fish for a living for a few years. In addition, she is also a farmer and raises pigs. With her work, she manages to get ahead and cover the household expenses. She lives in her own house, with two children that help her with her business and with farming.

Carmen is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy fish in bulk so that she can continue selling it. In the area where she lives this is a common business, which is why she has a lot of customers. With this loan, she will have a higher income and will be able to give her children a better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Victor Manuel
