texts.es: Victor de 57 años de edad se dedica a trabajar de mecánico automotriz desde hace 30 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad del trabajo que realiza, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logar cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus hijos, Victor está solicitando un crédito para la compra de herramientas y llantas usadas y nuevas para poder seguir con su trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Victor is 57 years old. He has worked as an auto mechanic for 30 years. His business is located in his residence. He has a lot of clientele because of the quality of work he does. With what he earns from his job he covers some of the household expenses. He lives in his own home with his life's companion and their children. Victor is asking for a loan to buy new and used tires and tools to be able to continue with his work and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy used and new tires and tools.

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dolores, se dedica a la venta frutas y verduras desde hace cinco años, por su experiencia su negocio le genera la rentabilidad que necesita para salir adelante con sus compromisos. La Sra.: Dolores es casada y madre tres hijos de 21, 19 y 15 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa propia.
El financiamiento lo utilizara para surtir de mercadería frescas su negocio así como también tener otro tipo de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, comprara papayas, zapotes, pepinos, ejotes, güisquiles, mangos, café, arroz, maíz y frijol.
Su objetivo es mantener su negocio funcionando para que su situación económica le permita ofrecer a sus hijos la oportunidad de asistir a la universidad para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Dolores has worked selling fruits and vegetables for five years. Due to her experience, her business generates the profits necessary to get ahead with her commitments. Dolores is married and the mother of three children, aged 21, 19 and 15. She lives with her family in their own home.

She will use the loan to stock up on fresh merchandise in her business, as well as have other products to offer her customers. She will buy papayas, squash, cucumbers, green beans, chayotes, mangos, coffee, rice, corn and beans.

Her goal is to keep her business running so that her financial situation will allow her to offer her children a chance to go to college so they can have good jobs.

loans.use: to buy papayas, squash, cucumbers, green beans, chayotes, mangos, coffee, rice,corn and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 25 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, es un joven muy trabajador, responsable y honesto, siembra está buscando la manera de poder ayudar a su familia en los gasto del hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. asi como lo muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poder seguir ayudando a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Our client is a 25-year old farmer.  He's pictured in the photo with a sprayer that he's used to maintain his crop.  Our client is a hard-working and responsible young man.  He lives with his extended family in a house that they own.  Our client grows maize to earn the money he needs to support his family and he is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs: seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicides, etc.  The investment will allow him to carry on his business and, in turn, generate an income that will provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Ana Yansi

texts.es: Ana de 31 años de edad desde hace 7 años decidió poner una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia que con gran esfuerzo la ha mantenido activa hasta la fecha, posee mucha clientela por la variedad y la calidad de los productos así como también los buenos precios,  ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, granos básicos, detergentes, papel higiénico, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y más productos para surtir a un mas la tienda y así obtener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Ana is 31 years old. Seven years ago, she decided to open a small store in her residence. With great effort, she has kept it active so far. She has a lot of customers because of the variety and quality of the products as well as the good prices. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. Ana is asking for a loan to buy soups, basic grains, detergent, toilet paper, snacks, beverages, etc. in order to stock her store more and obtain more income to giver her family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy soups, basic grains, detergent, toilet paper, snacks, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Solidario Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres socios todos exitosos, el coordinador es el señor Gloddys de 39 años de edad, acompañado y padre de tres hijos de las edades de 14, 13 y 6 años, comerciante de cerdo, este socio se dedica al destace de cerdo  y venta de nacatamales desde hace 5 años, cuenta con la ayuda de su compañera para la comercialización y destace del cerdo, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de cerdos en pie y materia prima para los nacatamales como es hojas, mecates, arroz, papa, maíz, achote, naranja agria, etc, el socio obtuvo crédito un ciclo anterior y las mejoras fueron notorias, debido a que obtuvo mayores ganancias que las que él  esperaba, esto lo motivó a seguir prestando en esta institución financiera. Las otras socias del grupo son la señora Esvelida de 46 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de comida en su domicilio los fines de semanas y la señora Gloribel de 19 años comerciante de calzado para damas y niñas y pantalones por encargo en lugares cercanos a su comunidad y las zonas francas cercanas.
texts.en: This community bank has three members, all of whom have built successful businesses.  The coordinator, Sr. Gloddys, 39, is partnered and the father of three children, 14-, 13-, and 6-years old, respectively.  He operates two businesses, raising and butchering pigs for sale and selling nacatamales.  He has operated the businesses for 5 years and his wife helps him butcher and sell his pigs.  Sr. Gloddys will use part of this loan to buy pigs and the rest to buy the supplies he needs--wraps, string, rice, potatoes, maize, etc.--to make nacatameles.  He borrowed money during the last lending cycle and the results of his investment were even better than he hoped, results that he hopes to repeat with this new round of funding.  The other members of the community bank are Sra. Esvelida, 46, who has a part-time food-sales business and Sra. Gloribel, 19, who has a clothing and shoes sales business.

loans.use: to carry on his animals and food sales businesses.

loans.name: Santa Martha Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres socias exitosas, coordinado por la señora Jazmina de 34 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 14 y 15 años, se dedica a la venta de ojuelas en las calles de su barrio y comunidades cercanas, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de quintal de harina, aceite y bolsa, azúcar, entre otras esta socia elabora el producto y luego lo comercializa y no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie más que la de ella, con créditos anteriores logrado mejoras personales y la compra de productos para el hogar como es la compra de sillas mesedoras, minicomponentes y mejoras de la vivienda. Las otras socias son la señora María de 35 años de edad comerciante de hojuelas en las calles de su comunidad y la señora Lidia de 39 años de edad quién elabora artesanías textilera en su domicilio.
texts.en: The group is made up of three successful members. It is coordinated by Jazmina, who is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of two children, aged 14 and 15. She sells hojuela pastries in her neighborhood and in nearby communities. she is going to invest the loan in buying a quintal of flour, oil, bags, sugar, and more. She makes the products and later sells it. She doesn't have anyone else who helps her. With the previous loans she was able to make some personal improvements and buy products for the home, such as rocking chairs and mini-components and home improvements. The other members are María, aged 35, who sells hojuelas in the streets of her community, and Lidia aged 39, who makes handmade textile crafts in her home.

loans.use: to buy a quintal of flour, oil, bags, sugar, and more.

loans.name: Maria Edith

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, a pesar de ser una personan de la tercera edad lucha por salir adelante con su familia hace varios años decidió poner un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, el cual le ha dado buenos resultados y muy buenas ganancias, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia pero también sale a vender por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de se casa. Posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que ella brinda a la hora de vender, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor y también comprar huevos ya que es un producto que se vende con mucha facilidad, para obtener mejores ganancias y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 55 lives with her extended family in a house that they own.  Despite her age, she's still working hard to push the family ahead.  She has operated a fruits and vegetables sales business for several years and says that she has earned a good living from it.  She mainly operates the business from her house but also works as a street vendor, going out to nearby neighborhoods to sell her merchandise there.  Her customers buy from her, she says, because her prices are fair and because she always has a friendly word for them.  Maria is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of fruits, vegetables and eggs, products that she says are always easy to sell.  The investment will allow her to carry on her business and, in turn, provide for her family.

loans.use: to stock her fruits and vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 13 años de edad. Rosa posee una pequeña tienda en su hogar de habitación la cual le permite percibir ingresos para apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Rosa es una mujer visionaria con mucho entusiasmo de seguir luchando para salir adelante. Rosa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso del corredor de la vivienda dado que actualmente es de tierra y desea dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en: Rosa, 50, and her husband live with their 13-year old son in a house that they own.  Rosa has a small corner shop in a space at her house that provides an extra income for the family.  She's shown that she has great vision and a strong drive to pull the family up.  She's applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to buy the materials she needs--cement, sand, gravel--to lay a cement floor.  The house has a dirt floor now and the investment will improve the family's standard of living.  Rosa hopes the loan will come through quickly so that she can begin the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy materials for laying a cement floor.

loans.name: Silvia Esperanza

texts.es: Silvia de 34 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Silvia solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, who is 34 years old, has made a living for several years selling tortillas in her home. She works from Monday to Sunday and has a lot of customers, as she is hard-working and friendly. With the profits she makes she is able to cover the household expenses.

Silvia is asking for a loan to buy corn by the quintal so she can carry on making her tortillas and thus make better profits, so she and her family can have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael de 64 años de edad, no estudio ningún grado ya que sus padres fallecieron cundo el era un niño y se crio con unos tíos, los cuales solo lo pusieron a trabajar, y debido a muchas circunstancias decidió no casarse por lo que ninguna persona depende de él.


Rafael actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y lo ha hecho desde que era un niño, lo aprendió de parte de sus tíos, pues a esto mismo se dedicaban ellos. Se levanta a las 4:00 am y se traslada a donde tiene la parcela donde trabaja, hora de salida no tiene pues hasta que termina lo programado para ese día regresa a su casa.


Con el dinero del préstamo comprara dos novillas que dentro de un año serán vacas, también pagara el alquilar de las tierras donde va a trabajar este año.


Rafael sueña con tener suficiente ganado, para ya no tener que trabajar en la agricultura, pues a su edad se le hace cada vez más difícil, está confiado en que Dios le dará las fuerzas para hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rafael is 64 years old and has had no education whatsoever, because his parents died when he was a boy and he was brought up by aunts and uncles who just made him work. For lots of reasons, he decided not to get married, and so no-one is dependent on him.  Rafael currently works in agriculture and has done this since he was a boy. He learnt from his aunts and uncles, as this was what they did.

He gets up at 4am and goes to the land where he works. He does not have a defined finishing time, and returns home when he has finished the work he had planned to do that day. 

He will use the loan to buy two heifers which will become cows within a year. He will also pay the rent on the land where he is going to work this year.

Rafael's dream is to have enough livestock so that he does not have to work in agriculture, as this is getting more and more difficult at his age. He trusts that God will give him the strength to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy two heifers which will become cows within a year.

loans.name: María Del Transito

texts.es:
María de 44 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos no estudio ningún grado, ya que sus padres le decían que solo el trabajo le serviría. Esta soltera ya que su compañero de vida los abandono, los tres hijos viven con ella por lo que ellos dependen de su persona.


María tiene una tienda en su casa  desde hace unos 10 años, además lava ropa ajena por lo que es un dinero extra y lo ha hecho desde que era niña. No tiene una hora de entrada ni salida, por lo que es difícil decir a que hora descansa ya que el trabajo de la casa es el más pesado.


El dinero del préstamo será invertido en la tienda, comprara jugos, arroz, frijoles, detergentes, golosinas, etc. ya que por los escasos productos hay momentos que no vende lo que los clientes necesitan.


Los sueños de María son ver realizados a sus hijos, poder darles todo lo que necesiten así como el estudio necesario para que puedan tener un buen trabajo, sabe que solo ella los puede ayudar;  pero confía en Dios que le dará fuerza para ver cumplidos sus sueños.
texts.en:
María, 44 years old, does not have any studies, as due to her limited economic resources her parents told her that work was the only thing which would be of any use to her. She is single as her partner abandoned her and their three children, who live with and depend on her.


María has had a shop in her house for around 10 years, and also washes other people's clothes to earn extra money, which she has been doing since she was a girl. She doesn't have a starting or finishing time, so it is difficult to say what time she gets to rest at, especially as the housework is the most hard-going.


The money from the loan will be invested in the shop. She will buy juices, rice, beans, detergents, sweets, etc. because due to the limited products she stocks there are times when she is not selling what the customers need.


María's dreams are to see her children succeed, to be able to give them all that they need, such as the necessary studies to get a good job. She knows that only she can help them, but she trusts in God to give her the strength to accomplish her dreams.

loans.use: to buy juices, rice, beans, detergents, sweets etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Virtudes Del Pilar

texts.es: Virtudes de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, desde hace varios años  que Virtudes se dedica al oficio de corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos, y agujas, para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y no perder la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras, para tener junto a su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Virtudes is 39 years old and lives with her husband who is a farmer. It has been several years since Virtudes began her work as a dressmaker, during which time she has gained a great deal of experience as well as regular customers. She is a very responsible person who works conscientiously to give the best of herself.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She will use the money to buy more raw materials such as fabric, buttons, thread, and needles. This will allow her to better serve her customers and not lose out on any opportunities to earn extra income so she and her husband can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha, la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz para preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha continues in the business of selling chicha, a beverage made from corn. She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. and does very well. She has been doing this for a number of years now. Her dream is to expand her chicha sales business and she is requesting the loan to buy more corn to make chicha. 

Martha is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn so she can make chicha, a beverage made from corn.

loans.name: Lluvia De Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo está coordinado por la señora Ninoska de 29 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 10 años y un bebé de 9 meses, ofrece variedad de productos como es caramelos que se elaboran en la ciudad, plantas, hamacas y lo que se le encarga, los distribuye en la región norte del país, y el crédito lo requiere para la compra de hamacas  y mecedoras que le han encargado, de esta manera aumentará sus ventas y por ende las ganancias, con las ganancias del crédito anterior hizo mejoras en su vivienda. Las otras socias son la señora Xiomara de 46 años de edad, comerciante de plantas, artesanías y especies como el romero, manzanilla, clavo de olor, linaza, entre otros, la señora Waleska de 26 años de edad comerciante de caramelos, plantas y artesanías, y la señora Luisa de 54 años quién ofrece plantas y variedad de artesanías en los diversos mercados del país.
texts.en:
This group is led by 29-year-old Ninoska, who has a partner and two children, one aged 10 and a baby of 9 months. She sells a range of products, such as the sweets which are made in the city, plants, hammocks and items which are ordered from her. She sells these in the northern part of the country.

She needs the loan to buy hammocks and rocking chairs which she has orders for. In this way she will increase her sales and therefore her profits. She used the profits from the previous loan to carry out some home improvements. 

The other members are Xiomara, aged 46, who sells plants, handicrafts and spices such as rosemary, camomile, cloves, linseed and others. Waleska, who is 26 years old, sells sweets, plants and handicrafts, while 54-year-old Luisa sells plants and a variety of handicrafts in various markets around the country.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts such as hammocks, vases and rocking chairs.

loans.name: Vilma Isabel

texts.es: Vilma de 43 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, pastelitos de carne, tamales, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, gracias a las ventas que realiza y a la ayuda de su esposo  han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Vilma pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los tamales, platanos, verduras y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and works at making and selling snacks such as french fries, fried yucca, turnovers, meat pastries, tamales, etc. from her stand which is near her house. She lives in her own house with her husband and four children. Thanks to her sales and the help of her husband, they have managed to cover their household expenses.

Vilma is asking for financing so she can buy the ingredients she uses to make her snacks such as oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, plantains, vegetables, etc. This will allow her to continue to maintain her home and cover all the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es: Sandra tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 15 años, 17 años, 13 años y 10 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sandra y su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y dar mejores condiciones de vida. Sandra se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 4 años aproximadamente. Tiene muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más gracias a los ricos e higiénicos tamales  que ofrece. Ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un pequeño cuarto para la cocina para lo cual necesita materiales como lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Sandra is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and four children, aged 17, 15, 13 and 10 years old and currently in school. Sandra and her husband work very hard to help their children to get ahead and to offer them better living conditions. Sandra has been working selling tamales for around four years. She has many customers who come back to her every day because of the clean and delicious tamales that she sells. Sandra has taken the decision to apply for a loan from "FUSAI" as she wishes to build a small room to install a kitchen. To do this she needs to buy laminated metal sheeting, wood and nails.

loans.use: to buy laminated metal sheeting, wood and nails in order to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  de 65 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos no tuvo ningún grado de estudio, ya que era el segundo de 8 hermanos y debido a su alta pobreza tenia que ayudar a sus padres a trabajar, esta casado y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar.
 

Manuel trabaja en la agricultura y lo ha hecho por toda su vida, ya que desde niño su padre le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura, a parte de trabajar en la agricultura compra y vende ganado eso le genera un dinero extra al año, hora de entrada no tiene debido a que en la agricultura no se puede decir a que hora se va a salir cuando lo que se trabaja es propio, se traslada junto con sus hijos al campo y hacen un recorrido de 3 kilómetros en bicicleta.

En la tarde cuando regresan tiene que cuidar el ganado, por lo que es difícil decir a que hora sale a descansar. 

El dinero del préstamo sera invertido en alquilar las tierras donde trabajara este año, ya que en este tiempo es donde empiezan a limpiar las tierras para el cultivo, también comprara un novillo que dentro de un año lo podrá estar vendiendo.
 
Manuel sueña con ver realizados a sus hijos que ellos puedan tener todo lo que él no tuvo, poder tener suficiente ganado para ya no trabajar en la agricultura; porque él sabe que a su edad es cada día mas difícil;  pero esta seguro que con la ayuda de DIOS y su esfuerzo lo podrá hacer posible.
texts.en:
Manuel is 65 years old and has no studies due to his limited economic resources. He was the second of eight children and due to their high level of poverty he had to help his parents with their work. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household chores.
 
Manuel works in agriculture, and has done for his whole life, since his father showed him how to do this work when he was a child. Apart from this he also buys and sells livestock, which gives him extra money throughout the year. He does not have normal working hours as it is hard to say with the agriculture job what time he will be able to leave. He travels to the land by bicycle with his children, which is a 3km journey.

When he returns in the afternoon he has to look after the livestock, so it is difficult to say what time he gets to rest. 

The money from the loan will be invested in paying the rent of the land where he will work this year, as this time of year is when they start to prepare the land for crops. He will also buy a bullock which he will be able to sell within a year.
 
Manuel dreams of seeing his children succeed and have all that he didn't have, and of having enough livestock to be able to stop working in agriculture, because he knows that at his age it becomes more and more difficult. He is sure that with the help of God and his own effort he can make it possible.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where he will work this year.

loans.name: Nicarao Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está integrado por cuatros socios exitosos en su trabajo, coordinado por el señor Ángel de 49 años de edad, casado y padre de cinco hijos unas gemelas de 13 años, uno de 21, 17 años y un bebé de 18 meses, es propietario de una panadería en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó un año atrás, este negocio lo ha motivado para solicitar el crédito en esta institución, para invertirlo en la compra de sartenes, harina, margarina, aceite, huevos y levadura. Los otros socios son la señora Zenaira de 40 años que elabora nacatamales y buñuelos para luego comercializarlos, la señora Flor de 38 años docente y comerciante de productos Arabela y AVON, el señor Ismael de 22 años dedicado a comercializar ropa americana en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group has four members who are all successful in their work. The group is coordinated by 49-year-old Angel who is married and has 13-year-old twins, and three other children, aged 21 and 17 year old, and 18 months. Angel runs a bakery out of his home. He started this business a year ago and he has decided to take out a loan to invest in pans, flour, margarine, oil, eggs and yeast.

The other members of this group are: 40-year-old Zenaira, who makes tamales and fritters to sell; Flor is 38-years-old and works as a teacher as well as selling Arabela and Avon cosmetics; and Ismael is 22 years old and sells American clothes from his home.

loans.use: to buy pans, flour, margarine, oil, eggs and yeast.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal and fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es: Este grupo está integrado por cinco socios trabajadores, coordinado por la señora Juana de 41 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos, dependiendo de ella solamente el menor de 19 años, la socia se dedicada a la venta de granos básicos en su domicilio y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para la comercialización de los productos, el crédito lo invertirá en productos como es el quintal de arroz, de frijoles, azúcar, bidón de aceite, pan y tortas, impulsó este negocio desde hace dos años. Los otros socios son la señora Ana de 33 años propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, el señor Gilberto de 31 años dedicado al negocio de la pesca, el señor Miguel de 40 años dedicado al negocio del destace de cerdo y la señora Elia de 22 años de edad comerciante de pescado en la municipalidad.
texts.en:
This group has five hard-working members and is coordinated by 41-year-old Juana. She is married and a mother to three children. The only child that is dependent on Juana is her 19-year-old son. Juana makes a living selling basic grains out of her home. She receives help from her husband to sell the items. This loan will be invested in items such as a hundredweight of rice, beans, sugar, oil, bread and cakes. Juana started this business two years ago.

The other members of this group are: 33-year-old Ana who owns a grocery store in her home; Gilberto, 31 years old, who has a fishing business; 40-year-old Miguel, who works slaughtering pigs; and 22-year-old Elia, a fishmonger in the local municipality.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, such as rice and beans, sugar, oil, bread and more.

loans.name: Jessica Viviana

texts.es:
La niña jessica Viviana, profesional en el cargo de Auxiliar de Enfermería para ayudar a las comunidades con respecto a lo que se enfoque con salud, enfermos o personas  que necesiten la ayuda de ella, en una sola palabra colaborar a la comunidad, cumplir las metas, sacando adelante los conocimientos para que la familia de ella se sienta muy orgullosa, no para los demás si no para ella misma, así mismo dará sostenimiento
Económico, moral y cultural a la familia, 
crecerá intelectualmente, será mejor persona y hará la diferencia ante la comunidad, ya que la profesión como tal lo exige no es ayudar ni mucho menos colaborar, si no tener amor al trabajo y sentido de pertenencia, colaborar es de muchos y hacerlo es de pocos. 

Pertenecer a la institución campo alto le ayudara y favorecerá a Jessica a realizar y cumplir los sueños, ya que viene soñando desde la adolescencia, por eso ella requiere esta ayuda para cumplir los sueños de pertenecer al gran mundo de enfermera,  que con esfuerzo y dedicación se puede lograr o si se pude hacer realidad, por eso Jessica quiere que le den la oportunidad de pertenecer al convenio kiva para poder realizar el sueño, ya que no tiene los recursos necesarios para pagar toda la cuota que le piden, por eso necesita el descuento de kiva, para poder pagar un precio más justo y necesario porque tiene otras  obligaciones y ella quiere seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Jessica Viviana is undertaking professional studies for the position of Nursing Assistant, in order to help sick people and anyone else that needs her help. In other words, to contribute to the community, complete her goals, and improve her knowledge so that her family feels proud, not for others but for herself, and through this she will give economic, moral and cultural support to her family. She will grow intellectually, become a better person, and make a difference in the community, in a profession that demands not just help or contribution, but love for the job and a sense of belonging that few people have. 

Belonging to the Campo Alto institution will help Jessica to achieve the dreams she has had since she was a teenager. She requires help, which along with her own effort and dedication, will allow her to achieve her goal of belonging to the great world of nursing. Jessica hopes to be given the opportunity to have an agreement with Kiva in order to achieve this dream, as she doesn't have the necessary resources to pay the whole fee and needs a discount to be able to pay a more fair price. This is necessary for her because she has other obligations, but wants to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay one semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: Julio de 44 años de edad se dedica a la  agricultura principalmente a la siembra de maíz, adicional a esos también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, vive en casa propia con esposa y sus tres hijos de 19, 4 y 1 año, comercializa sus productos  en los alrededores de la zona, Julio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, herbicidas, control de plagas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. para poder continuar con sus siembras y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Julio is 44 years old and makes a living in farming, mainly growing corn. He also raises cattle. Julio owns his house and lives there with his wife and their three children, aged nineteen, four and one years old respectively. Julio sells his products in the surrounding areas. Julio is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, weedkillers, anti-disease treatments, manure, fertilisers and more. He is taking out this loan so as to continue with his crops and earn higher profits and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, weedkillers, anti-disease treatments, manure, fertilisers and more.

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es: Milagro tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 29 años de edad quien es jornalero y su hija de 12 años de edad. Milagro se dedica a la venta de tamales y productos de primera necesidad desde hace mucho tiempo. Es una mujer trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a sus hijos. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño y para encementar el piso de la vivienda el cual es de tierra. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento y así poder hacer la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Milagro is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her son, a 29-year-old labourer, and her 12-year-old daughter. Milagro has been making a living selling tamals and staple goods for a long time. She is hard-working and has put in a lot of effort to help her children to get ahead. In order to improve her living conditions, Milagro has taken the decision to apply for this loan from "FUSAI", which she will invest in building a bathroom and cementing the earth floor in her home. This loan will be used to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks. Milagro hopes to receive this loan and to start work as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks in order to cement the floor in her home and to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia es una mujer trabajadora y exitosa en su negocio, tiene la edad de 32 años, acompañada, se dedica a comercializar repuestos de celular y venta de CD y DVD, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 6 años y el crédito lo requiere para invertir en productos como baterías para celular, carcazas, protectores para celular, compra de CD musicales, y películas en DVD por mayor. Con los créditos anteriores esta socia ha podido aumentar la mercadería por lo que ha obtenido mayores beneficios, esto le ha podido ayudar a hacer mejoras en su negocio y en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Sonia is a hard-working woman and is successful in her business. She is 32 years old and has a partner. She makes a living selling spares for mobile phones and selling CDs and DVDs. She has had this business for 6 years. She needs the loan to buy products such as mobile phone batteries, fascias and covers and to buy music CDs and DVD films wholesale.

With the previous loans this borrower was able to increase her stock and so has made better profits. This has helped her to make improvements in her business and her home.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone batteries, fascias and covers, music CDs and films on DVD.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession, madame Kossiwa après avoir fini sa formation, a ouvert son atelier dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé. En plus de son métier, elle revend des mèches, tissages à ses clients. N'arrivant plus à les satisfaire à cause du manque d'argent, elle sollicite un quatrième crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Son souhait à l'avenir, est d'avoir d'autres points de vente et fonder une famille financièrement stable. Kossiwa âgée de 32ans est mariée avec une ancienneté de 10ans dans l'activité.
texts.en:
A professional hairdresser, Kossiwa opened her salon in a neighbourhood in Lomé after completing her training. 

Alongside her main business, she sells hair extensions and weaves to her customers. As she is unable to satisfy customer demand due to lack of funds, she is requesting a fourth loan to enable her to buy more products. 

In the future, Kossiwa hopes to open other sales locations and start a family in financially stable circumstances. She is 32 years old and married, and has been running her business for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: Jose de 43 años desde hace 28 años que se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de maíz y frijol, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, abonos, etc. y  mejorar el  terreno donde desea continuar con sus siembras  y así poder tener  mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 years old and for the last 28 years has made a living from agriculture, mainly growing corn and beans. He lives in his own house with his wife and children. He sells his produce at the markets near his home and has a lot of customers because of the quality of his produce and his good prices.

Jose is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, weedkiller, manure etc. and to improve the land where he wants to continue growing his crops. In this way he will be able to improve his income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, weedkiller, manure etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas pupusas, posee mucha clientela ya que cuando de pupusas se trata ella tiene las mejores y con los precios más accesibles, ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio ya que su sueño es verlo crecer de manera que pueda así mejorar su calidad de vida. Piensa invertir en la materia prima necesaria como: maíz, arroz, chicharon, queso, frijoles, tomates, repollo, etc. de esta manera espera lograr su sueño y poder dar a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Vilma is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her children. She earns a living making and selling tasty pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans]. She has a lot of customers because when it comes to pupusas, hers are the best and are the most affordable.

She has decided to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business, since it is her dream to see it grow in such a way that she can improve her quality of life. She plans to use the loan to buy raw ingredients such as corn, rice, pork rind, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage etc. By doing this she hopes to achieve her dream and be able to give her family a better opportunity in life with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, pork rind, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, and other items

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg 1 Group

texts.en:
Maa Santoshi SHG self-help group consists of eleven women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves and share their problems and to solve their problems among them. All the members of this group are engaged in different business activities like selling milk, flower plants, fish, etc., so that they can make money to better help and support their families. 

One of them is Belamati, who was selected as the president of this self-help group. The lady standing with a raised hand in the photo is Belamati. Belamati is 29 years old and is living with her husband and her two children. She hopes to build a house for her family. She has a four-acre plot of land in her village, and she is using her land in paddy (rice) cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

Belamati has requested a loan of 165,000 Indian rupees (INR) for her group. She will use her portion to purchase the required resources for paddy cultivation. She says her portion of the loan will help her to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, salt, onion, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu, a 45-year-old woman from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has four children. 

For 30 years, Isatu has run her clothing material business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., seven days per week. She says that her business is doing well.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a plot of land. In the future, Isatu plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Tania Dayanna

texts.es:
Tania es una señorita que en estos momentos  está cursando grado once y al mismo tiempo está haciendo un técnico laboral auxiliar en Administración Hotelera en una Institución Educativa muy prestigiosa, ella lo hace con el fin de salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida, escogió ese programa porque le llama la atención y porque le es fácil socializarse y servirle a la gente, quiere conocer muchos lugares y le apasiona conocer nuevas culturas. 
Tania y la madre son unas mujeres muy unidas y emprendedoras en el trascurso de toda la vida ambas han tenido que luchar y pasar varios obstáculos ya que el padre desde siempre se ha desentendido de las responsabilidades del hogar y no le ha ayudado con nada  a la madre, a ella le toca sola y  hace lo que puede, se esfuerza mucho para que la hija salga adelante y tenga un buen futuro. Tanía vende dulces en el colegio y eventualmente trabaja en una panadería los fines de semana porque considera que de esta manera contribuye un poco a disminuir los gastos del hogar, le queda muy difícil debido a que tiene que responder académicamente tanto en el colegio como en la Institución, pero tiene claro que debe luchar por alcanzar los sueños. 
Ella está aprendiendo mucho con el programa de administración hotelera, siente que está cumpliendo el sueño  y que estos conocimientos le van a abrir muchas puertas en el camino por esta razón quiere seguir con los estudios pero le es un poco difícil a ella y a la madre pagar el semestre el presupuesto no les alcanza y es por esto que necesitan la ayuda de Kiva.
texts.en:
Tania is a young lady who is currently in 11th grade and at the same time is doing a technical assistant program in Hotel Administration at a very prestigious educational institution. She is doing this so she can get ahead and make something of herself. She selected this program because it appealed to her given her ease at socializing and serving people. She wants to travel to many places and is passionate about learning about new cultures.

Tania and her mother are very enterprising and supportive of one another. Throughout their lives they have had to fight and overcome various obstacles. Her father has always ignored his responsibilities to his family and has offered no help to her mother who has had to shoulder all the responsibility. She does what she can and works hard so her daughter can get ahead and have a good future.

Tania sells candy at school and works at a bakery on weekends so that she can contribute a little towards the household expenses, but it is hard for her because she has her academic responsibilities at school and at the hotel administration program. But she knows that she must fight to attain her dreams.

She is learning a great deal in the hotel administration program. She feels that she is accomplishing her goal and that her knowledge will open many doors along the way. This is why she wants to continue with her studies, but it is difficult for her and her mother to pay the tuition and that is why she is asking for Kiva's help.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for one semester.

loans.name: Tsvakai

texts.en:
Tsvakai’s poultry business is booming thanks to the Kiva loan she received. She keeps batches of 100 chickens that she sells to her community members and a local boarding school. Her life has improved greatly as a result of her growing business. She is managing to buy clothes for herself, her husband and their two children. Her diet has also improved and she is now a very happy person who has the confidence to invite visitors to her home since she now has enough food to feed them.

Tsvakai intends to continue to grow her business to 200 chickens per batch. She wants to open a Take Away shop where she will sell rice, sadza and chicken from her poultry business. She is planning on sending her children to a good school, preferably a boarding school. She also plans to buy a residential stand in the Growth Point of her home area and also to write her final secondary school examination so she can train as a teacher, which is her passion.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and open a fast food shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, groundnuts, beans, bananas, and plantains

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
LOLO est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDIA de N'TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de FATOUMATA  qui est la première  personne assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate, choux et poivre. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a un an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à  N'TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité importante de condiments alimentaire de différente sorte (tomate, choux et poivre).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et  réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Lolo Group is part of the Siguidia Association in N'tentou. It is made up of married women who are relations and neighbours, with an average age of 35 and four children on average.

The women run various businesses such as selling produce, like Fatoumata, who is pictured sitting on the far right. They live in large traditional families in N'tentou, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region,  Mali). They have been running their businesses for several years and are highly sought after for the produce they sell: tomatoes, cabbages and pepper.

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme a year ago. This is their second solidarity loan.

Fatoumata, a member of the group and very well-known in N'tentou, is good at selling produce. She will use her loan to buy a large quantity of different types of produce (tomatoes, cabbages and pepper). She buys her supplies in Bamako and directly from wholesalers and sells them to male and female customers in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit.

Fatoumata hopes to make 15,000 CFA francs a month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Yojana Del Socorro

texts.es: Yojana es una joven madre soltera con 4 hijos, tiene bajo su cargo a los dos menores de edad, se gana la vida como cocinera en un comedor ubicado en un mercado de Managua. Yojana solicita su primer crédito con el que busca mejorar las condiciones de su humilde hogar, desea entechar el porche de la casa para ir ocupando ese espacio tan importante para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yojana is a young single mother with 4 children. She has the two younger ones under her responsibility. She makes a living as a cook in an eatery located in a market in Managua.

Yojana is asking for her first loan, which she wants to use to improve the conditions of her basic house. She wants to put a roof on the porch of her house so she can make use of this space which is so important for her and her children.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and roofing beams.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace varios años, siembra maíz y frijol, con lo que obtiene de las ventas de sus productos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  Nicolás está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para poder comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. y así continuar con sus cultivos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nicolás is 57 years old and lives in his own house with his family. For several years he has made a living from agriculture. He grows corn and beans and he is able to cover some of his household expenses with what he makes from selling his produce. 

Nicolás is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy all the necessary agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers, manure, weedkiller, pesticides etc., so he can continue growing his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, weedkiller, pesticides etc.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Jariatu from Waterloo, Western rural area in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. For the past two years, Jariatu has been running a home products store. She began her business to create a permanent source of income for her family. Jariatu works from eight in the morning through five-thirty in the afternoon seven days a week. Her major business challenges are price inflation and proper business location.

Jariatu is requesting a loan to purchase food containers, plates, and cups to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to improve her status of living. In the future, Jariatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates, and cups

loans.name: Farima

texts.fr:
Née à BANGASSI, FARIMA vit avec ses dix enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle à N'TENTOU dans la commune rurale de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI). 
FARIMA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’achat vente d’habillements : tissus et friperie.  
Après avoir remboursé le troisième  prêt individuel, FARIMA est à son quatrième  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter 10 pièces de tissus et 1 balle de friperie. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, sur place et  effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
FARIMA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Born in BANGASSI, FARIMA lives with her ten children and husband in a traditional family in N'TENTOU, in Commune Rurale de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro), Republic of Mali. Not having the chance to progress in school, FARIMA soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, that is, buying and selling clothing: fabrics and used clothing.

After having repaid the third individual loan, FARIMA is on her fourth individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 10 lengths of cloth and a bale of secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies in Bamako locally and makes her sales retail, cash or credit, to men and women customers at the market and at the surrounding fairs.

FARIMA hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used to help out her husband in meeting family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest the rest in the clothing trade.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Aminata.  She is married and has four children ages four, 14, 18 and 25. In 2004, Aminata established her business where she sells flasks, sets of dishes, coolers, pots, enamelware, spoons, and glass plates. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself to support her children and husband. Aminata’s business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. She works seven days a week, 12 hours a day, and earns about 2,100,000 SLL each month.

Aminata is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to pay for additional coolers, flasks, and sets of dishes. She hopes that her loan will help her to bring about a change in her life and her family’s lifestyle. In the future, Aminata plans to educate her elder son through university to motivate her other children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for coolers, flasks, and sets of dishes

loans.name: Spasa

texts.en:
This is Spasa, who is seen inside her living area with, of course, her adorable cat sleeping on the arm of the couch. She works raising livestock and farming and she’s got three milk cows, a baby calf, and she plants wheat, corn, beans and vetch. Spasa comes from the Macedonian ethnic area of Albania and is a mother of two children. This area is located along the Prespa Lake in Korca as well as in the Dibra region and is comprised of approximately 10,000 people. Most of the residents that live in Spasa’s village have cows, sheep and goats, and they do a bit of planting. The district is also known for fishing and there are 23 types of fish in Lake Prespa. These resources have helped to keep the cultural tradition alive, including language, cooking and dressing.

Spasa is requesting a loan to pay for health costs. Specifically, she is scheduled for breast surgery and the procedure will take place in Macedonia.

loans.use: to pay for upcoming breast surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional bags and assorted ladies' footwear and to secure another stall not too far from her business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mariama.  She is single and has three children aged seventeen, thirteen and seven. In 2012, Mariama established her business selling exercise books, ledgers, pens and general stationery. She began her business because she wanted to take care of her children properly, more especially to see them through their education. 

Mariama's business is located in the city center and her main customers are school children and workers. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy more exercise books and other stationery items. She hopes that this loan will motivate her to put more effort into her business. In the future, Mariama plans to build a small kiosk or small shelter for the dry season and the rains. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for exercise books, ledgers, pens and general stationery items

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Née à KOUROUBA, KADIATOU vit avec ses six  enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI).
KADIATOU n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait le commerce de légume. KADIATOU, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir le commerce de légume : bananes, choux, carotte, ananas et tomate.    
Après avoir remboursé le premier  prêt individuel, KADIATOU est à son deuxième  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 kilogrammes de banane et une quantité importante de choux, carotte, ananas et tomate. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, sur place,  et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle mixte. 
KADIATOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente de légumes.
texts.en:
Born in KOUROUBA, KADIATOU lives with her six children and husband in a nuclear family in N'TENTOU, in Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro), Republic of Mali. Not having the chance to progress in school, KADIATOU soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses along side her older sister, who used to do commerce in fruit & vegetables. After years of experience with her sister, KADIATOU opted for the same work, that is, commerce in:  bananas, cabbages, carrots, pineapples, and tomatoes.

After having repaid the first individual loan, KADIATOU is now on her second individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 20 kg of bananas and a significant quantity of cabbage, carrots, pineapples, and tomatoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako locally and makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base at the market and at the surrounding fairs.

KADIATOU hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used to help out her husband in supporting family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest the rest in the fruit & vegetables business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Née à GOUREMA, DJENEBA vit avec ses cinq enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la commune rurale de OUELESSEBOUGOU Préfecture de  KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI). 
DJENEBA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des produits cosmétiques : savons.      
Après avoir remboursé le troisième  prêt individuel, DJENEBA est à son quatrième  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 40 cartons de savons. Elle s’approvisionne  à BAMAKO   et effectue ses ventes, à crédit de 15 jours, en détail, à TENINKOUN à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
DJENEBA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Born in GOUREMA, DJENEBA lives with her five children and husband in a nuclear family in N'TENTOU, in Commune Rurale de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de  KATI, (Région de Koulikoro), Republic of Mali. Not having the chance to progress in school, DJENEBA soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of cosmetic products: soaps. 

After having repaid the third individual loan, DJENEBA is now on her fourth individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 40 boxes of soap. She gets her supplies in Bamako and makes her sales retail to men and women customers paying her back over two weeks, in TENINKOUN. 

DJENEBA hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used to help out her husband in supporting family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest the rest in the cosmetics business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Alhaji Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Alhaji. He is married and has two children, aged 15 and 10. 

In 2009, Alhaji established his school bags and traveling bags business. He began his business because he wanted to be financially strong so that his children would have a good foundation when they are all grown up. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are young and old. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Alhaji requires a loan in order to pay for additional school bags and traveling bags. He hopes that this loan will support him to get enough stock, which will enable him to supply other retailers. 

In the future, Alhaji plans to educate his children, expand the business and build a house with the proceeds of his loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for school bags and traveling bags.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has two children, aged 11 and 7. 

In 2002, Fatmata established her perfume, body spray, perfume crème and facial make-up business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to pay for more designer perfume. She hopes that this loan will support her to attract more customers, especially those who are looking for quality items. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to engage in another business, such as confection, which she realizes is moving faster. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for perfume, body spray, perfume crème and facial make-up.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is currently operating a boutique at the local business center where she sells clothing and accessories. When she received the Kiva loan, her business was struggling because the majority of her customers were tobacco farmers and ploughing season had just started. Despite this, she went on and restocked her shop with higher quality clothes in order to get a competitive advantage to increase sales during this season, and the business has grown even bigger than she expected. 

From the proceeds of the business Beatrice is now able to pay her own school fees to finish her course in bakery. She is very passionate about food and would love to diversify her business and open a bakery corner in her shop where she will sell cakes, muffins, and coffee. 

She is now able to provide for her family with food and clothing and is paying school fees for her young sister. However, Beatrice still faces challenges in her business such as high rents and the seasonal variations in the business.

loans.use: to open a bakery in her shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florene’s clothing retail shop has benefited from an increasing amount of profits thanks to a loan from Kiva. The loan that she got enabled her to increase her stock and add a wide variety of clothes and shoes which attracted a lot of new customers. She also bought mannequins and added another shelf in the shop for shoes. The Kiva loan has made a huge impact on both the business and her family; she is now able to pay school fees for her two nieces and two nephews. Despite this success, she has a few challenges which include high traveling costs and also low demand for clothing during January and February when people are prioritizing school fees.

Going forward, Florene would like to diversify into selling televisions, irons, and other electrical appliances since these are in high demand in her community. She would also love to further her education and pursue a degree in humanitarian studies so that she can work with communities on a professional level.

loans.use: to purchase electrical goods to add to her stock

loans.name: Dudzai

texts.en:
When Dudzai applied for a Kiva loan she was running a salon business, however she later discovered that she can make a lot more money by selling goats and cows which is a very profitable business in Muzarabani, Zimbabwe. From this business she managed to raise funds for repaying debts and feeding her family. She is also taking care of her sister’s children, sending them to school and buying uniforms and stationery for them. She is also now able to provide more nutritious food and additional items of clothing for her family.

Dudzai has saved enough money from her business selling goats and cows that she got a passport for herself as she is planning to go out of the country to buy salon items such as chemicals, rollers, blowers, and braids in preparation for the season. One challenge Dudzai faces in her business is crocodiles occasionally eating some of her goats.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her salon

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis’ business has greatly benefitted from the Kiva loan. With increased sales and profits in December, she managed to build her own shop in her rural area. The business has been improving day-by-day and she is now investing in farming sugar beans on her two acres of land. She plans to sell her own packaged sugar beans in her shop, as she says this will be an opportunity to expand her business as well as improve her family’s diet. 

Mavis’ life has improved so much that she now dresses and eats well. Her parents are so happy and they now see her as their lifeline in terms of food and school fees for her siblings. Her status in the community has improved drastically as she is now respected and has become a role model for other young women. 

Her major challenge has been the seasonality of the business. There is an increase in her customer base during the tobacco harvest season because that is when most people have money. In most cases she has to resort to extending credit lines to the farmers during non-harvest times. However, this practice of extending credit has left her with some outstanding payments. 

Despite these challenges she still has plans to expand her business by building more shelves in her shop so that she can add other items like clothing. Mavis is also planning to re-sit the final secondary school examination which she once failed so that she can qualify to train as a teacher.

loans.use: to build more shelves in the shop and purchase clothes for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for trimmings and materials

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Meet Amie, 60 years old from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown. She is married with two children. In 2010, Amie established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to make a daily living. She works at the business from 7:00am till 6:00pm. She says that, despite the hardship, she wants to become a successful business woman.

Amie requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, tomato paste and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and increase her business. In the future, Amie plans to open a big food table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, tomato paste and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Marino

texts.en: Marino is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of silver for his original jewelry designs. He has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story: "When I was a boy, I liked art. I'd build houses and vessels of clay, and my friends and I would play with them. Eventually, I studied ceramics. But when I left my small town for the city, I took courses in electro-mechanics and when I completed them, I worked in this field. One day I realized I could make just about anything – even jewelry. And so I enrolled in a jewelry-making course in Lima. I work by myself, and every piece I make is crafted by hand. This work requires a lot of patience and dedication. I began by making rings, but now I have many ideas and find myself sketching necklaces of silver and precious stones. You can feel satisfied acquiring my pieces, as each is made with quality and the guarantee that the materials are genuine." "I would like to thank you all for collaborating in the funding of this micro-credit, and for supporting those of us who work with our hands. I will be using this micro-credit to build up my stock, which you'll soon be able to appreciate." Use the link below to view Marino's handcrafted silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5219

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of silver for his original jewelry designs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a Ghanaian artisan who creates wood carvings and also crafts a line of jewelry. He would like to purchase materials such as wood and cotton for his original accessories and decor items. Robert has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story: "I am a self-taught artist. I never took any classes or attended courses. I use manual tools to carve my pieces from wood and then I paint them myself. I enjoy working alone, and my inspiration comes from nature. My favorite things in life are to explore nature and to spend time with my wife and two daughters. One of my dreams for the near future is to become an art lecturer, even though I was never able to go to art class myself." "I am grateful to all of you who are contributing toward sustaining my workshop by funding this micro-credit. Thank you all!" Use the link below to view Robert's African wood carvings and jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5683

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wood and cotton for his original accessories and decor items.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro is a Peruvian artisan who carves beautiful polychrome relief panels. He would like to purchase wood for his relief panel designs. He has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story: "My brothers and I are heirs to our family's wood carving legacy. In 2005 I opted for creating my own pieces and to work on my own. I learned to carve when I was younger, and I've always enjoyed working with my hands. I love the woods' natural grain. My work is about beautiful images that come forth from the wood. I am motivated by the idea of one day becoming a great wood artist and have my work remembered forever. I try to transmit the patience and dedication one must have in order to do this kind of work." "Thanks to Novica, my work has reached many homes around the world, even places I once thought impossible. I'm very grateful for the warm reception I've received as an artist. This work is a blessing to me day after day. Gracias!" Use the link below to view Alejandro's hand-carved Bible-themed relief panels on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6220

loans.use: to purchase wood for his relief panel designs.

loans.name: Bedri

texts.en:
Bedri is seeking your financial help to buy material for the lime furnace and carpentry shop via a loan in an amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek. Thisl help him achieve the goals.

Bedri is 44 years old and has three children- ages 19, 15 and 11. In addition to what he does in the carpentry field and lime producing, he also raises livestock. He’s got two milk cows and he sells their raw milk to some nearby dairy farms. Due to the fact that the village has a mountainous terrain, planting activity is something that doesn’t go well with it. However, livestock is the practice that villagers pursue the most. 

Bedri’s village is known for having tens of hundreds of chestnut trees and selling large quantities of such nuts in the Albanian market. The traditional food here is dried beans with homemade bacon.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in his lime producing and carpentry shop

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
Chipo’s grocery shop is doing very well. With the Kiva loan, Chipo was able to restock her shop and add commodities which are needed by people on a daily basis, such as flour, rice, and soap. She has also added a section for school stationery which is in high demand in her community since there are no bookshops. 

Notably, Chipo is buying her stock in bulk and she now has a stockroom where she stores cases of basic commodities which are put on shelves to replenish depleting stocks. Chipo is now able to provide food and clothing for her family of five, which includes her mother, father, grandmother, brother and her five-year-old daughter. She is also assisting her parents with school fees for her brother and sending her daughter to a good school.

However, Chipo is facing challenges of transport since she purchases her stock 210 km away from her home. She uses public transport which is expensive, and this is taking part of her profits. She plans to buy her own lorry so that she can personally transport her goods and reduce the cost and risk of having her goods stolen or broken along the way. This would help her further increase her profits. She intends to buy her own stand and build her own shop and stop renting. 

If she gets another loan, she intends to purchase a wider variety of goods in order to get more profits. With high hopes for continued entrepreneurship, Chipo would also like to begin assisting two girls from her community who are in need of school fees. When everyone around her has been provided for, she aspires to develop herself by studying further.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ireen

texts.en:
Ireen is currently running a general shop at her homestead. Before acquiring the Kiva loan, she rented a store at the local business center. She later decided that owning her own shop was preferable, so she enlisted the help of her brother and they built the shop she is currently using with part of the Kiva loan and used the rest of the loan to purchase clothes for her stock.  

From the research she carried out, Ireen discovered that people were not as interested in buying clothes as she initially thought. To address this she began stocking her shop with food items such as sugar, cooking oil, and rice. She found that when people come to buy these food items, they also end up looking at the clothes as well. Because of this strategic marketing, Ireen has been able to increase her client base and improve her standard of living. 

She aspires to purchase a wider variety of things to sell in her shop and increase her client base further. She is also managing to feed her family, buy good clothes for herself and her child, and take care of her sick sister. Most importantly for Ireen, she gained respect from her family after they saw how successful she was as an entrepreneur. They even come to her for advice and guidance, which is something that never used to happen. Thanks to the opportunities that came along with the Kiva loan, Ireen has also managed to buy furniture for her house and is sending her daughter to boarding school.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of goods for her shop.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNIDOS ANIDOS AL FUTURO” está conformada por socias decidas a diversas actividades del comercio y prestar servicios. Evelin tiene 29 años de edad es soltera con un bebe de tres mese. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales a través de catálogos hace un año. Actividad que aprendió de su madre. Años atrás era estudiante. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más productos naturales que estén en oferta para poder expenderlos a un precio que le genere ganancias. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Evelin es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Unidos al Futuro Group is made up of women dedicated to a variety of service and sales activities.

Evelin, 29, is single and has a three-month-old baby.  She has earned a living for a year making catalogue sales of natural products, a job she learned from her mother.  Years ago she was a student.

She's going to invest the loan in buying more natural products that are on sale so she can sell them at prices that will generate a profit for her.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their loan.  Evelin's the first person on the left.

loans.use: to buy natural products

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata, a 23-year-old from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. Some years ago, Aminata established her retail business. She began her business because she did not go to school; she wanted to create income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more clothing items and food containers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing items and food containers for resale.

loans.name: José Gerzán
