texts.es: El señor José de 38 años de edad, acompañado y padre de un hijo de 16 años, es propietario de una pulpería donde comercializa principalmente granos básicos, este negocio lo tiene hace más de tres años y cuenta con la ayuda de su compañera para la comercialización de estos productos, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como es arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, pan, especie y más. Una de las metas del socio es convertir su negocio en una miscelánea.
texts.en: Sr. José, 38, is married and has a 16-year old son.  He started a grocery business three years ago and he and his wife operate it together. Sr. José is applying for a loan that he will use to stock the grocery with rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, bread, spices and other merchandise.  He mostly sells supplies of grain and his goal is to sell other kinds of products, as well.

loans.use: to stock his corner grocery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cloth material for resale

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Jeneba from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. During the past 7 years, Jeneba established her local chicken business. She began her business because she wanted to earn her daily bread. She works at the business 10 hours a day, 7 days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem within her area of operation.

Jeneba requires a loan in order to purchase more local chickens for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Jeneba plans to sell different types of local food. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more local chickens for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is 45 years old and lives in Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. During the past 20 years, Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income and empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that during the rainy season sales are very slow.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more used clothing and suitcases for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing and suitcases for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Bikram

texts.en: Bikram is 30 years old and lives with his parents and four brothers. He tried to do different work, but could not earn enough to live on his own and settle down. Eventually he began with the cultivation of rice since he hails from a traditional rice growing family. Seva MFI was a relief for him, because he could not get a loan from traditional banks. Bikram began planting rice on 6 hectares of land and this has now been expanded to 14 hectares. He is requesting a loan of SRD 10,000 for the purchase of new tires for his tractor. Furthermore, Bikram is saving for his own house.

loans.use: To purchase new tires for his tractor

loans.name: Hamufari

texts.en: Hamufari is an up and coming businesswoman. She is a single mother of two boys. She lives in the Nyaminyami District in Zimbabwe. Hamufari always dreamed of being self-reliant and a provider for her children. To make this dream a reality, she is now operating a grocery shop and is being assisted by her young sisters. She sells mealie meal, cooking oil, eggs, snacks, soap, body cream and other home essentials. With the Kiva loan she intends to buy mealie meal, cooking oil, salt, flour, snacks, soap, and body cream in bulk so as to make an increased profit. Hamufari hopes to improve her life and create employment in her community. When she is not working in the shop she serves as a Seed Money Scheme trainer, motivating and empowering young women in the community to be economically independent. She also coordinates the movement for HIV/AIDS awareness in the community.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Née à BAMAKO, FANTA vit avec ses deux enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la commune de  OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI). 
FANTA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’achat vente d’habillements : wax real et tissus.    
Après avoir remboursé le premier  prêt individuel, FANTA est à son deuxième  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  30 pièces de tissus et wax réal. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandise au GHANA, LOME, BURKINA FASO   et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, à OUELESSEBOUGOU et BAMAKO à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
FANTA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Born in BAMAKO, FANTA lives with her two children and husband in a nuclear family in N'TENTOU, in Commune de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de  KATI, (Région de Koulikoro), Republic of Mali. Not having had the chance to progress in school, FANTA soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, namely, the buying and selling of cloth: Wax Real [a brand of ‘pagne’ cloth] and fabrics. 

After having repaid the first individual loan, FANTA is now on her second individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 30 lengths of fabrics and Wax Réal. She gets her supplies of merchandise from GHANA, LOME, and BURKINA FASO. And she makes her sales retail to men and women customers paying with cash or credit at her home, in OUELESSEBOUGOU, and in BAMAKO 

FANTA hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to help out her husband in meeting family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest the rest in the fabrics trade.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Oumarou

texts.fr:
Né  à KOMO, OUMAROU vit avec ses six enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à KOMO dans la commune rurale de TIELE Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA  (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI).
OUMAROU  n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales: maïs, fonio et haricota. 
OUMAROU est à son premier prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 sacs de fonio et 5 sacs de maïs. Il s’approvisionne sur place et à FARALA, et effectue ses ventes  au comptant, à crédit, en gros et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
OUMAROU espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Born in KOMO, OUMAROU lives with her six children and husband in a nuclear family in KOMO, in Commune Rurale de TIELE, Sous-Préfecture de  BAGUINEDA, (Région de Koulikoro), Republic of Mali. Not having had the chance to progress in school, OUMAROU soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of grains: corn, fonio [a type of millet], and beans. 

OUMAROU is on her first individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 5 sacks of fonio and 5 sacks of corn. She gets her supplies locally and in FARALA. And she makes her sales retail and wholesale to men and women customers paying with cash or credit at her home and at the market. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and to reinvest the rest in the commerce of grains.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Quilla Rayme Group

texts.es:
La socia Miriam pertenece al banco comunal QUILLA RAYME, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Miriam tiene 36 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negoció el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando parad es esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de kiosco escolar, venta de ensaladas de frutas, albañil, artesanía, taxi.
texts.en:
Miriam, 36, belongs to Quilla Rayme Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.

Miriam's married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells rice, sugar, milk, snacks, and other necessities.  She has had her business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to keep on working and supporting her family.

Miriam's requesting the loan to buy milk, rice, and other products.  She's grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

The businesses of the other members are a school kiosk, selling fruit salad, bricklaying, arts and crafts, and taxi service.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, and other products

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha es una mujer exitosa en su negocio, tiene la edad de 38 años, casada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de 20, 17 y 14 años, se dedica  a la venta de frutas en el mercado del departamento y venta de leña en su domicilio, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para la compra y venta de estos productos y de sus hijos en la venta de la leña, con el crédito obtuvo mayores ganancias y consigo mayores beneficios, esto la motivó a seguir prestando en esta institución financiera, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de frutas de la temporada como es el mango, jocote, tamarindo, naranja, y la compra de leña por carreta.
texts.en:
Señora Martha is a woman who has been very successful in her business. She is 38 years old, she is married, and she is the mother of three children, ages 20, 17, and 14. 

She sells fruit at the department marketplace (a department is an administrative division within a given region), and she sells firewood at her home. She has her husband’s help with the purchase and sale of these products, and that of her children with selling the firewood. 

With the loan, she achieved better earnings and made more profits; and this motivated her to continue borrowing from this financial institution. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of seasonal fruits such as mangoes, jocotes (a small fruit that grows on trees), tamarind, and oranges; and to purchase cart loads of firewood.

loans.use: to purchase jocotes (a small fruit that grows on trees) and mangoes.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia  junto a su esposo quien trabaja como seguridad y le ayuda con la economía del hogar. María se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y es así como junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. María desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso el cual actualmente es de tierra y para comprar nuevas ventanas y puertas dado que las actuales se encuentran deterioradas por lo que no se siente segura. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava puertas y ventanas.
texts.en: María, 49, and her husband live in a house that they own.  Her husband works in security and his income covers part of the their joint expenses.  María works as a cleaner and shares the expenses with her husband.  María wants to make improvements to their house and is applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to lay a cement floor and buy new windows and doors.  The house only has a dirt floor now and its windows and doors have deteriorated so badly that they offer no security at all.  María will use the loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, windows and doors.

loans.use: to buy materials for house-improvement project.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos de 45 años de edad se dedica a la venta de juguetes, vende de  forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Carlos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas juguetes por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias para poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Carlos, 45, is a street vendor.  He buys and sells toys, working the markets and neighborhoods near his house.  He lives with his extended family in a house that he owns.  Carlos is applying for a loan that he will use to buy wholesale supplies of toys so that he can maximize his earnings.  The investment will allow him to carry on his business and provide a steady income for his family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of toys for his toy sales business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 45 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de verduras en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, es viuda vive con sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que gana en sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: arena, cemento, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra, y así poder construir unos cuartos para que ella y sus hijos puedan vivir cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Marina, 45, earns a living selling vegetables in the market near her home.  She's a widow and lives with her three children in her own house.

Marina wants to improve her house but doesn't have enough money from what she earns in sales.  She's requesting a loan to be able to pay for labor and buy the materials she needs, such as sand, cement, bricks, and rebar.  That way she can build a few rooms so she and her children can live comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, and rebar, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Hannah from Waterloo2 Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children. In 2009, Hannah established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income for her family. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Hannah requires a loan in order to purchase more soap and palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Hannah plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soap and palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: María De Los Santos

texts.es:
María es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que le gusta la vida en el campo, ella vive en una finca con su esposo y su hijo de 9 años en la cual se desempeñan como mayordomos.
Ella desea aumentar sus ingresos pues con los que en estos momentos tiene no han podido suplir algunas necesidades; por eso solicita un apoyo económico para comprar una vaca lechera y bultos de alimentos para su engorde y adelantamiento, de esta forma iniciar con su negocio de venta de leche en las viviendas a los alrededores de la finca.
Ella conoce muy bien esta actividad pues desde que era niña trabajaba con su padre en las fincas lecheras, allí aprendió el oficio y adquirió experiencia en el campo.
Su mayor sueño es poder independizarse, comprar su vivienda propia y tener un lote de ganado lechero para continuar con el negocio que según ella le apasiona bastante, además quiere enseñarle este oficio a su hijo y que crezca con la idea de que con trabajo duro se obtiene todo lo que se desea.
texts.en:
Maria is a humble, hardworking woman who likes the country life.  She lives on a farm with her husband and nine year old son and where they work.

She wants to increase her income because she is not able to meet her needs with her current one, so she is asking for a loan to buy a dairy cow and feed.  In this way she can start her milk sales business to the homes around her farm.

She is very familiar with this activity and worked with her father on dairy farms.  She learned this trade and got experience there.

Her greatest dream is to be able to work on her own so she can buy a house of her own and have a dairy farm so she can continue her business, which she loves very much.  She also wants to teach her son the business and for him to grow up with the idea that he can obtain anything he wants through hard work.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Ester is a 24-year-old woman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her husband and their child. In 2013, Ester started a poultry business because she felt the need to be financially independent and knew that selling poultry was a profitable business in her community. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. In her spare time, Ester works as a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering at schools to teach life skills and improve the wellbeing of students in her community. 

She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. In the future, Ester would very much like to increase production and eventually become a poultry supplier to major supermarkets. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Soenil

texts.en: Soenil is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children. His oldest child will start next year studying at the university. Almost a year ago, he started rice cultivation by renting a plot of a relative. Without Seva MFI, it was impossible for Soenil to start with the rice cultivation, because he had no money to invest. Soenil saves the profits of his rice cultivation for the studies of his children. He also wants to have his own piece of land where he can plant rice and take care of his family. Soenil needs a loan of SRD 10,000 for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Waridi

texts.en: Waridi is 36 years old and used to work as a part-time guard. He lives with his wife and two daughters. As a small boy, he always helped his grandfather with planting rice. After the death of his grandfather, Waridi inherited his areas and began to cultivate rice independently. From this season, he plans to plant on more areas and needs support to cover the higher investment costs. With a loan of 7500 SRD, he will buy fertilizers and pesticides. This will help him lower the production costs. Saving for the future of his daughters is his aim.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, bananas, flours, sugar, and other items in large quantities.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan de 31 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, control de plagas, abonos, etc. y  mejorar  el terreno donde desea hacer la siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Juan, 31, grows maize and beans for a living.  He sells his crop to local grain merchants and his income from the sales supports his family.  He lives with his family in a house that he owns.  Juan is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--fertilizers, pest control agents, etc.--to prepare his land for his next crop.  (Juan is pictured on his land in the photo.)  The investment will help Juan carry on his farming business and generate an income for supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es: José tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 10 años y 2 años de edad. José es un hombre muy trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo va sacando adelante a su familia. José desea ampliar los corredores de su vivida y así brindar mayor seguridad a su familia puesto que cuando es tiempo de lluvia el agua se filtra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos y así poder proceder lo antes posible a la construcción del corredor.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their children, ages 10 and 2. Jose is a hard-working man who with great effort has been advancing his family.

Jose wishes to expand his house's roofed corridors and, thereby, offer his family more security, since now when it rains, water filters in. To achieve this improvement, he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in purchasing galvanized steel sheets, wood and nails. He hopes to be able to proceed as soon as possible to construct the covered corridors.

loans.use: to buy galvanized steel sheets, wood and nails in order to construct waterproof corridors for his house.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Richard tiene 30 años de edad y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una agencia de viajes, él socio lleva buen tiempo trabajando en esta empresa el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio traslada a sus turistas a los distintos tours que realizan, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos turísticos.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de vidriería, artesanía.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
 El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The NUEVO AMANECER community bank is in Cusco.  

One of its members, Richard, is 30-years old and single.  He works for a travel agency and says that he's been there a number of years because he's wholly committed to his work.  He takes tourists on organized tours, a business that he hopes he can build his future on.
Richard is applying for a loan that he will use to buy tickets to tourist sites.
The other members of the community bank have their own businesses: fruit sales, glassware sales, craft sales.
The member in the picture at the bottom left of the group photo asked to be photographed separately because she had to work.
Richard is grateful for the support that this kind of lending provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy tickets for tourism business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27 años de edad,  desde hace varios años se dedica a ser agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, vive en casa propia con su familia, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía, y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client, 27, has worked in agriculture for several years growing corn and beans.  She lives in her own house with her family.  She sells her products in the different markets near her home.

The client's requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, and so forth, to improve the plot of land that's shown in the photograph.  That way she'll be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, soil amendments, etc.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Meet Mbalu. She is 31 years old from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with 1 child.  In 2001, Mbalu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Mbalu requires a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks, body cream and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mbalu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks, body cream and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Meet Fanny, who is a 30-year-old from Waterloo2 Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married and has one child, age 6 years.  In 2010, Fanny established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to develop her family. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Fanny requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fanny plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 28 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Buhera district, Zimbabwe. 

Yvonne is a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their survival skills. She helps the old people in her community with food, clothes and cleaning their houses. In addition, Yvonne sells door to door within her local community products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for 2 years now and it has enabled her to support her family.
  
With the Kiva loan, Yvonne intends to purchase more clothing stock for her business in order to expand and also to create employment for the community. She also intends to build her own shop for the sustainability of her business. This will help her business to stabilize and will enable her to expand.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock for her business

loans.name: Tabeth

texts.en:
Tabeth is a 19-year-old entrepreneur from the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. To support herself, she rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. For over a year, Tabeth has been able to use the profits from her shop to support her family.  In her free time, Tabeth has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. 
With the Kiva loan, Tabeth will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Tabeth dreams of buying her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to continue providing for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Гулбахор жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 52 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Гулбахор со своей семьёй живёт в сельском посёлке.  Она имеет среднее образование. Сама Гулбахор работает уборщицей в местной столовой. Заработок у неё очень  маленький.  Муж Гулбахор тоже работает в местной мастерской. От своей работы он получает хороший доход. Общего дохода в их семье хватает лишь на проживание среднего уровня.

Сейчас Гулбахор планирует организовать большой праздник, у её сына скоро будет день рождения. По традиции она должна организовать большой праздник. Сейчас она закупает все необходимые вещи и продукты для этого праздника. Но у неё имеется недостаток денежных средств. Поэтому сейчас Гулбахор  обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить потребительский кредит на покупку продуктов для мероприятия. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a happy and hardworking 52-year-old woman.  She is married and has three children.  Gulbahor and her family live in a rural village.  She has a secondary education.  Gulbahor works as a janitor at a local cafeteria.  Her salary is very small.  Gulbahor's husband works at a local shop.  He earns a good income from his job.  The combined income in their family is enough only for middle-class living expenses.  

Now Gulbahor is planning to organize a big celebration.  Her son's birthday is coming up. According to tradition, she has to organize a big celebration.  She is now buying all of the necessary things and food for this celebration, but she does not have enough money.  This is why Gulbahor came to Arvand and wants to obtain a consumer loan to purchase food for this event.  She hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maíz, frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros. Adicional a eso también se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tamales,  tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes,  en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio, y sus molinos ya no le dan abasto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica y emocional a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelina lives in her own home with her family. She works in her mill, processing all types of food, such as corn, beans, flour, sauces and others. As well as this she also makes and sells tamales. She has had the business for some time already and has ample experience which helps her to generate a very good income. She is well-known by the local people and has achieved a large customer base, who prefer her for the quality, affordable prices and unequalled service that she always offers her customers. 

In the last few weeks the demand for her service has increased, and her mills can no longer keep up with this. Because of this she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy blades, discs and all the necessary tools to have a good mill. She has good repayment references and she is responsible and promises to pay off the debt. She believes that it will bring her family economic and emotional security.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs and all necessary tools.

loans.name: Hanifamo

texts.ru: Ханифамо 34-летняя замужняя женщина, обладающая профессией швеи. Она занимается швейным делом на протяжении 5 лет. Ханифамо ответственный человек, когда она берется за выполнение заказа, то всегда сдает в срок. Она является квалифицированной швеей в области шитья женских национальных платьев и ее услуги всегда востребованы. В городе Куляб, где проживает Ханифамо женская часть населения предпочитает покупать ткани и шить платья под свой размер и вкус. Сейчас Ханифамо хочет расширить свое дело. Она берет кредит для приобретения новой вышивальной машинки, и с помощью это машинки делать на платьях вышивки по запросу клиенток. Таким образом Ханифамо планирует увеличить доходность своей деятельности.
texts.en: Hanifamo is a 34-year-old married woman, who is a professional seamstress.  She has been involved in the sewing business for 5 years.  Hanifamo is a responsible person when she starts to work on an order and always completes it in-time.  She is a qualified seamstress in the area of sewing women's national dresses, and her service is always in demand.  In the city of Kulob, where Hanifamo lives, women prefer to purchase fabrics and sew dresses according to their measurements and taste.  Now Hanifamo wants to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a new embroidery machine, with the help of which she would be able to make embroideries on dresses based on the clients' requests.  This is how Hanifamo plans to increase the earning ability of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new embroidery machine in order to expand her business

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es: Pedro tiene 51 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él trabaja como albañil desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su familia y mantiene la economía de su hogar. Pedro solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas para la vivienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento y así proceder a la compra lo antes posible y posteriormente mudarse junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has worked as a builder for a long time and this is how he supports his family and maintains the family finances.

Pedro asks FUSAI for this loan so that he can buy doors and windows for the house which he has managed to build after much effort. He hopes to be able to have access to this funding and so proceed with the purchase as soon as possible and then move with his family.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for his house.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Née à BAMAKO, ROKIA vit avec ses quatre enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire au quartier MISSION CATHOLIQUE de la ville de OUELESSEBOUGOU,  Préfecture de  KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
ROKIA n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habillements : tissus et pagnes.    
Après avoir remboursé le quatrième  prêt individuel, ROKIA est à son cinquième  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 pièces de tissus et 15 pièces de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandise à BAMAKO   et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, à  OUELESSEBOUGOU et aux lieux d’orpaillage,  à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.  
ROKIA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Born in BAMAKO, ROKIA lives with her four children and husband in a nuclear family in the MISSION CATHOLIQUE district of OUELESSEBOUGOU City, in Préfecture de KATI, (Région de Koulikoro), Republic of Mali. Not having had the chance to progress in school, ROKIA soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of fabrics, including ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa).

After having paid back the fourth individual loan, ROKIA is on her fifth individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 20 lengths of fabrics and 15 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth. She gets her supplies of merchandise in Bamako. And she makes her sales retail to men and women customers paying with cash or credit at her home, in OUELESSEBOUGOU, and where panning for gold is done. 

ROKIA hopes to make a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used to help out her husband in meeting family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest the rest in the commerce of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Gladis Margarita

texts.es: Gladis de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maíz y frijol, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Gladis está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their 4 children. She has been dedicated to farming for various years, sowing corn and beans. With what she obtains from her earnings, and with her husband's help, she manages to cover at least some of their household expenses.

Gladis is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, plaguicides, and other inputs, making it possible to have, together with her family, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, plaguicides, etc. for her crops.

loans.name: Zviedzo

texts.en: Zviedzo is 22 years old, single and lives in the Mudzi district in Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, and teaches life-skills education in local schools. She also helps the local school advise its students. Sometimes she also works with the mother support groups to feed school children. In addition to this work, Zviedzo rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for 18 months and it has allowed her to support her family. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more clothes, shoes and blankets because this will reduce her costs and boost her sales volumes and profits. In the future, she hopes to expand into a large retail business and create even more employment in her community and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Sekai

texts.en: Seka, who lives in the Buhera district of Zimbabwe, is 30 years old, married and the mother of two. She is a Learner Guide who volunteers at schools in her community. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 80 broiler chicks every six weeks and selling them to local residents and schools. She started this business over the last year because she wanted to be financially independent, and went into this line of work because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. Sekai would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets and boarding schools in her local community. She will use this Kiva loan to buy more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. She also aspires to create sustainable jobs for people in her community.

loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks and feed to increase production.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
Исроил молодой энергичный парень, ему 26 лет. Он живет вместе с пожилыми родителями. Родители помогли ему выучиться и получить хорошее образование. Исроил еще не женат. Он считает, что для того чтобы создать семью он должен самостоятельно создать условия для будущей семьи, и поэтому  дополнительно от основной работы Исроил занимается тем, что выращивает скот на убой.
 У него есть несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. Так как финансов  пока еще недостаточно он хочет приобрести ещё  одного теленка , чтобы в ближайшем будущем получить дополнительный доход. Исроил обратился в "Арванд" за кредитом, он надеется что этот кредит поможет ему   для реализации его плана. Исроил заранее благодарен что быстро и удобно смог оформить кредит.
texts.en: Isroil is a young, energetic man.  He is 26 years old.  He lives together with his elderly parents.  The parents had helped him to study and get a good education.  Isroil is not yet married.  He thinks that he has to independently create proper conditions for future family in order to have a family, and this is why Isroil raises livestock for meat in addition to this main job.  He has several heads of cattle.  Because his finances are still insufficient to purchase another calf in order to earn a decent income in the near future, Isroil came to Arvand for a loan.  He hopes that his loan would help him to realize his plan.  Isroil is grateful in advance that he was able to quickly and conveniently complete his loan request.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Edita Del Carmen

texts.es: Edita 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella posee un vivero ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela fija que la buscan por los buenos precios, Edita esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar abonos, sacos de tierra negra, plantas por mayor así como muestra a la fotografía y seguir con su negocio para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edita is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two daughters. For several years she has had a plant nursery situated in her home. She has a lot of regular customers who come to her because of her good prices.

Edita is asking for a loan to buy manure, bags of black earth and plants wholesale, as seen in the photograph, so she can continue with her business to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, bags of black earth and plants wholesale.

loans.name: Darwin Alfonso

texts.es: Darwin 39 años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el  necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, etc. Darwin tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Darwin is 39-years old and lives with his family in his own house.  He makes his living growing corn and sorghum.  He has been working in agriculture for a number of years, which has given him a lot of experience and allowed him to obtain the best harvests.  Darwin sells his harvests in areas surrounding his community.  He has a large clientele, who prefer to buy from him because of his quality, good prices and, above all, his good customer service.  Darwin needs to invest in his business, which is why he his requesting a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicides, fertilizers etc.  Darwin has many good credit references from the people who know him.  He is very responsible and is sure he will be able to pay back his loan in the established time period.  In addition, he trusts that he will be able to bring his household financial security.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticide, herbicides, fertilizers etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to buy house building materials for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Thokozile

texts.en: Thokozile is a 22-year-old businesswoman. She is the single mother of one child and lives in the Matobo district of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a local flea market stand for one year where she sells shoes and clothes. When she is not working at her flea market stand, Thokozile serves as the Cama district's committee secretary and also volunteers as a Community Health activist in schools. With the requested Kiva loan, Thokozile intends to purchase clothes and shoes in bulk in order to increase her sales and profits. With the additional profits she hopes to expand her business and own two flea market stands, one in her home area and one in a neighboring village, to create employment. She also aspires to send her child to school using the additional profits.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist and protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona is a 20-year-old single mother of four from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Fiona is a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education at local schools. In addition, Fiona does door-to-door delivery where she sells products such as towels, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year and two months, and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Fiona will purchase more towels, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her clothing inventory. Her desire is to grow the business and build her own shop. This will give her stamina, and she will enjoy a fair share in the market which will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs and improve her living standards. She wants to help people in the community by providing sustainable employment to them.

loans.use: To purchase more towels, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her clothing inventory.

loans.name: Tanaka

texts.en: Tanaka is 18 years old, single and lives in the Mudzi district of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, and teaches life-skills education in local schools. She also counsels students and helps clean the local clinic. Tanaka rents a shop where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for five months now and it has allowed her to support her family. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more clothes, shoes and blankets to sell. This will reduce her costs and boost her sales volumes and profits. In the future, she hopes to expand into a large retail business and create even more employment in her community and provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 25-year-old mother of two currently residing in Kwekwe District, Zimbabwe. As an entrepreneur, Patricia saw an opportunity to start her own business when she realized the great demand for poultry in her community. Over the last eight months, she managed to increase her production capacity of 50 chickens to 120 chickens every six weeks. She is very proud of this rapid growth and her ability to sell her birds to local residents. In addition to her business, Patricia is also very passionate about helping the elderly in her community. She goes out of her way to make sure that they are taken care of since many of them have no one to look after them. 

Patricia would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a poultry supplier to major supermarkets. To achieve this dream, she will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chickens and chicken feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her family and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chickens and chicken feed to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her stock

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is businesswoman and member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae organization. She is 27 years old and lives in the Matobo district of Zimbabwe. She is a single mother with one child. To support her family, Pamela successfully runs a small grocery store where she sells rice, cooking oil, sugar, salt and flour. When she is not in her shop she is volunteering her time as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students valuable life-skills education. Pamela has requested this Kiva loan to make bulk purchases of sugar, salt, meal, soap, bread and matches so that her sales volume and profits may increase. With the additional profits made possible by this loan, she hopes to expand her business enough so that she can build her own shop and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of goods for her shop.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 29-year-old married woman living in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. 

She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at schools in her community. Over the last eight months, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 60 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started her business because she wanted to be financially independent and because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. Rosemary would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major schools within her community, supermarkets and community members. 

She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. She also wishes to provide quality education for her child.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Tendai is a 30-year-old married mother of two from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Tendai is a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills at local schools. In addition, Tendai does door-to-door delivery where she sells products such as towels, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for two years, and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Tendai intends to purchase more towels, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her clothing inventory. Her dream is to grow the business and build her own shop. This will allow her to have a better income and enjoy a fair share in the market, which will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs and improve her living standards. She wants to be a role model in her community and also to provide good education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase more towels, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her clothing inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Betsaida Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres socias trabajadoras, coordinado por la señora Yadira de 55 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos de las edades de 19, 18 y 9 años es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio y cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas mayores para la compra de los productos ofrecido y también para la venta de éstos, el credito lo solicitan para la compra de granos basicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, azucar, sopa maggy, sopa marucham, pan, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras Paula de 55 años dedicada a la crianza de pollos en su domicilio para luego venderlos, la señora Aura de 53 años ofrece el servicio de venta de comida en su domicilio los fines de semana y los días de semana por encargo a trabajadores de la zona franca ubicada cerca de vivienda.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members, coordinated by Yadira. She is 55 years old, single and the mother of three children aged 9, 18 and 19. She is the owner of a small store located in her house. She has the help of her older children buying and selling the products they offer. She is requesting a loan to purchase basic food items like rice, beans, oil, sugar, Maggi soup, Marucham soup, bread etc.

The other members of the group are: Paula is 55 years old and raises chickens at her home for resale. Aura is 53 years old and she sells meals at her home on weekends and during the week sells by order to workers in the free-trade area close to her home.

loans.use: to buy basic food items like rice, beans, oil, sugar, soup, bread etc.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace varios  años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Maria solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Maria is 50 years old and she lives with her husband in their home. She has a small beauty salon that she has run for the past few years. It is located in her home and is open from 9am to 7pm. She has a lot of customers because she provides a good service.  With the earnings she makes, she helps her husband with household expenses. Maria is asking for a loan in order to purchase products for her salon like creams, shampoos, hairpins, scissors and other items that she needs. These items will help her to earn more money and to have more economic stability.

loans.use: purchase creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors etc.

loans.name: Vidalia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Idalia de 57 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijas mayores de edad,  ofrece el servicio de refrescos y comida rápida en su domicilio, dicho negocio lo impulsó hace dos años y requiere el crédito para aumentarlo y comprar productos como pan, lechugas, carne de res, salchichas, tomates, cebollas, naranjas, granadillas, azúcar, sal, etc. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas para la compra y elaboración  de los productos ofrecidos. Al apoyarla con el crédito la socia está segura que será de gran beneficio para la superación personal de ella.
texts.en: 57-year-old Vidalia is a single mother with two adult daughters. She sells drinks and fast food in her home. She started this business two years ago and needs the loan so she can expand the business and buy items such as bread, lettuce, beef, sausages, tomatoes, onions, oranges, granadillas, sugar, salt etc. She has the help of her daughters for buying and preparing the food she sells. Vidalia is sure that getting the help of the loan will be a great benefit to her for her personal progress.

loans.use: to buy items such as bread, lettuce, beef, sausages, tomatoes, onions, oranges, granadillas, sugar, salt etc.

loans.name: Manuel De La Trinidad

texts.es: El socio Manuel de 68 años de edad, casado, es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas, se ha dedicado a este negocio aproximadamente por treinta años, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos para la comercialización de los productos, este socio tiene una pequeña finca que le provee frutos, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de cosechas de jocote por ser una de las frutas más demandadas en esta temporada.
texts.en: Manuel is 68 years old and married. He is an extremely hard-working man who works buying and selling harvests. He has been in this business for about 30 years. He has the help of his wife and his children to sell these products. He has a small farm where he grows fruit. The loan he is requesting is for buying jacote harvests as it is one of the fruits most in demand at this time of year.

loans.use: to buy jocote (a fruit related to cashews) harvests.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 21-year-old married woman from the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe.

In 2013, Faith started her own poultry business because she wanted financial stability and independence. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. This is a marked improvement from her initial production of 65 birds. Faith is also dedicated to giving back to her community. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers at schools in her community where she teaches students valuable life skills.

She began her business because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. Pamela would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to further her education in farming with the proceeds.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a 19-year-old divorced lady with one child, and she lives in the Mudzi district of Zimbabwe.  

Olivia is a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills in local schools. In addition, she rents a shop in a local shopping area where she sells groceries such as mealie meal, biscuits, cooking oil, flour, eggs, maputi, fresh bread, soap and body cream. She has been running this business for 9 months now and it has enabled her to support her family.
  
With the Kiva loan, Olivia will purchase more sugar, salt, flour, rice, eggs, maputi, soap, body cream, fresh bread and other basic commodities. She also wants to boost her profits and use them to supplement failed subjects. She aspires to build her own shop in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Chihwehwete

texts.en: Ruvarashe is a 19-year-old businesswoman who is single and lives in Gokwe South in Zimbabwe. She earns a living by potato farming and sells her produce to boarding schools and big supermarkets. She got the passion to go into this business from her family, because she grew up around farmers. With this loan, Ruvarashe intends to expand her business by buying fertilizers, potato seeds, chemicals and other supplies. She intends to create more employment in her area and help the less privileged, and hopes to be the biggest supplier of potatoes in her community within the next two years. Ruvarashe is also a Cama member who volunteers in her community, assisting needy children with food. She is also a learner guide at the local secondary school.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying fertilizer, potato seeds, and chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 24-year-old widow with one child who lives in the distric of Mudzi in Zimbabwe. Maria is a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools. In addition, Maria has been successfully operating a grocery shop where she sells products such as soap, mealie meal, sugar and flour. She has been running this business for one year now, and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Maria will purchase more soap, mealie meal, sugar and flour. Her hope is to sustain herself and her child. She wants to grow her business and build her own store. She started the business from what little savings she had and made a commitment that her child won’t have any shortages in life. Members of her community are getting basic commodities at her shop, while she is looking forward to improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Tendai is a 27-year-old mother of two who lives in the Kwekwe district of Zimbabwe. Tendai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year and it has enabled her to support her family.  
Tendai also works as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. With the Kiva loan, Tendai will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow her business and open her own store. Profits from the business will be used to put her two children through school as well as improve her family’s current standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Varaidzo

texts.en:
Varaidzo is a 22-year-old woman who is single. She lives in the Gokwe South district of Zimbabwe. 

She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for over a year and employs two people to assist her in the business. Varaidzo sells sugar, drinks, cooking oil, kapenta, rice and flour. She is a well-known and trusted supplier in her community. 

With the requested loan amount, she intends to make bulk purchases of sugar, drinks, cooking oil, kapenta, rice and flour to reduce costs as well to boost her sales volume and profits. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand her business into a large supermarket and create employment for other people in the community, and also buy food for her relatives. 

When she is not working, she serves as a Learner guide for the school in her community.

loans.use: To increase her stock so that she can increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chicken feed to increase production.

loans.name: Primrose

texts.en: Primrose is a 20-year-old business woman living in the Matobo District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a small flea market stall, selling clothes for the past six months. She is also a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. As a Cama member Primrose volunteers as a learner guide in her community. teaching students life skills. With the requested Kiva loan, Primrose will buy skirts, tops, and baby wear so that her sales and profits may increase. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a big shop and assist needy and vulnerable children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her stall.

loans.name: Tebitha

texts.en:
Tebitha is a 21-year-old divorced lady with one child. Tebitha lives in Mudzi district in Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering at schools in her community. She also mobilizes other young women in her community to be active citizens and economically independent.
Over the last year and half, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 150 birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. 
She began her business because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. Tebitha would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chicken feed to increase production. She also wants to build a bigger foul run so that she can expand her business. With the additional profits, she hopes to create more employment and provide for her child. She hopes to provide enough for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of sugar, rice, flour, sour and soft drinks, candles, cooking oil, snacks, and sweets to boost her sales volume and profits

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en:
Tinei is a 21-year-old single lady who lives in the district of Mudzi in Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at schools in her community. Over the last 11 months, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity, producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2013 because she wanted to be financially independent. She began her business because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. 

Tinei would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. She is also looking forward to supplementing subjects failed using the profits and to providing basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and stock feed

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel is a 21-year-old business woman who is married and has one child. She lives in Gokwe district. Angel has been operating a poultry business for over a year now and has employed one person to assist her. Within the requested loan, Angel intends to make bulk purchases of feed to reduce costs and boost her sales and profits. Within the additional profits, she hopes to expand into large retail and create more employment and provide for her child. When she is not working in her business, Angel serves as the chairperson of her district Cama chapter and volunteers as a community health trainer  in schools within the community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of feed to reduce costs and boost her sales and profits

loans.name: Maria Dalila

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 años y 16 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. María se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. María desea mejorar las condiciones del piso de la vivienda dado que actualmente es de tierra por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old. She lives in a house of her own together with her life partner and his two children, aged 9 and 16, who are studying. María sells clothes as a street vendor. She has been doing this for many years, so she has many customers that prefer her more every day.

María would like to improve the floor of her house, which is made of dirt. This is why she is requesting a loan at FUSAI to buy cement, bricks and gravel to make this improvement as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and gravel to improve her earthen floor.

loans.name: Teodora Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Teodora es una mujer trabajadora de 44 años de edad, acompañada, se dedica a comercializar ropa, calzado y artesanías que se elaboran en el país para luego comercializarlas en Costa Rica, también tiene un autolavado cerca de su domicilio contando con la ayuda de su hijo para la compra de productos utilizados en este negocio y también es el encargado de lavar los autos, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de ropa de niños, camisas para damas, camisas para caballeros, hamacas, cotonas, etc.
texts.en: Mrs. Teodora is a hard working 44 year old married woman. She makes a living by selling clothing, shoes and artisanal items made in her country so she can then sell them in Costa Rica. She also owns a laundromat near to her home. She relies on her son's help in purchasing items for her business and also to be in charge of the laundromat. The loan she is asking for will be used to purchase children's clothing, men's and women's shirts, hammocks and sleeping shirts etc.

loans.use: purchase children's clothing, men's and women's shirts, hammocks, sleeping shirts etc.

loans.name: Jose Cristobal

texts.es: Es señor José de 54 años de edad, soltero y padre de un hijo mayor de edad se dedica a la venta de calzado en el mercado de Masatepe, cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo en la compra y comercialización de dichos productos; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de sandalias de mujer, zapatos para damas, calzado colegial y zapatos para caballeros. Con el crédito el socio afirma que se le asegura mayor aumento en los productos y por ende mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Mr. José is 54 years old and the father on an adult son. José makes a living by selling shoes in the market Masatepe. He relies on his son's help to purchase and sell his product. The loan he needs will be used to purchase women's shoes, women's sandals, school uniform shoes and men's shoes. He says that the loan will help him to have a larger number of products to sell and higher earnings.

loans.use: purchase women's sandals, women's shoes, school uniform shoes and men's shoes.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como golosinas, granos básicos, aceite, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, etc. asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, who works in agriculture. She has a shop in her home. She has had the business for many years and this has given her sales experience which enables her to make the best profits. She is very well-known by the neighbours in the local area and has built up a large number of customers by keeping the shop well-stocked.

She wants to grow the business and make a further investment but she needs capital, so she is asking for a loan. This will enable her to buy what she needs for the shop such as sweets, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, soft drinks etc. She gives assurances that she will pay off the loan and at the same time she is sure it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Nury Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito  Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.
En este lugar vive la señora Nury, tiene 54 años de edad, hace varios años el compañero de toda su vida falleció pero de esa relación tienen 5 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad.
Doña Nury es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para así ganarse el sustento diario y con esto sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, trabaja todos los días ya sea en su casa o en sus recorridos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 17 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas entre otras prendas. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado. Sus sueños son terminar su casa y construir un pequeño local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Picoaza” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, celebrating the traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and having a rich historical culture influenced by the surrounding mountains.

Sra. Nury lives in this place. She is 54 years old. Her companion in life died several years ago and she was left alone with their five children. All of them are now grown.

Doña Nury is a woman who always enjoys working because she is able to earn a daily income, which allowed her children to get ahead. She sells all types of clothes by going door-to-door, but she also sells products at home whenever customers come to her house. Nury works every day at home or by traveling. She offers her products on credit and then collects payment every eight days. Nury has been in this line of work for more than 17 years and it has allowed her to move forward.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, T-shirts, blouses, and other types of garments. She has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and she enjoys the assistance that has been given to her. Her dreams include finishing the construction of her house and building a small shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy trousers, T-shirts, blouses, and other types of garments.

loans.name: Luz Dary Gallego

texts.es: Luz Dary es una mujer soltera sin hijos que ha luchado mil y un batallas más, tiene 61 años de edad y toda la vida se ha preocupado por su auto-sostenimiento, se dedica a realizar manicura y pedicura en todos los horarios incluyendo horarios nocturnos, estrategia que le ha funcionado para abarcar muchos cliente que no solo compran sus servicios por su disponibilidad de horarios si no por su excelente trabajo. Hablando un poco de la historia de Luz es una persona que ha sabido salir adelante gracias al apoyo recibido por los micro créditos con los que ha forjado su negocio el cual se ha convertido en su estilo de vida. Y ahora requiere otro pues al ser una mujer soltera sin hijos no tiene mucha ayuda solo tiene las entidades prestadoras de dichos servicios, el crédito será usado para la compra de esmaltes, crema para manos y herramientas de mano. La principal fortaleza de la señora Luz Dary es que sus clientes la consideran su “abuelita” una más de la familia y se le hace muy fácil ganar el cariño de sus nuevos clientes pues con un buen servicio y una sonrisa en su rostro los enamora. Su gran sueño es tener un Spa de uñas en un negocio propio el cual pueda administrar y dirigir con sus valores: humildad, respeto, buen servicio  pero ante todo sonreír al cliente.
texts.en: Luz Dary is a single woman, with no children, who has fought a thousand and one battles in her life. She is 61 years old and has lived independently for who whole life, relying only on herself. She makes a living by doing manicures and pedicures at all hours of the day, even at night. The strategy has worked because she has many customers who choose her business not only because of the convenient hours but because of the quality of her work. A little about Luz's story: she is someone who has worked to get ahead thanks to the support she has received from micro-credit loans. These loans helped her to strengthen her business and change her way of life. And now she needs another loan because as a single woman with no children, she doesn't have much help; she only has the lenders of Kiva. The loan will be used to purchase nail polish, hand cream and manicure tools. The principal strength of Luz Dary is that her clients consider her their "grandmother," like another member of the family, and that makes it very easy for her to gain the affection of new customers because with her quality service and her smile, everyone falls in love with her. Her biggest dream is to have her own nail Spa and her own storefront where she can administrate and teach her values: humility, respect and quality service, and above all, to smile for the customers.

loans.use: purchase nail polish, hand cream and manicure tools.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza es una hermosa, emprendedora, soñadora y responsable joven que desde muy temprana edad decidió casarse pues solo tiene 20 años de edad, en el transcurso de su matrimonio logro montar un local de venta de ropa y artículos de variedad como lociones, desodorantes entre otros cabe aclarar con ayuda de su esposo, actualmente tiene un aceptable volumen de ventas y es por esto que requiere una ayuda crediticia pues Maritza tiene un gran sueño con su propio esfuerzo construir una casa forjada de su esfuerzo, sudor y sacrificio. Maritza dice que no quiere que nadie le ayude en este proyecto ya que durante su matrimonio recibió muchos comentarios de que solo se casaba por interés y ella quiere demostrar lo contrario de que no necesita de ninguna persona para adquirir y lograr sus metas, el uso del micro-crédito será para la adecuación del local, hacerlo vistoso y atractivo al público ya que como toda una mujer le gusta tener su negocio adornado y decorado y con estas adecuaciones espera atraer clientes y poder generar unos mayores ingresos para cumplir los sueños anteriormente mencionado
texts.en:
Maritza is a lovely, enterprising, responsible young woman who is full of dreams.  At a very young age—she was only 20 years old—she decided to get married.  In the course of her marriage, she managed to open a shop selling clothing and a variety of articles such as lotions and deodorants.  Her work was made lighter by the help of her husband.  

She currently has an acceptable volume of sales.  Because of this, Maritza has a big dream of building a sturdy house with her own efforts, sweat, and sacrifice.  Maritza says that she doesn’t want anyone to help her with this project because when she got married she got lots of comments that she was only getting married for her own benefit.  She wants to demonstrate the opposite: that she doesn’t need anyone in order to reach her goals.  

The micro-loan will be used to update her shop and make it pleasing and attractive, because like any woman she likes to have her business decorated and pretty.  With these updates she hopes to attract customers and be able to generate a better income in order to achieve her previously mentioned dreams.

loans.use: to update her shop so that it is more attractive and pretty for the public.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 24-year-old businesswoman in the rural district of Matobo, Zimbabwe. As a single mother providing for her one child, Irene successfully operates a footwear and clothing stand in the local flea market. Irene is also a Camfed Learner Guide at a school within her community. As a Learner Guide, she volunteers her time teaching students life skills education.
