loans.name: Hái

texts.en: Hái operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Hái lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoá province. This is Hái's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hái has been involved in her business for eight years. The main hardship that Hái faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. With her business profits, Hái hopes that her family can be healthy and happy, that her business will do well, and that she will be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ba

texts.en:
Ba is 24 years old and he is married with two children. He lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with  dependents.

Ba operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. He has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Ba faces in his life is not having a latrine so his family shares the neighbor's latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Ba hopes for his business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for his kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

She is 39 years old and married with two children.  She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

In 2013, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  With her business profit, she hopes to buy a motorbike, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: 02-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hảo works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

Hảo is 50 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the 02-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members.  She lives with no dependents and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Hảo joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Fund Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid seven loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Hảo has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hảo hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Josesito De Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Josesito de Cumbe está formado por 13 mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy alegres, realizan diferentes actividades para salir adelante con sus familias y día a día entregan su mejor esfuerzo. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo y futuro para sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Vilma, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo ya se encuentra en la escuela, su esposo labora en el área de la construcción y la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Vilma se dedica al bordado de polleras que es la ropa tradicional de la región, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos, cerdos y ganado, cultiva y lo que cosecha es  para el consumo de su casa. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de tela para su negocio. Su meta es tener su taller con operarios.
texts.en:
The loan group "Josesito de Cumbe" is formed by 13 hard-working women, who are fighting hard and happy. They have different businesses in order to get ahead along with their families, and day after day they deliver their best effort. They live in the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca. This parish is known for its cold climate. Its people work in raising animals and in agriculture. Many work in the city in different businesses. They have also migrated in search of better work and a better future for their families.

One of the members of this group is Señora Vilma. She is 24 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 4. Her first son is in school. Her husband works in the construction area, and the house in which they live is their own.

Doña Vilma embroiders skirts, which are the traditional  clothing of the region. She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and cattle. She farms, and what she harvests is for the use of her household. She is going to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of fabric for her business. Her goal is to have her own workshop with employees.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Darío tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, una bebida tradicional que se elabora en base al proceso artesanal de caña de azúcar para posteriormente comercializarlo como bebida para días festivos, como producto medicinal y antisépticos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de caña y de esta manera producir en mayor cantidad aguardiente para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Darío is 43 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Callayuc. His region is dedicated to agriculture, business and livestock.  Callayuc is located in the province of Jaén which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the Northern mountains of Perú.

He works distilling aguardiente, a traditional alcoholic drink that is made from sugar cane following an artesanal process. He then sells it as a drink during holidays and festivals as well as for medicinal and antiseptic uses.  He is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency) in order to purchase a large quantity of sugar cane and in that way produce a larger quantity of aguardiente to offer to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sugar cane and in that way produce a larger quantity of aguardiente.

loans.name: Shirley Alejandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vida Nueva se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar. 
En este lugar vive la señora Shirley, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  10, 6 y 1 años de edad, los mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Shirley es una gran esposa y ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su que su esposo en su trabajo, el se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otra persona se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, ella por su parte también se dedica a la venta de ropa  de todo tipo la cual la realiza puerta a puerta, también aprovecha para vender cuando regresan los pescadores de los grandes barcos pesqueros. 
Este crédito es para comprar materiales para pesca y ropa de todo tipo. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The loan group "Vida Nueva" (New Life) meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and dedicated to work at sea.

Señora Shirley lives in this place. She is 29 years old. She is married, and from this relation she has three children, ages 10, 6, and 1. The oldest go to school. Her husband fishes.

Doña Shirley is a great wife and housewife who is taking out the loan to help her husband in his work. He works in fishing. He and another person go out on the high seas in his little boat to fish. On her part, she also sells clothing of all types, work that she does door to door. She also takes advantage of the opportunity to sell when the fishermen from the big fishing boats return.

This loan is to buy materials for fishing and clothing of all types. This is the fourth loan cycle of this loan group, and she likes it because she can help her husband. Her dreams are to give the best to their children.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Grey Milena

texts.es: 22 años de edad, vive con su familia no tiene hijos su única ambición es poder ser alguien en la vida, generar sus propios ingresos, ayudar con los gastos del hogar, su meta poder montar un almacén de productos nutricionales, sus principales debilidades su falta de experiencia como empresaria pues debido a su corta edad tiene poco recorrido en este aspecto pero todas estas deficiencias las compensa con su madures y ansias de ser una emprendedora ella es Grey una mujer de 22 años de edad que se une a este gremio de emprendedores jóvenes que cada día crece en Colombia, se desempeña en la venta de productos nutricionales por catálogo, en un principio puerta a puerta debido a que apenas está en crecimiento y comenzando a ganar clientela, su actividad la aprendió gracias a un amigo con el que trabaja y realiza sus ventas, el apoyo financiero solicitado es para la afiliación, fortalecimiento y compra de mercancía para su negocio con el que esperar tener grandes resultados y tener un modo de vida sostenible en el tiempo
texts.en:
She is 22 years old, lives with her family, and does not have children.  Her only ambition is to be someone in life, to earn her own income, and to help with the household expenses.  Her goal is to open her own store that sells nutritional products. Her main weakness is her lack of experience as a businesswoman given her youth.  However, she compensates for these shortcomings with her maturity and desire to be an entrepreneur.  

Her name is Grey.  She is 22 years old and is a member of this group of young entrepreneurs in Colombia that is growing everyday.  She works selling nutritional products from a catalog.  She started selling door-to-door because she is still growing and starting to gain a customer base.  She learned this business from a friend that she works with and makes her sales with.  

The financial support that she is seeking is for recruiting, strengthening and purchasing merchandise for her business.  With it, she hopes to have good results and have a sustainable lifestyle for the time being.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and strengthen her business, in order to attract a loyal client base

loans.name: Betania Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Betania de 25 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no se pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a  trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a sus esfuerzos y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica, venta de cilos metálicos, para almacenar granos básicos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias, ofreciendo sus servicios. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con más cilos para la venta. Betania agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Betania, age 25, is married and has a minor son.  She is from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the region.  She is known for being hard-working and responsible with the desire to improve.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources, she was not able to study for a career.  She had to start working at an early age in order to help with the household expenses.  She currently struggles day to day in order to provide her children with a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, her business activity is selling metal silos to store basic grains.  She spends eight hours a day on her business offering her services.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business with more silos to sell.  Betania is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of working.

loans.use: to buy and sell metal silos to store basic grains.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa tiene 27 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 2 años,   sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de cosméticos y  productos de belleza por catálogo lleva años con este negocio, ella entrega a distintos lugares oficinas y domicilios donde le hacen pedidos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, solicita el crédito para la compra de joya  que se encuentran e promoción al por mayor, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que ñle permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Elsa is 27, married with two children aged 2 and 4 years old. She is still selling cosmetics and beauty products from catalogs. She has been in this business for years. She delivers to different offices and homes who have requested goods. This loan is her first from this institution.

Elsa is requesting the loan to buy jewellery that is currently on promotion, wholesale. Her reason for requesting the loan is to increase her working capital and in this way improve the living standard of her family. She feels happy and grateful with the institution for the support offered as this is her only activity to support herself.

loans.use: to buy jewellery wholesale.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La Señora Silvia sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de su primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de mercadería,  ya que surtió su tienda que cada día está más surtida gracias a los créditos de Kiva , en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como refrescos por mayor  y así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Silvia continues in the same line of work, selling necessary home products out of her neighborhood store. She says it went very well for her with the previous loan, which she used to purchase merchandise.  Little by little, she is stocking her store, thanks to the loans she has gotten from Kiva. This loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise merchandise, such as sodas at wholesale. In this way, she will continue to improve her business and thus increase her economic income.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: La señora Lucy tiene 48 años casada con dos hijos de las edades de 4 años y 10 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de frutas naturales, ella vende sus productos en uno de los  mercados de la zona de Villa Bolívar, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Lucy va a usar este préstamo para compra de frutas por cambio de temporada al por mayor, la señora Lucy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia  ya que existen varias vendedoras de frutas por la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  frutas para ir mejorando su negocio  así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Lucy is 48 years old, and married with two children, ages 4 and 10.  She is engaged in selling natural fruits, and sells her product at one of the markets in the Villa Bolívar area.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution.  Lucy will use the loan to purchase wholesale fruit for the change of season.  Lucy faces challenges in her business because she has competition from several fruit vendors in the area.  She will use will use the profits to continue buying fruits to keep improving her business and thus generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fruits.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: El señor Raymundo es un socio muy exitoso en sus labores diarios, tiene la edad de 69 años y casado se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio, destinando una parte para la realización de nacatamales y el resto lo comercializa en el mercado de la municipalidad y en el mercado capitalino, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa para la elaboración de dichos productos y para la comercialización, el socio solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdo en pie y materia prima para los nacatamales como es la papa, arroz, hoja de chaguite, cebolla, chiltoma, maíz etc.,  este producto tiene una demanda amplia por lo que sus ganancias espera sean mayores.
texts.en:
Raymundo is very successful in his daily work.  He is 69 years old, married, and works butchering pigs in his home.  He uses some of his pork to make nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and he sells the rest in the local market and the market in the capital.  He counts on his wife's help to make the nacatamales and to sell them,  

The member is seeking a loan to purchase live pigs and raw materials to make nacatamales such as potatoes, rice, banana leaves, onions, bell peppers, corn, etc.  The nacatamales are in high demand, therefore he hopes to generate greater earnings.

loans.use: purchase live pigs and raw materials to make nacatamales (corn, bell peppers, onion, rice, potatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Francisca Ismelda

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito  Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 50 años de edad, está separada y de esta  relación tiene cinco hijos, cuatro mayores y la menor de 17 años que recién acaba sus estudios secundarios y es quien aun vive con ella. 
Doña Francisca para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto darle lo necesario a su hija hace dos años y con la ayuda de los créditos surtió en su casa una  pequeña tienda de víveres en el cual vende arroz, azúcar, legumbres y ciertas cosas de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00,  tiene clientes que siempre realizan sus compras en su tienda y son los que le permiten ganarse la vida con una actividad honesta y decente.
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar y otros víveres. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Picoaza” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, celebrating the traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and having a rich historical culture influenced by the surrounding mountains.

Sra. Francisca lives in this place. She is 50 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five children. Four of her children are grown. The youngest child, age 17, recently finished high school and still lives with her.

Doña Francisca has been earning a living for two years and this enables her to provide for her daughter’s needs. With the help of the loans, she has been able to restock the small grocery store in her house where she sells rice, sugar, legumes, and a few bazaar products. She works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. Francisca has customers who always buy from her store, so she is able to make an honest and decent living.

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, and other provisions. She has been with the Communal Bank for four years and enjoys being a member because the loans were used to start her business. Her dreams include having a shop in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other provisions.

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for nine years.

Thúy is 35 years old and married with two children. Thúy supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes to buy a cell phone, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anyelith Maria

texts.es: Anyelith de 23 años de edad habita al suroccidente de la ciudad con su pequeño hijo de un año de edad. Allí se dedica al oficio de confecciones, actividad que inició desde el año 2012, cuando su madrastra que practica esta actividad le propuso que se asociaran, para producir cubrelechos, sabanas y almohadas. Así lo hizo Anyelith y hoy  tiene una meta importante, que es la de ampliar su infraestructura comprando mas maquinarias. Ella vende de contado y a crédito, trabajando todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Sus compras las realiza de contado  en los almacenes del centro de la ciudad y sus clientes principales son los vecinos y referidos. Su mayor desafío aumentar la productividad las utilidades y ahorrar, porque tiene como propósito remodelar su vivienda.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina y materias primas para aumentar la producción y mejorar los acabados de la prenda.
texts.en:
Anyelith is 23 years old and lives in the southwestern section of the city with her one-year-old son. She is a seamstress and started in this line of work in 2012. Her stepmother suggested that she learn this skill so that she could produce comforters, bed sheets, and pillows. Anyelith followed her suggestion and now she has a major goal of expanding the infrastructure of her business by purchasing more machines.

She sells her products for cash and on credit. Anyelith works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. She buys her supplies with cash from the stores in the central part of the city. Her main customers consist of neighbors and referrals. Her greatest challenge is to increase her productivity, her profits, and her savings because she plans to remodel her house.

Anyelith is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy a machine and raw materials so that she can increase her production and improve the finishing touches on the goods she makes.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials.

loans.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es: Lester Antonio es un hombre muy trabajador y dispuesto a luchar por obtener mejores condiciones de vida, él anhela que sus hijos puedan nacer y desarrollarse en la casa que piensa construir con este crédito. Lester trabaja desde hace varios años como operario de la limpieza de la Alcaldía y expresa que este trabajo le permitirá construir su casa, la cual junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa podrán disfrutar y adornar. Él solicita el crédito para comprar los siguientes materiales de construcción piedras canteras, hierro, cemento, zinc, madera  y cubrir los gastos de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Lester Antonio is a very hard-working man who is willing to struggle in order to have better living conditions.  He wishes for his children to be able to be born and grow up in the house that he is planning to build with this loan.

He has worked as a cleaner for the mayor’s office for several years.  He states that this job will allow him to build his house.  He and his wife, a housewife, will be able to enjoy and decorate the house.

He is requesting to loan to buy the following construction materials: quarry stones, iron, cement, metal sheeting, and wood and to cover the labor costs.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones, iron, cement, metal sheeting, and wood and to cover the labor costs.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana tiene 48 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Ana se gana la vida por medio de la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento y grava dado que desea encementar el piso de la vivienda que actualmente es de tierra.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner. Ana has made a living through providing domestic services for a long time. She is a very hardworking woman and is dedicated to her family. 

With the desire to improve her living conditions she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of sand, cement, and gravel since she wants to cement the dirt floor in her home currently.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and gravel to cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Osmin Humberto

texts.es:
Osmin  de 67 años de edad, es un agricultor  que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, esta acompañado  la esposa se dedica a los oficios  domésticos, han  procreado 3  hijos solo uno está viviendo con él,  ya que los otros están en hogares apartes por lo tanto solo la esposa y el hijo dependen de él.

Osmin se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12  años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño  el papá que decidió enseñarle este trabajo, ya que es importante aprender a la agricultura que es algo que le va servir de mucho,  este trabajo lo tiene a una distancia de 30 minutos él viaja en la yegua que desde ya hace varios años la tiene; pero también Osmin se dedica a la ganadería,  ya que él tiene tres vacas que le están dando la leche y de ahí el vende la leche y queso fresco es la otra fuente de ingreso que tiene esto lo hace en un horario de las 6 am a las 12 mediodía.

Con el préstamo solicitado, pagara a personas que le ayuden a preparar el cerco del terreno donde va a cultivar y también esas personas le ayudaran a quitar el monte para que esté limpio cuando sea el tiempo de sembrar, ya que gracias a Dios siembra en terreno propio.
texts.en:
Osmin, age 67, is a farmer who did not have the opportunity to study. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores. They have three children, but only one is living with them. The others have their own families, so only his wife and his son are dependent on him.

Osmin has been farming since the age of 12. His father taught him this trade because he thought farming is an important skill that can be of great use. Osmin must travel 30 minutes on horseback before he can perform his work. He has already been doing this for several years. Osmin also raises cattle. He has three dairy cows that produce milk to sell and to use for making fresh cheese, which provides an additional source of income. His work schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 12:00 noon.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for people to put up a fence around his farmland. He will also pay these people to help with weed removal so that his land is clear in time for planting. Osmin is grateful to God that he plants on his own land.

loans.use: to pay for labor in order to put up a fence and to remove weeds from his farmland.

loans.name: Gladys Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vida Nueva se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar. 
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 7, 6 y 4 años y el menor de 10 meses de edad, los dos mayores  estudian  en escuela. El marido se trabaja en una fábrica. 
Doña Gladys es una muy buena ama de casa que además se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como muchines de yuca, empanadas, corviches, entre otros, además de jugos naturales, sodas, aguas y otras bebidas, ella tiene un pequeño local en las afueras de su casa en el cual todas las tardes y noches vende sus alimentos los cuales tienen mucha aceptación de sus clientes, lleva dos años con este negocio el cual le permite  salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, maní y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda para seguir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The loan group "Vida Nueva" (New Life) meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and dedicated to work at sea.

Señora Gladys lives in this place. She is 26 years old and maintains a free union relationship from which she has four children, ages 7, 6, 4, and 10 months. The two older ones are in school. Her husband works in a factory.

Doña Gladys is a very good housewife, who in addition prepares and sells snacks and fast food such as yucca fritters, empanadas, and corviches, among other items, in addition to selling natural juices, sodas, water, and other beverages. She has a little shop outside her house, where every afternoon and evening she sells her foods, which meet with much approval from her customers. She has had this business for two years, and it allows her to get ahead.

She is going to use this loan to buy oil, plantains, peanuts and other grocery items to prepare her foods. She has been in the loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because of the help [it provides] to continue advancing. Her dreams are to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy oil, plantains, peanuts, and other groceries

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима жительница района Вахш. Ей 65 лет. Халима веселая, жизнерадостная женщина с чувством юмора. Она замужем. Халима сильно любит своего мужа и растет с ним троих детей. У них два замечательных сына и одна дочка. Сыновья занимаются животноводством. Ее дочка Нигора занимается шитьем национальной одежды. Муж Халимы любит работать на огороде, следит, чтобы дети питались здоровой пищей. Халима с сыновьями наравне занимается скотоводством, выращивает крупнорогатых скотин. Она кормит, поит и ухаживает за ними. Халима просит кредит, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота. Она надеется, что с увеличением количество скота увеличится и доход от деятельности. С такими намерениями она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Halima is 65 and lives in the Vakhsh district. She is a lively and cheerful woman with a sense of humor. She is married and loves her husband and their three children very much. She has two wonderful sons and one daughter. Her sons raise livestock and her daughter sews traditional dresses. Her husband likes to work in the garden and make sure that the children eat healthy food. Halima and her sons raise cattle together. She cares for the cattle and gives them food and water. Halima is requesting a loan to buy more cattle. She hopes that she will earn a larger income with more cattle, which is why she applied for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Mercedes Rosario

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vida Nueva se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijas de 21, 17, 13 y 10 años, las tres menores  estudian en colegio y escuela y son las que aun viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta con su esfuerzo ayudarle  a su marido a sobrellevar la carga del hogar, ella trabaja de lunes  a viernes en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta pero para ganar algo extra también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo. Ella aprovecha los días y horas libres que tiene para ir a vender sus prendas y también les vende a sus compañeros de trabajo, les deja a crédito y les cobra por quincena, este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Vida Nueva” [New Life] Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton, an area known for its beautiful beaches.  Here, most of the residents are very hardworking and engaged in sea jobs.

Mercedes lives in this area.  She is 48 years old, married, and has four children, ages 21, 17, 13, and 10.  The three youngest attend school and are still living with her.  Her husband is engaged in fishing.

Mercedes is a hardworking woman who enjoys making the effort to help her husband bear the household burden.  She works from Monday to Friday at a factory in Manta but in order to earn something extra, she is also engaged in selling all kinds of clothing.  She takes advantage of her free days and hours to sell her clothing and also sells it to her coworkers. She extends them credit and collects payments bi-weekly.  She started this business with the first loan that she received from the group, and she is very grateful for it. 

The purpose of this loan is to purchase all kinds of clothing.  She has belonged to the communal bank from the beginning and enjoys it because this was how she started her business.  Her dream is to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to purchae clothing.

loans.name: María Annabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vida Nueva que se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2  años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una fábrica. 
Doña María es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad la cual comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo y  le permite ganar algo para el bienestar de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y bisutería. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The credit group “Vida Nueva” (“New Life”) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo, a place is known for its beautiful beaches. Here the majority of the inhabitants are hard-working and make a living working at sea. This is where Mary, 26, lives. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children ages 6 and 2, the oldest of which studies in school. Her husband works in a factory.

Doña Maria is a homemaker who sells shoes and jewelry to make her own living and thereby help her husband with household expenses. She sells door to door and works three days a week, two to three hours a day. She sells her products on credit and charges every eight days. She has been working in this business for a year. It began with the first loan she received from the group and has enabled her to earn money for her children’s well-being.

This loan is to buy shoes and jewelry. This is her third cycle in the credit group, and she likes it because payments are easy to make. Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Ramona Maribel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vida Nueva se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ramona, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, dos mayores y dos de 16 y 13 años que son los que aun viven con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Ramona es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo. Su forma  de venta es puerta a puerta  y trabaja todos los días, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella aprovecha para vender sus productos a los pescadores cuando  llegan a la playa. Este negocio lo comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que gracias a esto salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Vida Nueva communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches.  Most of the inhabitants are very hard-workers and devote themselves to work at sea.

Ramona, age 45, lives in this place.  She is married, and they have four children.  Two of the children are grown, and the other two are 16 and 13.  The younger two still live with her.  Her husband does not work do to his health.

Ramona is a housewife who sells all types of clothes in order to get her own resources and use them to get ahead.  She sells door to door, and she works every day.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects every eight days.  She benefits by selling her products to the fishermen when they arrive on the beach.  She started this business with the first loan that she received.  Therefore, she is very grateful.  Thanks to this they are getting ahead.

This loan is to buy all types of clothes.  She is the founder of her communal bank.  She likes it because of the help she gets with the loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: 10-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Đỡ has a retail business selling dry food; she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Đỡ is 64 years old, and she is single with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Đỡ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Đỡ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Đỡ is the group leader of the 10-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food to sell.

The main hardship that Đỡ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to sell

loans.name: Estrellas Del Paraiso  (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Estrellas Del Paraíso se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Paraíso en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Este es un grupo de 10 mujeres y 4 hombres que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir mucho ya que con los créditos van a mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, venta de comida, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Aracely, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 18, 16, 14 y 6 años, todos estudia en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es pescador.
Doña Aracely con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta para poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan  sus clientes. Trabaja por ratos cuando está desocupada, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su familia a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas. Este es su primer ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Estrellas del Paraíso Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the El Paraíso neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city's known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round, for being an incomparably beautiful city, and for its tourist attractions.

This group is made up of ten women and four men who decided to get together and start a communal bank.  It's going to help them a lot because they're going to improve their small businesses with the loans.  The earn a living with a variety of jobs, including general sales, food sales, and services.

Aracely, 35, is one of the members of this group.  She's in a common-law relationship from which she has four children, ages 18, 16, 14, and 6, all of whom are college, high school, or elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Aracely wants to earn money on her own so she can get ahead in the household.  She earns a living selling all types of clothing.  She sells door-to-door as well as at home, where her customers visit her.  She works when she's not busy.  She leaves clothing with her customers on credit and charges every two weeks.  She has been doing this job for three years and it helps her family get ahead.

She's going to use this loan to buy more merchandise: pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other garments.

This is Aracely's first loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help she gets with the loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other garments

loans.name: Irma Janneth

texts.es: Irma tiene 30 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 10 y un años de edad. Irma y su compañero de vida trabajan muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar y juntos van sacando adelante a su familia. Irma se dedica a la venta de fruta partida en el mercado de su localidad. Con el fin de brindar mejores condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos puesto que desea repara el techo de un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en: Irma, 30, lives in her own house with her life partner and two children, ages 1 and 10. She and her life partner work very hard to sustain their household. Together, they provide for their family. Irma makes a living selling chopped fruit at a local market. In order to provide her family with better living conditions, she has decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, wood, and nails as she would like to repair the roof over a room in her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails to repair the roof over a room in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase assorted goods such as school bags, jeans and mobile phones.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Isatu. She is single and has three children, aged 17, 14 and 11 years, all are school-going children. 

In 2008, Isatu established her household wares and clothing business. She began her business, but has not opened a boutique, as planned.  Her business is improving. She bought a refrigerator for her beverage business that she has introduced. She is able to pay her children's fees and she bought a large television set.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 4,930,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Isatu has already received and successfully repaid four loans and now she requires a new loan in order to buy pieces of African-made clothing and food flasks. 

In the future, Isatu plans to use the entire loan on goods as the holidays are fast approaching. The loan has helped to improve her family and social status.  She is hard-working and committed to her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase African-made clothing and food flasks.

loans.name: Rimen Yoel

texts.es:
Rimen Yoel tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, una bebida tradicional de la sierra del Perú, su elaboración se realiza en base al proceso artesanal mediante el trapiche, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de caña de azúcar materia prima para la elaboración de aguardiente y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rimen Yoel, 22, lives with his wife and children in the district of Callayuc, a community which is dedicated to agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Rimen Yoel makes a living distilling aguardiente, a traditional liquor from the Peruvian mountains. He makes this liquor through an artisanal process using a "trapiche" sugar mill. He has applied for a loan of 3,000 Peruvian new soles to buy a larger quantity of sugar cane, which is the raw material he uses to make aguardiente. He will then earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of raw sugarcane to make aguardiente.
